Title: PowerBI Consultant
Description:
PowerBI Consultant




Jij kan als geen ander op een vertellende manier informatie zo presenteren dat het maximaal impact maakt. Elk dashboard dat jij oplevert beantwoord de gestelde vragen en het liefst met zo min mogelijk toeters en bellen. Jij bent nieuwsgierig als het gaat om technologie en werkt graag samen met ervaren (technische) BI-collega’s om jou als consultant vakinhoudelijk verder te ontwikkelen. Zie jij jezelf al starten in deze rol? Lees snel verder!




Het Business Intelligence team van McCoy & Partners is met 24+ consultants één van de grotere Business Units. Een divers en hecht team. Wij doen aan onvoorwaardelijk kennisdeling en kennen geen functieprofielen zoals Junior, Medior of Senior. Iedereen heeft zijn eigen expertise, de lijntjes zijn kort en er is vrijheid. Elk persoon is een puzzelstukje op zichzelf. Uniek en onmisbaar voor het leggen van de gehele puzzel.




Het volgende puzzelstukje

Wij zijn op zoek naar het volgende puzzelstukje die ons team kan aanvullen. Jij gaat starten als Power BI consultant bij één van onze (inter)nationale klanten. Jij zit samen met andere BI-collega’s op een project en bent de expert als het gaat om de ontsluiting van data richting PowerBI. Op SAP gebied word jij vakinhoudelijk begeleidt door een van onze ervaren consultants. Daarnaast helpt een coach jou verder in je persoonlijke ontwikkeling.




Naast het goede werk dat jij gaat doen bij onze klanten, ben jij één van de personen die samen met onze functionele Business Units (o.a. Finance, HRx, SCM) dashboards gaat ontwikkelen voor hun specifieke processen. Met als doel de dashboards als propositie aan te bieden op de markt. Kers op de taart is wanneer jij jouw eigen dashboard mag gaan implementeren bij de klant!




Dit maakt ons BI-zonder

Als Business Intelligence team hebben wij goede langdurige klantrelaties. Hierdoor zijn er altijd mogelijkheden te creëren om je als PowerBI consultant verder te blijven ontwikkelen. Zowel op het technisch als functioneel gebied.




Daarnaast heeft McCoy & Partners alle functionele expertise in huis. Van Finance tot HR. Het Business Intelligence team is nauw betrokken bij productimplementaties zoals S/4, EWM en SuccessFactors. Dit betekent dat onze expertise vaak nodig is in (pre-)sales trajecten en wij een prominente plek innemen in het geheel.




Heb jij als consultant genoeg van PowerBI en wil je doorgroeien naar Business Analist? Of ga je liever aan de slag met Snowflake? Dat kan!




Dit krijg je bij ons




Jouw werk wordt beloond. Naast een goed salaris op basis van jouw ervaring en kennis voorzien we jou van een goed voorwaardenpakket waar je blij van wordt.




Dertig vakantiedagen
Geen concurrentiebeding en geen proeftijd.
Een nettobedrag van 2350 euro voor het aanschaffen van een laptop, telefoon en/of de inrichting van jouw thuiskantoor
Een mobiliteitsvergoeding of de mogelijkheid om een auto (incl. brandstof) en/of fiets te leasen;
Direct een vast contract bij indiensttreding;
De mogelijkheid om mede-eigenaar te worden van McCoy met de McCoins
Onkostenvergoeding van 60 euro netto per maand;
Gratis opleidingen via McAdemy;
Ieder jaar een eindgesprek waarin we jouw groei bespreken en dit ook in het salaris doorvoeren
Een bonus op basis van persoonlijk- en bedrijfsresultaat (ongeveer 1,5 maandsalaris).




Kop koffie?




Minimaal een afgeronde HBO opleiding
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met PowerBI
Ervaring met Data Storytelling
Ervaring met SAC Analytics Cloud is een pre
Vind het uitdagend om technische vaardigheden te verbeteren
Gelooft in onze 'More Than BI' gedachtengoed




Ben jij het missende puzzelstukje waar wij naar op zoek zijn? Dan zouden wij je graag eens willen spreken!




Over McCoy




Wij zijn McCoy, dé onafhankelijke SAP-partner van Nederland. Sinds onze oprichting in 2012 zijn we uitgegroeid tot een team van ruim 300 medewerkers. Bij ons draait het niet alleen om IT-oplossingen, maar om jou en jouw behoeften. Wij brengen de ‘soft’ terug in software, omdat we geloven dat de kracht van technologie pas echt tot zijn recht komt wanneer het mensen slimmer laat werken en plezier in hun werk geeft. Ervaar zelf wat “Work smart. Be happy.” écht betekent!




Onze cultuur




McCoy is een Great Place to Work, letterlijk, en behoort tot de top 40 beste werkgevers van Nederland. We zijn een zelfstandig bedrijf en worden geleid door en zijn eigendom van de mensen die er werken. Hierdoor ontstaan teams vanuit ondernemerschap, gebaseerd op ideeën of technologieën van consultants. We nemen beslissingen op basis van expertise, in plaats van hiërarchie.

Show more

PowerBI Consultant


Jij kan als geen ander op een vertellende manier informatie zo presenteren dat het maximaal impact maakt. Zie jij jezelf al starten in deze rol? Lees snel verder!


Het Business Intelligence team van McCoy & Partners is met 24+ consultants één van de grotere Business Units. Een divers en hecht team. Wij doen aan onvoorwaardelijk kennisdeling en kennen geen functieprofielen zoals Junior, Medior of Senior. Iedereen heeft zijn eigen expertise, de lijntjes zijn kort en er is vrijheid. Elk persoon is een puzzelstukje op zichzelf. Uniek en onmisbaar voor het leggen van de gehele puzzel.


Het volgende puzzelstukje

Wij zijn op zoek naar het volgende puzzelstukje die ons team kan aanvullen. Jij gaat starten als Power BI consultant bij één van onze (inter)nationale klanten. Jij zit samen met andere BI-collega’s op een project en bent de expert als het gaat om de ontsluiting van data richting PowerBI. Op SAP gebied word jij vakinhoudelijk begeleidt door een van onze ervaren consultants. Daarnaast helpt een coach jou verder in je persoonlijke ontwikkeling.


Naast het goede werk dat jij gaat doen bij onze klanten, ben jij één van de personen die samen met onze functionele Business Units (o.a. Finance, HRx, SCM) dashboards gaat ontwikkelen voor hun specifieke processen. Met als doel de dashboards als propositie aan te bieden op de markt. Kers op de taart is wanneer jij jouw eigen dashboard mag gaan implementeren bij de klant!


Dit maakt ons BI-zonder

Als Business Intelligence team hebben wij goede langdurige klantrelaties. Hierdoor zijn er altijd mogelijkheden te creëren om je als PowerBI consultant verder te blijven ontwikkelen. Zowel op het technisch als functioneel gebied.


Daarnaast heeft McCoy & Partners alle functionele expertise in huis. Van Finance tot HR. Het Business Intelligence team is nauw betrokken bij productimplementaties zoals S/4, EWM en SuccessFactors. Dit betekent dat onze expertise vaak nodig is in (pre-)sales trajecten en wij een prominente plek innemen in het geheel.


Heb jij als consultant genoeg van PowerBI en wil je doorgroeien naar Business Analist? Of ga je liever aan de slag met Snowflake? Dat kan!


Dit krijg je bij ons


Jouw werk wordt beloond. Naast een goed salaris op basis van jouw ervaring en kennis voorzien we jou van een goed voorwaardenpakket waar je blij van wordt.


  • Dertig vakantiedagen
  • Geen concurrentiebeding en geen proeftijd.
  • Een nettobedrag van 2350 euro voor het aanschaffen van een laptop, telefoon en/of de inrichting van jouw thuiskantoor
  • Een mobiliteitsvergoeding of de mogelijkheid om een auto (incl. brandstof) en/of fiets te leasen;
  • Direct een vast contract bij indiensttreding;
  • De mogelijkheid om mede-eigenaar te worden van McCoy met de McCoins
  • Onkostenvergoeding van 60 euro netto per maand;
  • Gratis opleidingen via McAdemy;
  • Ieder jaar een eindgesprek waarin we jouw groei bespreken en dit ook in het salaris doorvoeren
  • Een bonus op basis van persoonlijk- en bedrijfsresultaat (ongeveer 1,5 maandsalaris).


Kop koffie?


  • Minimaal een afgeronde HBO opleiding
  • Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met PowerBI
  • Ervaring met Data Storytelling
  • Ervaring met SAC Analytics Cloud is een pre
  • Vind het uitdagend om technische vaardigheden te verbeteren
  • Gelooft in onze 'More Than BI' gedachtengoed


Ben jij het missende puzzelstukje waar wij naar op zoek zijn? Dan zouden wij je graag eens willen spreken!


Over McCoy


Wij zijn McCoy, dé onafhankelijke SAP-partner van Nederland. Sinds onze oprichting in 2012 zijn we uitgegroeid tot een team van ruim 300 medewerkers. Bij ons draait het niet alleen om IT-oplossingen, maar om jou en jouw behoeften. Wij brengen de ‘soft’ terug in software, omdat we geloven dat de kracht van technologie pas echt tot zijn recht komt wanneer het mensen slimmer laat werken en plezier in hun werk geeft. Ervaar zelf wat “Work smart. Be happy.” écht betekent!


Onze cultuur


McCoy is een Great Place to Work, letterlijk, en behoort tot de top 40 beste werkgevers van Nederland. We zijn een zelfstandig bedrijf en worden geleid door en zijn eigendom van de mensen die er werken. Hierdoor ontstaan teams vanuit ondernemerschap, gebaseerd op ideeën of technologieën van consultants. We nemen beslissingen op basis van expertise, in plaats van hiërarchie.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Over The Member Company







We are a global high-tech consultancy company with a team of entrepreneurial engineers, scientists, and digital experts from around the world. Together we form a fast-growing and proud community. We offer consultancy services to high-profile clients globally in diverse service areas, such as:







About this vacancy




As a Data Analyst at TMC Data Science, you will transform raw data into actionable insights that guide strategic decision-making. You will create dashboards and visualizations that simplify complex data and support innovation through trend analysis and forecasting.







Key Responsibiliies




Analyze data to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities.
Develop intuitive dashboards and reports for stakeholders.
Conduct trend analysis and create predictive models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business.
Present findings in a clear and impactful manner.




hat we expect from you?

Bachelor’s or Msc degree in Data Science, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related fields.
3-5 years of experience in data analysis or business intelligence.
Proficiency in visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
Strong analytical and communication skills.
Knowledge of the high-tech industry is a plus.




What you can expect you

TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.




At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.




As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.

Title: Medior/Senior Data Analyst
Description:
How do you delight our customers?

At bol.com, we are dedicated to making daily life more convenient for our over 13 million customers. As a Data Analyst within the Customer & Marketing domain, you’ll play a critical role in analyzing customer behavior, uncovering insights and opportunities for improvement, and ultimately driving customer loyalty. You’ll work closely with the rest of our Customer Analytics team to understand customer needs, evaluate the effectiveness of our marketing efforts, and identify new opportunities to enhance the customer experience.

Do you enjoy solving complex puzzles in the customer and marketing domain? Are you passionate about using data to drive business decisions? Do you have a strong affinity for data, experience with SQL, and a desire to dive into all the data bol has to offer? Or are you looking for your next challenge after 3-7 years as a data analyst? Join our team at bol as a Data Analyst in the Customer & Marketing domain!

What you do as a Data Analyst Customer & Marketing?

You’ll join a group of data professionals in the Customer Analytics team, that aims to make people, programs, and products in the customer and marketing organization more performant through data. This job is for the versatile analyst, one that is equally comfortable talking to data as to stakeholders. Your days vary but at the core you’ll use SQL/Tableau/dbt/git to provide metrics, datasets, analysis, and predictions that help the business make better decisions.

You’ll collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to understand business needs, identify key performance metrics, and develop and deliver reports and dashboards that track performance and drive continuous improvement. Additionally, you’ll play a critical role in identifying and evaluating new data sources, tools, and techniques that can help us better understand our customers and improve our marketing efforts.

Some Specific Responsibilities Include


Analyzing customer behavior and identifying key drivers of customer loyalty and marketing effectiveness. You'll use your analytical skills to uncover patterns and insights in our data that help us understand what drives customer loyalty and makes our marketing more effective, and you'll work with the rest of the Customer Analytics team to translate those insights into recommendations for improving the customer experience.
Develop, implement, and test marketing experiments across channels to improve marketing efficiency and ROI. Focussing on incremental result insights through experiments will enable the performance teams to improve their ROIs. You’ll be responsible for developing the test setup, the required data and evaluating the tests, in close collaboration with product and marketing teams.
Developing high-quality data pipelines for dashboarding and KPIs. You'll work with our analytical engineers to create robust, efficient data pipelines using dbt, ensuring that the data we use for reporting and analysis is accurate, complete, and up-to-date.
Analyzing & prepping datasets for marketing efficiency and customer propositions. You'll work with our marketing teams to analyze the effectiveness of our marketing efforts, using data to identify opportunities for marketing channels (like e-mail or push messages) and customer propositions (like Select)
Writing high-quality and easily interpretable SQL code that can be reused. You'll use your SQL skills to query large, complex datasets, extracting the data needed to answer key business questions. You'll also ensure that your SQL code is reusable, well-documented, and easily interpretable by other members of the team.
You'll work closely with stakeholders across the organization, using your data expertise to help guide decision-making processes and ensure that data-driven insights are at the forefront of our business strategy. You'll also represent the data perspective in cross-functional discussions, ensuring that our decisions are based on the best available information.
In this role, you'll have the opportunity to work with a variety of data sources and tools, and to collaborate closely with stakeholders across the organization. You'll be at the forefront of our efforts to understand and delight our customers, and you'll play a critical role in driving business impact through data-driven insights and recommendations.


Why you can make the difference?

You’re an enthusiastic team player who lives and breathes analytics. The ideal candidate for this role has a strong analytical mindset, a passion for customer-centricity, and excellent communication and collaboration skills. You have experience working with SQL and dashboarding tools like Tableau/Looker Studio and are comfortable navigating and analyzing large, complex datasets. You’re also able to work effectively with cross-functional teams, and have a knack for translating complex data insights into clear, actionable recommendations.

3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out


- Discomfort working with data on a daily basis This role requires a strong analytical mindset and a willingness to work with large, complex datasets.
- Prefer working independently over collaborating with others This role involves working closely with stakeholders across different teams and functions, so strong communication and collaboration skills are essential.
- Lacking the technical skills required for the role You will be responsible for building data pipelines, creating dashboards, and conducting advanced analyses to drive business impact. If you are not open to getting technical and enjoy working more on the business side of things, this may not be the ideal fit for you.
+ A passion for data-driven problem solving and collaboration. You love working with data and are passionate about using data to drive business impact. You enjoy digging into complex datasets and using your analytical skills to uncover insights that help drive decision-making.
+ You enjoy collaborating with stakeholders across different teams and functions. You're a strong communicator who can translate technical information into non-technical language, and you enjoy working with others to drive projects forward.
+ Strong commitment to delivering high-quality analytics that drive business impact. You understand that data-driven insights are only valuable when they are accurate, reliable, and actionable. You are always striving for excellence in your work and take pride in the impact your insights have on the business.


This is where you’ll work

Your new role will be part of the Customer Analytics team at bol.com, where you will collaborate with 6+ talented analytics professionals. Together, you will support a variety of teams across Product, Marketing, Strategy, and Finance, driving customer loyalty, growth, and profit for the company. The Customer Analytics team has a rich history at bol, and has built a modern data stack on the Google Cloud Platform, including technologies like BigQuery, Git, Airflow, dbt, and Tableau, as well as a range of Python libraries that enable advanced analytics. You’ll be joining a team that is passionate about data and committed to quality, using cutting-edge tools and techniques to drive meaningful insights and business impact.

It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about bridging the gap between business needs and IT data solutions? Do you enjoy translating business needs into actionable insights through tools in BI and reporting? Are you excited about joining a new, innovative role in an international environment where your advice will drive impactful change?

We are expanding our Data team! In this exciting new role, you will play a key part in driving value for our organization by acting as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions, specializing in the Business Intelligence (BI) and Reporting domain. This is a unique opportunity to shape your role, taking on significant responsibility and making a direct impact on the business. You will advise and implement strong technical solutions, contributing to the growth and success of the organization.

What makes this role even more exciting is the diversity of your stakeholders: ranging from headquarters to regional teams and local businesses. You will be involved in innovative projects, taking on new challenges that offer great opportunities for personal and professional growth.

We are looking for a talented new colleague to join us as our next:

Data Analyst

In this role you will be part of a talented and skilled data team. You will report to the Lead BI and EAI and collaborate closely with various stakeholders across our dynamic and growing company.

The tasks and responsibilities are:


Collaboration with business stakeholders for the definition and establishment of KPIs, metrics, and analytical requirements.
Translation of complex data requirements into clear, actionable recommendations for the business.
Coordination with Data Engineering teams for smooth workflow and data integration.
Design and development of automated reports and dashboards using Power BI.
Analysis of large datasets for the identification of trends, patterns, and insights for decision-making.
Assurance of data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across all reports.
Streamlining of processes for data collection and reporting.
Training and support for teams in the use of reports and dashboards.
Presentation of findings and insights to senior management and stakeholders.



About You


We are looking for a data wizard with strong business and people skills with the following background and experience:
You have at least a Bachelor degree in IT, Data science or a related field.
At least 4 years of working experience in a Data/Business Analyst or similar role.
Strong proficiency and interest in SQL & Python for querying, data extraction, and analysis.
Expertise in data visualization and reporting tools, particularly Power BI.
Experience with Agile/Scrum teams and working with SAP ECC or SAP S4HANA is a plus.
Excellent proficiency in the English language, both spoken and written.
You are strong in ‘translating’ technical data to non-technical teams and the other way around.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
You are data savvy, pragmatic and enjoy to work with different various and international stakeholders.



What We Offer


A competitive reward package, including bonus eligibility.
A collaborative, international, and commercial environment where you can make a meaningful impact.
Opportunities for continuous professional development and growth.
A dynamic team culture that values integrity, efficiency, and open communication.



We are the creator of drinks. We take great pride in creating world-class beverages, partnering with top retailers and brands across Europe, North America, and Australia to produce drinks that you love every day.

Do you want to see your drinks on every table? Do you want to join our exciting journey?

 

Recruitment process

Are you interested in this open position, feel free to send your application!

In case of any questions with regards to the position, you may reach out to Yasimin Harput (Corporate Recruiter Group/HQ)

Phone: 010 440 5100

E-mail: yasimin.harput@refresco.com

Additionally: we have great pleasure in getting in touch with potential new employees directly. For this reason we are fully managing the search for this role in-house and will not be needing any external assistance (agencies e.g.).

Title: Analytics and Insights Internship
Description:
As an Analytics & Insights Intern at Armada Music, you’ll work closely with our Analytics & Insights team, while also supporting the Marketing team with data-driven strategies. You’ll dive into streaming and audience data, track artist and campaign performance, and help enhance internal reporting tools. This internship is perfect for someone with a strong analytical mindset, a passion for music, and an interest in how data fuels both artist development and marketing strategy in today’s music industry.




What You’ll Do

Work with large datasets from streaming platforms, social media, and internal sources to analyze artist, track, and campaign performance.
Write and optimize SQL queries to extract insights, automate reporting, and improve data visibility.
Help track KPIs across streaming, playlisting, audience growth, and campaign effectiveness.
Support predictive and trend analysis to uncover growth opportunities and marketing impact.
Segment audiences and develop listener insights to inform marketing and promotional strategies.
Present findings through clear, insightful reports and visualizations for the A&R, Marketing, Digital, and Catalog teams.




Who You Are

Currently enrolled in or recently completed a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Marketing Analytics, or a related field.
Proficient in Excel and SQL, with experience working with large datasets.
Comfortable with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or Google Data Studio) and storytelling with data.
Strong analytical thinker with great attention to detail and a proactive, problem-solving attitude.
Passionate about music and how data can influence decision-making across the industry.
Based in (or within commuting distance of) Amsterdam and enrolled at a Dutch university for the duration of the internship (starting April 2025).

Bonus Skills (Nice to Have)

Experience with Python or R for data analysis and automation.
Familiarity with music and marketing data sources (Spotify for Artists, Chartmetric, Meta Ads, Google Analytics).
Understanding of API integrations for data extraction and automation.




What You’ll Get in Return

Hands-on experience in analytics and business intelligence in the music industry.
Access to real-world data and collaboration with key teams like A&R, Marketing, Digital, and Catalog.
A fast-paced, open, and creative working environment at one of the world’s leading dance music labels.
Skill development in SQL, forecasting, and data storytelling.
A unique opportunity to contribute directly to artist development and marketing decisions.




About Armada

Armada Music is the biggest independent dance music label in the world, founded in 2003 by Armin van Buuren, Maykel Piron and David Lewis (AR-MA-DA). Promoting dance music all over the world from its offices in Amsterdam (HQ), New York and London, Armada Music represents and cultivates the creative exploits of some of the biggest players in the electronic music game, including Armin van Buuren, Lilly Palmer, D.O.D, Hannah Laing, ARTY, Audien, Giorgia Angiuli, Yulia Niko, Brando, Cat Dealers, Loud Luxury, Tensnake, Eelke Kleijn, Jan Blomqvist, Joris Voorn, KI/KI, Sunnery James & Ryan Marciano and THEMBA.

  • Currently enrolled in or recently completed a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Marketing Analytics, or a related field.
  • Proficient in Excel and SQL, with experience working with large datasets.
  • Comfortable with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or Google Data Studio) and storytelling with data.
  • Strong analytical thinker with great attention to detail and a proactive, problem-solving attitude.
  • Passionate about music and how data can influence decision-making across the industry.
  • Based in (or within commuting distance of) Amsterdam and enrolled at a Dutch university for the duration of the internship (starting April 2025).

Bonus Skills (Nice to Have)

  • Experience with Python or R for data analysis and automation.
  • Familiarity with music and marketing data sources (Spotify for Artists, Chartmetric, Meta Ads, Google Analytics).
  • Understanding of API integrations for data extraction and automation.


What You’ll Get in Return

  • Hands-on experience in analytics and business intelligence in the music industry.
  • Access to real-world data and collaboration with key teams like A&R, Marketing, Digital, and Catalog.
  • A fast-paced, open, and creative working environment at one of the world’s leading dance music labels.
  • Skill development in SQL, forecasting, and data storytelling.
  • A unique opportunity to contribute directly to artist development and marketing decisions.


About Armada

Armada Music is the biggest independent dance music label in the world, founded in 2003 by Armin van Buuren, Maykel Piron and David Lewis (AR-MA-DA). Promoting dance music all over the world from its offices in Amsterdam (HQ), New York and London, Armada Music represents and cultivates the creative exploits of some of the biggest players in the electronic music game, including Armin van Buuren, Lilly Palmer, D.O.D, Hannah Laing, ARTY, Audien, Giorgia Angiuli, Yulia Niko, Brando, Cat Dealers, Loud Luxury, Tensnake, Eelke Kleijn, Jan Blomqvist, Joris Voorn, KI/KI, Sunnery James & Ryan Marciano and THEMBA.

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Bedrijfsomschrijving

Een positieve toekomst voor iedereen, daar werken we bij Sopra Steria aan. Met meer dan 56.000 collega’s in 30 landen zijn we Europa’s toonaangevende aanbieder van digitale oplossingen. Wij geloven dat het niet alleen technologie is die transformatie aandrijft, maar dat mensen de kern vormen van verandering. Daarom staan mensen centraal in alles wat we doen, zowel individueel als in teamverband. De wereld is hoe we haar vormgeven. Laten we haar samen vormgeven.

Vacatureomschrijving

Als BI Consultant help je onze klanten complexe data-uitdagingen op te lossen. Je verzamelt data uit verschillende bronnen, optimaliseert datasets voor visualisatie en ontwikkelt inzichtelijke en gebruiksvriendelijke dashboards.

Met behulp van je eigen expertise en de design-thinking methodologie van Sopra Steria, verhoog je de kwaliteit van rapportages en visualisaties bij onze klanten. De "actionable insights" uit de rapporten en visualisaties helpen de klanten om de juiste strategische, tactische en operationele beslissingen te nemen.

Naast de waardevolle bijdrage die je levert aan de klant, draag je ook bij aan de visie en ontwikkeling van de praktijk en de eenheid.

Functie-eisen

Wij zijn op zoek naar gepassioneerde collega’s die graag de grenzen verleggen op het gebied van digitale transformatie en technologieconsultancy. Bij Sopra Steria krijg je de kans om je vaardigheden verder te ontwikkelen in een constructieve, samenwerkende teamomgeving, waarbij je werkt aan impactvolle projecten die verandering teweegbrengen voor onze klanten. Als je gedijt op uitdagingen en (de meeste van) de onderstaande kwalificaties bezit, kijken we uit naar je sollicitatie!

Type dienstverband: Hybride

Locatie: Nieuwegein

Aantal uren: 32-40 uur werkweek

Contracttype: Vast

Opleiding: Je hebt een HBO- of WO-opleiding afgerond in de richting van IT

Talen: Nederlands (vereist) en Engels

Je hebt kennis en ervaring van de volgende zaken:


vanaf ongeveer 3jaar ervaring met ten minste één van de volgende tools en kunt dit aantonen via je portfolio of certificaten:
o Power BI
o Tableau
o Qlik
o D3.js
Ervaring met het optimaliseren van de prestaties van dashboards
Creatief, maar pragmatisch met oog voor detail
Kennis van best practices en visuele ontwerpprincipes
Kennis van programmeertalen zoals JavaScript, Python, C# is een voordeel
Kennis en gevoel voor UX-design is een extra pluspunt
Je geniet ervan om expert te zijn en collega's en klanten te coachen
Je kunt gemakkelijk communiceren, zowel met je collega’s als met de klant en eindgebruikers van je visualisaties
Het toevoegen van je dashboards of portfolio aan de sollicitatie is een voordeel


Aanvullende informatie

Als onderdeel van een van Europa’s grootste aanbieders van digitale oplossingen profiteer je van uitgebreide carrièremogelijkheden, zowel lokaal als internationaal. Bij de Sopra Steria Academy maak je deel uit van een dynamisch netwerk van 56.000 professionals in verschillende stadia van hun loopbaan. Je wordt onderdeel van een toonaangevende techspeler in Europa, erkend voor zijn consultancy, digitale diensten en softwareontwikkeling.

Binnen de area Data creëren wij duurzame waarde bij onze klanten op het gebied van data. Wij helpen bedrijven om wendbaar te blijven in de transitie door data en techniek onderdeel te laten zijn van zowel de dagelijkse operatie als de strategische besluitvorming. Hiermee helpen wij onze klanten de verandering voor te zijn met behulp van data. Het is onze ambitie om organisaties te laten excelleren met data. Je werkt in een hightech omgeving met focus op kennis en innovatie, een open no-nonsense bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor eigen initiatief. De area bestaat uit 5 practices: Data Governance & Data Management, Data Visualisation, Data Science & AI, Data Engineering & Data Migrations en Spatial Intelligence. Elk met een duidelijke signatuur en focus op inhoud en bijbehorende solution. Binnen deze area zijn ruim 170 professionals werkzaam in een voor hen logische en passende vakinhoudelijke practice.

Onze medewerkers staan bekend om hun gedurfde keuzes en het leveren van resultaten. Werk samen met hooggekwalificeerde professionals die voorop lopen in bedrijfs-softwareoplossingen en innovatie bij Europa's toonaangevende aanbieder van digitale diensten.

Wij bieden een aantrekkelijk arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket, waaronder:


Locatie onafhankelijk en flexibel werken;
Onbeperkte ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden;
Een laptop, telefoon en thuiskantoor;
Een aantrekkelijk salaris;
Keuze tussen een bedrijfsauto of een mobiliteitsbudget;
De mogelijkheid om je eigen voordelen aan te passen via Flex Benefits:
Vakantiegeld en winstdeling;
27 verlofdagen (20 wettelijke en 7 bovenwettelijke vakantiedagen).

______

Sopra Steria is een werkgever die gelijke kansen biedt. Alle gekwalificeerde sollicitanten worden in aanmerking genomen voor een job zonder rekening te houden met leeftijd, afkomst, nationaliteit, huidskleur, verlof voor familie- of medische zorg, geslachtsidentiteit of -uitdrukking, genetische informatie, immigratiestatus, burgerlijke staat, medische toestand, nationale herkomst, fysieke of mentale handicap, politieke voorkeur, beschermde veteranen- of militaire status, ras, etniciteit, religie, geslacht (inclusief zwangerschap), seksuele geaardheid of enig ander kenmerk dat wordt beschermd door toepasselijke lokale wetten, voorschriften en verordeningen. We koesteren een werkomgeving die inclusief is en alle verschillen respecteert.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
This is not a coffee-fetching internship. This is a high-responsibility, high-learning role at the heart of a fast-growing startup where data drives every decision. You’ll work directly with our CTO and Founders to turn millions of data points into insights that shape the future of travel connectivity.




Company Description:

Hubby eSIM is a fast-scaling travel technology startup redefining how travelers stay connected. We partner with the world’s leading tour operators, airlines, and OTAs to deliver seamless mobile data in 190+ countries. From jungle treks to city breaks, we help travelers stay connected and safe without switching SIM cards.




We’re backed by top-tier partners and growing fast. Hubby offers a fast-paced, dynamic, and entrepreneurial environment — perfect for ambitious people who want to learn fast, take ownership, and build things that matter.




Role Description:

We’re looking for a Data Analyst Intern who lives and breathes data. You’ll dive deep into app usage, funnels, and campaign performance, build dashboards that guide real decisions, and help drive product adoption and partner growth.




You’ll also work closely with the CTO and leadership team to answer key questions in our organization. You’ll use data to guide our product, optimize performance, and find new growth opportunities.




In this role, you’ll:

Analyze user behavior and product adoption across millions of data points
Build and maintain dashboards to track performance and uncover insights
Identify and monitor growth levers in our app and partner network
Create data funnels to track key KPIs and conversion points
Deliver daily insights that drive action — from product tweaks to campaign strategy
Collaborate closely with our CTO and be embedded in strategic decision-making




Your Profile:

Exceptionally strong analytics skills — you love Excel, SQL, or Python
Experience (or strong interest) in dashboarding tools like Looker, Power BI, Tableau, etc.
Curious, independent, and impact-driven
Clear communicator — you can turn complex data into business insights
Fluent in English
Obsessed with understanding what our partners need — and making it happen
Based in Amsterdam, student, full-time in-office




Why Hubby?




This internship is a launchpad. You’ll gain hands-on exposure to real-world startup analytics, work with experienced operators and our CTO, and contribute directly to growth. If you're looking to build your analytics career and make an actual difference — this is it.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Who we are




The commodity world is complex—it is fast-moving but traditional. These everyday products, from your morning coffee to the grains in your pasta, play a critical role in the global economy and in our daily lives.




Vesper is disrupting the commodity game. We are the fastest-growing commodity intelligence platform, trusted by giants like Nestlé, Unilever, and Danone. We combine cutting-edge AI with real-world data to give our customers the insights they need to win in a volatile market.




What we expect from this role




As our Business Intelligence Analyst, your mission is to derive actionable insights and opportunities from our internal data. There is an emphasis on product and usage behavior, but also financial and commercial data play an important role. You will help us build a smarter, faster business by providing data-informed answers to key questions like “How can we improve our retention?” or “What is our churn risk from certain customer segments?”.




You will partner closely with other teams and play an important role by building automated data pipelines, creating actionable insights while also enabling self-serve analytics to support our strategic and business decision-making.




We are looking for somebody who loves getting “into the data”, improving data-driven decision-making processes, translating business questions into BI solutions, applying analytics rigour to strategic questions and collaborating effectively with others.




If you like to jump on a high-speed train, enjoy all the learnings that come from a rapidly changing environment, get energy from having autonomy and enjoy an environment where decisions are made in a minute, this role might be for you!




What you will be doing




Generate accurate and reliable data insights: break down business problems and turn raw data into actionable insights around user behavior (e.g. customer retention, cost-usage analysis)
Enable data-informed decision making: empower all departments and management to make data-driven decisions by providing relevant automated dashboards, tailor-made insights or self-serve analytics where needed
Build and maintain data infrastructure: develop and optimize ETL pipelines to consolidate data from various raw data sources and integrate them into a unified database
Secure data reliability: ensure data is consistent, accurate and trustworthy – from collection to reporting

What you will bring




2-4 years experience in a role in Business Intelligence, Analytics, or a related field – ideally with previous experience in a fast-paced environment (scale-up, tech or product-driven organisation)
Strong analytical and problem solving skills – you break down complex problems using data and can translate ambiguous business questions into measurable insights
Solid technical foundation — you have proven skills in SQL and Python and are comfortable with data modeling, setting up and managing ETL processes, and database design (ideally with previous experience with Airflow)
Solid stakeholder management skills – you love to say “yes”, but definitely know when to say “no”. You keep everyone in the loop and can create a shared understanding across the team
Excellent communication skills — you speak both “data” and “human” and can work with technical peers and non-technical stakeholders
Business intuition — you understand how different parts of the business connect and how to prioritize what matters most
Autonomy & initiative – you don’t wait to be told what to do. You seek out problems, validate assumptions and propose solutions
An eye for detail — you take pride in clean, accurate data and high-quality wor
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Business Analytics)




What you get




A fast-moving, high-growth environment with plenty of opportunity to learn
Full ownership of your domain, and the trust to shape your role
A collaborative culture that values speed, clarity, and impact
A chance to transform a traditional business impacting every day of our lives
A fantastic location in the city centre of Amsterdam
Great hangouts with brilliant people

Show more

Title: Finance Data Model Analyst
Description:
Note: Deadline for applying is 23.59 the day before the Job Posting End Date.

UNILEVER IS LOOKING FOR AN ICE CREAM – ERP Finance Data Model Analyst

 

Location: The Netherlands (Amsterdam), UKI (100 VE)

Full-time: Yes

Local conditions apply 

 

For the recruitment of this position, we would like to emphasize that local conditions apply to the position and for this vacancy in principle we will consider candidates based in the set locations. If you are based outside of these locations and you are interested to apply, please feel free to do so but at this stage we will not take your application forward. We will only consider your application if a decision is made to also recruit outside of the set locations.

 

About Unilever          

With 3.4 billion people in over 190 countries using our products every day, Unilever is a business that makes a real impact on the world. Work on brands that are loved and improve the lives of our consumers and the communities around us. We are driven by our purpose: to make sustainable living commonplace, and it is our belief that doing business the right way drives superior performance. At the heart of what we do is our people – we believe that when our people work with purpose, we will create a better business and a better world.   

At Unilever, your career will be a unique journey, grounded in our inclusive, collaborative, and flexible working environment. We don’t believe in the ‘one size fits all’ approach and instead we will equip you with the tools you need to shape your own future.   

We want our business to flourish, and we know that our success depends on others flourishing around us. That's why our purpose is to make sustainable living commonplace, and why sustainable, long-term growth is at the heart of our business model.  

           

ABOUT ICE CREAM: Life Tastes Better With Ice Cream

Unilever Ice Cream is the largest global Ice Cream Company in the world, with over 100 years of experience delivering a diverse range of indulgent, yet responsible, craft food experiences and treats delighting consumers. Committed to innovation, quality, and sustainability we have 35 brands, including 3 one billion Euro brands (Magnum, Wall’s, Ben & Jerry’s), a strong presence in over 60 countries, generating annual revenue of €8 billion. All brands are driven to transform moments into memories through indulgent yet responsibly made and marketed products. We have a well-developed strategy to deliver growth and value creation which is clear on where to play and how to win.

We are investing to unlock the full growth potential of Ice Cream as a standalone entity, once we separate from Unilever, which is planned to happen by November 2025. Ice Cream has distinct characteristics from Unilever’s other operating businesses and the growth potential of Ice Cream will be better delivered under a different ownership structure.

We turn the ordinary into the extraordinary by designing unique and innovative Ice Cream experiences that make life taste better, creating joyful experiences. In our Ice Cream business, we’re crafting the future through innovation and imaginative minds, creating unique products. We spark moments of happiness for people and within the communities where we operate. However, it is not as simple as it may seem. As Ice Cream makers we are serious about happiness. With warm hearts, we create the coolest products.

Job Purpose

The Finance Data Model Analyst will support the Finance Data Model Lead in designing, governing, and implementing a structured financial data model for our ERP transformation. This role ensures data integrity, consistency, and efficiency across financial reporting, accounting, and compliance processes.

This position is essential to the seamless integration of financial data within the ERP system and will exist for the project implementation duration, expected to be 2.5–3 years.

Key Responsibilities


Finance Data Model Development & Implementation:
Assist in defining and implementing financial data models supporting global reporting and compliance.
Ensure alignment with IFRS, local GAAP, and regulatory requirements.
Support the establishment of data hierarchies, naming conventions, and governance structures.
Work closely with the R2R, MR, FP&A, and Tax teams to ensure financial data structures enhance reporting efficiency.
ERP Transformation & Data Structuring:
Collaborate with IT and finance teams to configure financial data structures within the ERP system.
Support the design and implementation of Chart of Accounts, cost centers, and other financial dimensions.
Identify automation opportunities to improve data reconciliation and reporting efficiency.
Data Governance & Compliance:
Maintain finance master data quality, consistency, and security.
Assist in implementing data governance policies and validation controls.
Work closely with audit and compliance teams to meet financial reporting and regulatory requirements.
Data Migration & Archiving:
Support the execution of a robust data migration strategy, ensuring seamless transition from legacy systems.
Assist in data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes, ensuring integrity and completeness.
Establish validation and reconciliation procedures to minimize errors and ensure post-migration accuracy.
Collaboration & Stakeholder Support:
Act as a key contact between finance, IT, and business teams for financial data modelling needs.
Provide training and support to finance teams on best practices in data governance and ERP usage.
Support change management efforts to promote a data-driven culture within finance.
Testing & Continuous Improvement:
Participate in testing and validation of financial data models within the ERP system.
Conduct data reconciliation and integrity checks to ensure reliable reporting.
Identify gaps and propose enhancements for optimization.

Qualifications & Experience

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED:


Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Analytics, or a related field.
3–5+ years of experience in finance data management, financial reporting, or ERP transformation.
Exposure to ERP systems (SAP, Oracle, Workday, or similar) and financial data modelling.
Experience with business intelligence tools and data visualization (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) is a plus.


Technical & Analytical Skills


Strong financial data analysis and structuring capabilities.
Familiarity with automation tools and digital finance solutions.
Attention to detail and problem-solving skills.


Collaboration & Communication


Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage functional teams.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, evolving environment while maintaining high accuracy standards.


WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU? 

 

Unilever is the place where you can be yourself and bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world. We offer an exciting & dynamic work environment where you can make things happen. Furthermore, we offer some great reward and benefits!  


Attractive total remuneration package; excellent company pension, bonus and share scheme. 
Flexible cross-disciplinary career opportunities and a wealth of training opportunities & wellbeing resources whenever and wherever.  
Plenty of company-paid holidays to further ensure your work-life balance is maintained.  
We encourage an inclusive culture, which comes to life with interchangeable public holidays, paid paternity leave of 6 weeks and our transgender policy.  
Under the Hybrid Working principles, you will be expected to spend a minimum of 40% in the office or at customers, suppliers or partners to connect and collaborate.  For the time you work from home, we will ensure you are well equipped. When you are at the office, you can enjoy our tasty canteen with prepped food and own products.
Informal culture and being the first one trying our new products.   
My Fitness Plan (reduction on your Fitness Subscription). 
Home work allowance
Company laptop and mobile phone
Green Mobility Policy


EXCITED? 

Join Unilever and our team! To apply, you must do so online. Please do not forget to upload your CV and a motivation letter.  Your application will be reviewed against our requirements, and we will be in touch shortly after the closing date to provide you with an update on the status of your application. 

Looking forward to meeting you!   

 

Please note this is a Direct Search led by Unilever. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.  

 

Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, disability, age, parenthood, pregnancy or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against.  

By highlighting the gender diversity at the workplace, Unilever encourages women equally men to apply. If you look for a job after a long career break or after any type of leave, do not hesitate to apply. 

NOTE: Please save a copy of this vacancy for personal use as it will disappear from the website after closing of the role.

HTML:
Note: Deadline for applying is 23.59 the day before the Job Posting End Date.

UNILEVER IS LOOKING FOR AN ICE CREAM – ERP Finance Data Model Analyst

 

Location: The Netherlands (Amsterdam), UKI (100 VE)

Full-time: Yes

Local conditions apply 

 

For the recruitment of this position, we would like to emphasize that local conditions apply to the position and for this vacancy in principle we will consider candidates based in the set locations. If you are based outside of these locations and you are interested to apply, please feel free to do so but at this stage we will not take your application forward. We will only consider your application if a decision is made to also recruit outside of the set locations.

 

About Unilever          

With 3.4 billion people in over 190 countries using our products every day, Unilever is a business that makes a real impact on the world. Work on brands that are loved and improve the lives of our consumers and the communities around us. We are driven by our purpose: to make sustainable living commonplace, and it is our belief that doing business the right way drives superior performance. At the heart of what we do is our people – we believe that when our people work with purpose, we will create a better business and a better world.   

At Unilever, your career will be a unique journey, grounded in our inclusive, collaborative, and flexible working environment. We don’t believe in the ‘one size fits all’ approach and instead we will equip you with the tools you need to shape your own future.   

We want our business to flourish, and we know that our success depends on others flourishing around us. That's why our purpose is to make sustainable living commonplace, and why sustainable, long-term growth is at the heart of our business model.  

           

ABOUT ICE CREAM: Life Tastes Better With Ice Cream

Unilever Ice Cream is the largest global Ice Cream Company in the world, with over 100 years of experience delivering a diverse range of indulgent, yet responsible, craft food experiences and treats delighting consumers. Committed to innovation, quality, and sustainability we have 35 brands, including 3 one billion Euro brands (Magnum, Wall’s, Ben & Jerry’s), a strong presence in over 60 countries, generating annual revenue of €8 billion. All brands are driven to transform moments into memories through indulgent yet responsibly made and marketed products. We have a well-developed strategy to deliver growth and value creation which is clear on where to play and how to win.

We are investing to unlock the full growth potential of Ice Cream as a standalone entity, once we separate from Unilever, which is planned to happen by November 2025. Ice Cream has distinct characteristics from Unilever’s other operating businesses and the growth potential of Ice Cream will be better delivered under a different ownership structure.

We turn the ordinary into the extraordinary by designing unique and innovative Ice Cream experiences that make life taste better, creating joyful experiences. In our Ice Cream business, we’re crafting the future through innovation and imaginative minds, creating unique products. We spark moments of happiness for people and within the communities where we operate. However, it is not as simple as it may seem. As Ice Cream makers we are serious about happiness. With warm hearts, we create the coolest products.

Job Purpose

The Finance Data Model Analyst will support the Finance Data Model Lead in designing, governing, and implementing a structured financial data model for our ERP transformation. This role ensures data integrity, consistency, and efficiency across financial reporting, accounting, and compliance processes.

This position is essential to the seamless integration of financial data within the ERP system and will exist for the project implementation duration, expected to be 2.5–3 years.

Key Responsibilities

  • Finance Data Model Development & Implementation:
    • Assist in defining and implementing financial data models supporting global reporting and compliance.
    • Ensure alignment with IFRS, local GAAP, and regulatory requirements.
    • Support the establishment of data hierarchies, naming conventions, and governance structures.
    • Work closely with the R2R, MR, FP&A, and Tax teams to ensure financial data structures enhance reporting efficiency.
  • ERP Transformation & Data Structuring:
    • Collaborate with IT and finance teams to configure financial data structures within the ERP system.
    • Support the design and implementation of Chart of Accounts, cost centers, and other financial dimensions.
    • Identify automation opportunities to improve data reconciliation and reporting efficiency.
  • Data Governance & Compliance:
    • Maintain finance master data quality, consistency, and security.
    • Assist in implementing data governance policies and validation controls.
    • Work closely with audit and compliance teams to meet financial reporting and regulatory requirements.
  • Data Migration & Archiving:
    • Support the execution of a robust data migration strategy, ensuring seamless transition from legacy systems.
    • Assist in data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes, ensuring integrity and completeness.
    • Establish validation and reconciliation procedures to minimize errors and ensure post-migration accuracy.
  • Collaboration & Stakeholder Support:
    • Act as a key contact between finance, IT, and business teams for financial data modelling needs.
    • Provide training and support to finance teams on best practices in data governance and ERP usage.
    • Support change management efforts to promote a data-driven culture within finance.
  • Testing & Continuous Improvement:
    • Participate in testing and validation of financial data models within the ERP system.
    • Conduct data reconciliation and integrity checks to ensure reliable reporting.
    • Identify gaps and propose enhancements for optimization.
Qualifications & Experience

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Analytics, or a related field.
  • 3–5+ years of experience in finance data management, financial reporting, or ERP transformation.
  • Exposure to ERP systems (SAP, Oracle, Workday, or similar) and financial data modelling.
  • Experience with business intelligence tools and data visualization (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) is a plus.

Technical & Analytical Skills

  • Strong financial data analysis and structuring capabilities.
  • Familiarity with automation tools and digital finance solutions.
  • Attention to detail and problem-solving skills.

Collaboration & Communication

  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage functional teams.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, evolving environment while maintaining high accuracy standards.

WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU? 

 

Unilever is the place where you can be yourself and bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world. We offer an exciting & dynamic work environment where you can make things happen. Furthermore, we offer some great reward and benefits!  

  • Attractive total remuneration package; excellent company pension, bonus and share scheme. 
  • Flexible cross-disciplinary career opportunities and a wealth of training opportunities & wellbeing resources whenever and wherever.  
  • Plenty of company-paid holidays to further ensure your work-life balance is maintained.  
  • We encourage an inclusive culture, which comes to life with interchangeable public holidays, paid paternity leave of 6 weeks and our transgender policy.  
  • Under the Hybrid Working principles, you will be expected to spend a minimum of 40% in the office or at customers, suppliers or partners to connect and collaborate.  For the time you work from home, we will ensure you are well equipped. When you are at the office, you can enjoy our tasty canteen with prepped food and own products.
  • Informal culture and being the first one trying our new products.   
  • My Fitness Plan (reduction on your Fitness Subscription). 
  • Home work allowance
  • Company laptop and mobile phone
  • Green Mobility Policy

EXCITED? 

Join Unilever and our team! To apply, you must do so online. Please do not forget to upload your CV and a motivation letter.  Your application will be reviewed against our requirements, and we will be in touch shortly after the closing date to provide you with an update on the status of your application. 

Looking forward to meeting you!   

 

Please note this is a Direct Search led by Unilever. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.  

 

Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, disability, age, parenthood, pregnancy or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against.  

By highlighting the gender diversity at the workplace, Unilever encourages women equally men to apply. If you look for a job after a long career break or after any type of leave, do not hesitate to apply.

Title: Data Analyst FinTech and Finance
Description:
How do you make our customers happy?

With 13.5 million customers, a catalog of 38 million products, and 48,000 partner sellers, the success of our financial processes hinges on exceptional sophistication and reliability. As Data Analyst FinTech and Finance, you’ll drive the transformation of complex financial data into clear, actionable insights that improve decision-making across our organization. Your analysis will directly impact how we optimize financial processes, improve partner experiences, and deliver additional customer value.

The biggest challenge

Developing and implementing scalable analytics solutions in an environment where traditional financial models converge with platform dynamics. The complexity of our operation – processing millions of transactions across multiple business models – demands very particular approaches to financial data analysis. You’ll need to combine technical precision with business acumen, transforming vast datasets into insights that demonstrably drive strategic decisions. And this role requires more than analytical excellence; you’ll also have to influence stakeholders and promote a data-driven culture across finance and business teams.

What You'll Do As Data Analyst FinTech And Finance

As a key member of the FinTech/Finance Data team, you’ll lead initiatives that define and enhance our financial data capabilities and promote data-driven decision-making. You’ll work closely with stakeholders across Finance, FinTech, and business teams to develop solutions that drive operational excellence and accelerate strategic growth.

Your primary focus will be designing and implementing automated analytics solutions that scale with our growing platform. From developing robust reconciliation frameworks to creating intuitive dashboards, you’ll ensure our financial reporting is accurate and actionable. You’ll also serve as a strategic advisor, helping teams understand and act on the financial implications of new propositions and process changes.

Responsibilities

Working closely with product teams and finance stakeholders, you’ll take ownership of end-to-end analytics projects. This includes conceptualizing solutions, building automated workflows, and implementing monitoring systems that ensure sustained value delivery. You’ll champion data-driven approaches, demonstrating through concrete results how analytics can and should improve business outcomes. Key responsibilities:


Design and implement scalable, automated financial analytics solutions
Develop comprehensive dashboards that provide deep insight into transaction flows
Create analytical frameworks that assist financial teams in commercial decision-making
Lead complex data initiatives from conception through successful implementation
Advise stakeholders on data-driven process optimizations
Build and maintain critical financial connections and reconciliation systems
Drive adoption of data-driven practices across finance and business teams


Why you can make a difference

You combine deep analytical expertise with a strong business sense and proven stakeholder management skills. With a relevant Master’s degree and at least 5 years of data analytics experience in finance, you have the theoretical foundation and practical expertise to drive immediate impact. Your technical skills span SQL, dashboard development, and data storytelling, and you take a systematic approach to problem-solving. You also know how to communicate your ideas convincingly, and collaborate with relevant business stakeholders to ensure your solutions generate long-term value.

3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out


- Detail obsessed You get lost in striving for technical perfection at the expense of making business impact
- Solo performer You prefer independent analysis to collaborative problem-solving
- Status quo defender You're more comfortable managing existing processes than driving change
+ Strategic data leader combine technical mastery with business insight. That’s how you drive transformation
+ Impact accelerator You translate analytical insights into concrete actions that deliver measurable results
+ Collaborative thinker You thrive on building cross-functional partnerships that amplify your strategic value


Where you'll work

You’ll join our FinTech/Finance Data team at the heart of bol’s financial operations. Here, you’ll work with peers who combine analytical rigor with business pragmatism to drive retail tech platform growth. We take our analysis seriously, and our culture is welcoming and collaborative. Impact is a given: you’ll help shape how we leverage financial data to create better experiences for colleagues, partners, and millions of customers.

It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.
