You will also work closely with two data engineers to create sustainable data pipelines and turn data into actionable insights.

In this role you will become the fifth member of the Business Intelligence (BI) team. We, the BI team, create value for various stakeholders (CEO, Finance, COO, Payments, and Everfield’s portfolio companies), by creating insights, delivering analysis, automating reporting processes and improving data quality.

We build pipelines with Synapse to ingest the data into our data platform, uses Databricks for data transformation and Power BI for data visualization. For analytics the team also uses SQL.

The scope of the team is expected to scale with the company’s growth and maturity level. Everfield will scale from 28 portfolio companies currently, to approximately 90 companies in the next 4 years.

What You Will Do

  • Requirements gathering
    • Align with key stakeholders to understand reporting requirements
    • Create feature development and communication plans
    • Identify new data variables to be captured on a portfolio level
  • Data Analysis
    • Exploratory Data Analysis to test feasibility of requests and propose additional features
    • Suggests alternatives if requirements cannot be met
  • Data visualization
    • Design proof of concept solutions fit for user acceptance testing
    • Maintain and update Power BI reports
  • Data Ingestion, Verification and Validation
    • Extract raw data from upstream sources
    • Improving data quality and efficiency
      • Support portfolio companies with quality assurance of their Payments data
    • Analyse and organize raw data
  • Data modeling and Transformation
    • Build data systems and pipelines based on a medallion architecture
  • Compliance & Security
    • Create and maintain data glossary
What We Are Looking For

  • A self-starting personality, that fits into an environment that is characterised by entrepreneurship and has a customer centric approach.
  • At least 5 years of experience within an international or complex environment and the right drive and ambition to make the difference.
  • Experienced with payments business and business partnership with Payment Service Providers (PSP).
  • Experience with Synapse or Azure Data Factory and Databricks is a plus.
  • Knowledge and hands on experience with Python (PySpark, Pandas).
  • Experience with data modeling.
  • Experience with working in a DevOps team, following a structured, iterative agile development process.
  • Business fluent in English.
  • Above all, a great colleague, enthusiastic, approachable, honest, committed, result focused, a team player who wants to achieve the best results together.

What’s in it for you?

  • Grow your career in a fast-paced and growing organization.
  • Enable exponential growth by designing a world class data platform.
  • Working with the latest Data Analytics technologies.
  • Long term career opportunities.
  • Working closer to leadership teams within the Head Quarters and Portfolio Companies.
  • Flexible work environment with offices around Europe (Netherlands, UK, Spain, France, Poland, Germany).

Recruitment Process

Here’s what you can expect and who you will speak to during the interview process.

  • Initial call with Talent Acquisition Lead, Maria (30 min)
  • First interview with Head of BI, Tom (45 min)
  • Second interview with Head of Payment Services, Nico (45 min)
  • Third interview, a Case Study presentation with Tom (60 min)
  • Final interview with CFO, Franklin (30 min)

We look forward to reviewing your application!

Title: Commercial Data Analyst
Description:
Get acquainted with Eurofiber: the lifeline for the digital society. We consider it as our responsibility to help shape the digital society of the future and steer it in the right direction. Thanks to our connectivity and cloud solutions we ensure, among other things, that critical organizations, such as hospitals, schools and government agencies, are always up and running.




Job Description

As Commercial Data Analyst at Eurofiber, you'll be at the heart of driving commercial success across our organization. This pivotal role serves as the crucial link between sales and marketing teams, leveraging your analytical skills to optimize performance and identify growth opportunities.

As a self-motivated and proactive individual, you'll manage multiple activities while maintaining a big-picture perspective.

Your ability to collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders, both internally and externally, will be key to aligning and executing commercial plans.

If you're passionate about data-driven decision-making, have a knack for identifying market trends, and thrive in a dynamic environment where your insights can directly impact business growth, this role offers an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact at Eurofiber.

You will work in the Marketing Team and work with several international Commercial Business Units.

Core activities & responsibilities

Analyze market trends and customer behavior, leveraging internal and external data sources to improve commercial activities and strategies.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities, create data-driven business cases, and support strategic decision-making, including network rollout initiatives.
Provide actionable insights and recommendations to support marketing campaigns, customer retention, and lead generation efforts.
Support marketing and sales with targeted base and prospect selections, along with data-driven insights to optimize campaigns and decision-making.
Perform extensive (geospatial) analytics and statistical modelling on large datasets to identify market/business sector trends, customer buying patterns, etc. to support business, product development, and marketing decisions.
Engage in and develop data science projects that enhance the commercial performance of marketing and sales initiatives (churn prediction, cross-sell prediction, sales optimalization analysis).
Automate data processes, acquire and integrate datasets, and create visualizations to support and enhance data-driven initiatives.




Why you want to work at Eurofiber

Eurofiber gives you confidence. This gives you the freedom to decide for yourself how to do your work and reach your goals together with your colleagues. That’s our guiding principle. You’re in the driver’s seat, so how you develop yourself personally and professionally is up to you. Countless opportunities for you to explore. After all, the better you do, the more we can all achieve together.




This means:

A salary tailored to your talent, a bonus and a 13th month;
Work/life balance;
Actively develop your skills and competences through a wide range of training opportunities;
29 holidays a year with us, based on a 40 hour workweek.




Minimum qualifications

Master's degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, or another quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in data analysis and reporting, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis, or a related function, or an advanced degree.
Experience in data visualisation, data modelling, big data analytics and programming languages, like: Python, R, or SQL.
Experience with data analytics and reporting tools, e.g. PowerBI.
Familiarity with MS Office, expert level MS Excel and PowerPoint.
Dutch native and proficient in spoken and written English.




Preferred qualifications

Strong communication, presentation and negotiation skills, including towards senior management.
Ability to self-direct work in an unstructured environment.
Experience with data science and engineering tools, e.g. Azure ML.




READY FOR YOUR NEXT STEP?

We see talent in everyone and believe that Eurofiber is a place where that talent can flourish. Are you ready to join us? Please send us your cv as soon as possible.

Working for Eurofiber means contributing to the digitalization of our society. Being part of an organization that strives to work in a 100% climate-proof and circular way.




DIVERSITY STATEMENT

As the engine of the digital society, we play a vital role in unleashing the full potential of people. At Eurofiber diversity, equity and inclusion are at the core of that potential. Our commitment to these values are vital. We believe that different perspectives within teams help us to provide smart solutions to companies, government bodies and non-profit organizations .Therefore we would love to meet any candidate with unique skills, opinions and ideas. Those who feel free to be themselves, collaborate and learn from others. Whether you're part of our IT or Engineering team, we are looking for new colleagues who live by our core values, and who are willing to carry these out in their daily work.

Title: Internship - Business Intelligence
Description:
Are you ready to kick-start your career at one of the world’s most iconic companies?

At Unilever, we’re not just about creating products – we’re about building dreams, opportunities, and innovation. With over 400 brands like Dove, Knorr, and Lipton, we’re committed to making sustainable living commonplace.

This is more than just an internship; it’s a chance to learn, grow, and leave your mark at one of the largest FMCG companies on the planet.

What makes this internship exciting?

As an intern in the Business Intelligence Department, your ideas will drive impact, and your creativity will take center stage.

The team will provide you with opportunities to support projects that will help you gain hands-on experience in data analysis, modeling, and developing data-driven solutions, enhance skills in collaborating with cross-functional teams and communicating data insights effectively.

This isn’t just about learning – it’s about leading! Here’s what your journey will look like:


Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics.
Create visual representations of data to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide solutions.
Ensure data quality and integrity by managing data sources and performing regular audits.
Identify opportunities to improve data processes and implement best practices.
Learn and apply tools and technologies such as SQL, Power BI, Tableau, and Excel.
Assist in various projects by providing data-driven insights and recommendations.


You’re The Perfect Fit If


You’re available for 5 to 6 months starting 25 of August or 1st September 2025 (minimum 32 hours/week).
You’re enrolled (3rd or 4th year) in Bachelor or Master of Economics, Econometrics, or Data Science.
You have strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Experience with SQL and/or Python is a plus.
You have experience with PowerBI.
Experience with AI (LLM or ML) is a plus.
You demonstrate innovation and creativity.
You have advanced Excel skills.
You are fluent in English.


Why you’ll love working with us?

We know internships are all about growth and exploration – and we’ve got you covered.


A €625 gross/month allowance.
Travel reimbursement (if you don’t have a student travel card).
Fun and engaging intern programs – onboarding, events, and activities with fellow interns.
Access to extensive training programs for personal and professional growth.
A flexible working environment tailored to your success.
A behind-the-scenes experience at one of the world’s largest and most innovative FMCG companies.


Application Process


Click "Apply now" and upload your CV and motivation letter. Don't forget to complete the questionnaire we send you. It's your chance to shine!
Our team will carefully review your application. We receive a lot of applications, so please bear with us as we give each one the attention it deserves.
If we think you might be a great fit, we'll schedule a friendly phone call to get to know you better and hear about your motivations.
We'll present your profile to the manager. If they’re impressed, you'll be invited for an interview to discuss the opportunity further.
After the interview, the manager will provide feedback on your performance. If you are selected, you'll receive an offer letter with all the exciting details about your internship.
Once you accept the offer, we'll guide you through the onboarding process, including any necessary paperwork, training sessions, and introductions to your awesome team.
You'll kick off your internship, get integrated into the team, and start working on your cool projects and responsibilities.


Unilever is more than a workplace – it’s a space to bring your passions to life while creating impact. Are you ready to be part of something extraordinary? Let’s make it happen together!
Show more

Title: PowerBI Consultant
Description:
PowerBI Consultant




Jij kan als geen ander op een vertellende manier informatie zo presenteren dat het maximaal impact maakt. Elk dashboard dat jij oplevert beantwoord de gestelde vragen en het liefst met zo min mogelijk toeters en bellen. Jij bent nieuwsgierig als het gaat om technologie en werkt graag samen met ervaren (technische) BI-collega’s om jou als consultant vakinhoudelijk verder te ontwikkelen. Zie jij jezelf al starten in deze rol? Lees snel verder!




Het Business Intelligence team van McCoy & Partners is met 24+ consultants één van de grotere Business Units. Een divers en hecht team. Wij doen aan onvoorwaardelijk kennisdeling en kennen geen functieprofielen zoals Junior, Medior of Senior. Iedereen heeft zijn eigen expertise, de lijntjes zijn kort en er is vrijheid. Elk persoon is een puzzelstukje op zichzelf. Uniek en onmisbaar voor het leggen van de gehele puzzel.




Het volgende puzzelstukje

Wij zijn op zoek naar het volgende puzzelstukje die ons team kan aanvullen. Jij gaat starten als Power BI consultant bij één van onze (inter)nationale klanten. Jij zit samen met andere BI-collega’s op een project en bent de expert als het gaat om de ontsluiting van data richting PowerBI. Op SAP gebied word jij vakinhoudelijk begeleidt door een van onze ervaren consultants. Daarnaast helpt een coach jou verder in je persoonlijke ontwikkeling.




Naast het goede werk dat jij gaat doen bij onze klanten, ben jij één van de personen die samen met onze functionele Business Units (o.a. Finance, HRx, SCM) dashboards gaat ontwikkelen voor hun specifieke processen. Met als doel de dashboards als propositie aan te bieden op de markt. Kers op de taart is wanneer jij jouw eigen dashboard mag gaan implementeren bij de klant!




Dit maakt ons BI-zonder

Als Business Intelligence team hebben wij goede langdurige klantrelaties. Hierdoor zijn er altijd mogelijkheden te creëren om je als PowerBI consultant verder te blijven ontwikkelen. Zowel op het technisch als functioneel gebied.




Daarnaast heeft McCoy & Partners alle functionele expertise in huis. Van Finance tot HR. Het Business Intelligence team is nauw betrokken bij productimplementaties zoals S/4, EWM en SuccessFactors. Dit betekent dat onze expertise vaak nodig is in (pre-)sales trajecten en wij een prominente plek innemen in het geheel.




Heb jij als consultant genoeg van PowerBI en wil je doorgroeien naar Business Analist? Of ga je liever aan de slag met Snowflake? Dat kan!




Dit krijg je bij ons




Jouw werk wordt beloond. Naast een goed salaris op basis van jouw ervaring en kennis voorzien we jou van een goed voorwaardenpakket waar je blij van wordt.




Dertig vakantiedagen
Geen concurrentiebeding en geen proeftijd.
Een nettobedrag van 2350 euro voor het aanschaffen van een laptop, telefoon en/of de inrichting van jouw thuiskantoor
Een mobiliteitsvergoeding of de mogelijkheid om een auto (incl. brandstof) en/of fiets te leasen;
Direct een vast contract bij indiensttreding;
De mogelijkheid om mede-eigenaar te worden van McCoy met de McCoins
Onkostenvergoeding van 60 euro netto per maand;
Gratis opleidingen via McAdemy;
Ieder jaar een eindgesprek waarin we jouw groei bespreken en dit ook in het salaris doorvoeren
Een bonus op basis van persoonlijk- en bedrijfsresultaat (ongeveer 1,5 maandsalaris).




Kop koffie?




Minimaal een afgeronde HBO opleiding
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met PowerBI
Ervaring met Data Storytelling
Ervaring met SAC Analytics Cloud is een pre
Vind het uitdagend om technische vaardigheden te verbeteren
Gelooft in onze 'More Than BI' gedachtengoed




Ben jij het missende puzzelstukje waar wij naar op zoek zijn? Dan zouden wij je graag eens willen spreken!




Over McCoy




Wij zijn McCoy, dé onafhankelijke SAP-partner van Nederland. Sinds onze oprichting in 2012 zijn we uitgegroeid tot een team van ruim 300 medewerkers. Bij ons draait het niet alleen om IT-oplossingen, maar om jou en jouw behoeften. Wij brengen de ‘soft’ terug in software, omdat we geloven dat de kracht van technologie pas echt tot zijn recht komt wanneer het mensen slimmer laat werken en plezier in hun werk geeft. Ervaar zelf wat “Work smart. Be happy.” écht betekent!




Onze cultuur




McCoy is een Great Place to Work, letterlijk, en behoort tot de top 40 beste werkgevers van Nederland. We zijn een zelfstandig bedrijf en worden geleid door en zijn eigendom van de mensen die er werken. Hierdoor ontstaan teams vanuit ondernemerschap, gebaseerd op ideeën of technologieën van consultants. We nemen beslissingen op basis van expertise, in plaats van hiërarchie.

  • Ervaring met Data Storytelling
  • Ervaring met SAC Analytics Cloud is een pre
  • Vind het uitdagend om technische vaardigheden te verbeteren
  • Gelooft in onze 'More Than BI' gedachtengoed

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Over The Member Company







We are a global high-tech consultancy company with a team of entrepreneurial engineers, scientists, and digital experts from around the world. Together we form a fast-growing and proud community. We offer consultancy services to high-profile clients globally in diverse service areas, such as:







About this vacancy




As a Data Analyst at TMC Data Science, you will transform raw data into actionable insights that guide strategic decision-making. You will create dashboards and visualizations that simplify complex data and support innovation through trend analysis and forecasting.







Key Responsibiliies




Analyze data to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities.
Develop intuitive dashboards and reports for stakeholders.
Conduct trend analysis and create predictive models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business.
Present findings in a clear and impactful manner.




hat we expect from you?

Bachelor’s or Msc degree in Data Science, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related fields.
3-5 years of experience in data analysis or business intelligence.
Proficiency in visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
Strong analytical and communication skills.
Knowledge of the high-tech industry is a plus.

Title: Medior/Senior Data Analyst
Description:
How do you delight our customers?

At bol.com, we are dedicated to making daily life more convenient for our over 13 million customers. As a Data Analyst within the Customer & Marketing domain, you’ll play a critical role in analyzing customer behavior, uncovering insights and opportunities for improvement, and ultimately driving customer loyalty. You’ll work closely with the rest of our Customer Analytics team to understand customer needs, evaluate the effectiveness of our marketing efforts, and identify new opportunities to enhance the customer experience.

Do you enjoy solving complex puzzles in the customer and marketing domain? Are you passionate about using data to drive business decisions? Do you have a strong affinity for data, experience with SQL, and a desire to dive into all the data bol has to offer? Or are you looking for your next challenge after 3-7 years as a data analyst? Join our team at bol as a Data Analyst in the Customer & Marketing domain!

What you do as a Data Analyst Customer & Marketing?

You’ll join a group of data professionals in the Customer Analytics team, that aims to make people, programs, and products in the customer and marketing organization more performant through data. This job is for the versatile analyst, one that is equally comfortable talking to data as to stakeholders. Your days vary but at the core you’ll use SQL/Tableau/dbt/git to provide metrics, datasets, analysis, and predictions that help the business make better decisions.

You’ll collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to understand business needs, identify key performance metrics, and develop and deliver reports and dashboards that track performance and drive continuous improvement. Additionally, you’ll play a critical role in identifying and evaluating new data sources, tools, and techniques that can help us better understand our customers and improve our marketing efforts.

Some Specific Responsibilities Include


Analyzing customer behavior and identifying key drivers of customer loyalty and marketing effectiveness. You'll use your analytical skills to uncover patterns and insights in our data that help us understand what drives customer loyalty and makes our marketing more effective, and you'll work with the rest of the Customer Analytics team to translate those insights into recommendations for improving the customer experience.
Develop, implement, and test marketing experiments across channels to improve marketing efficiency and ROI. Focussing on incremental result insights through experiments will enable the performance teams to improve their ROIs. You’ll be responsible for developing the test setup, the required data and evaluating the tests, in close collaboration with product and marketing teams.
Developing high-quality data pipelines for dashboarding and KPIs. You'll work with our analytical engineers to create robust, efficient data pipelines using dbt, ensuring that the data we use for reporting and analysis is accurate, complete, and up-to-date.
Analyzing & prepping datasets for marketing efficiency and customer propositions. You'll work with our marketing teams to analyze the effectiveness of our marketing efforts, using data to identify opportunities for marketing channels (like e-mail or push messages) and customer propositions (like Select)
Writing high-quality and easily interpretable SQL code that can be reused. You'll use your SQL skills to query large, complex datasets, extracting the data needed to answer key business questions. You'll also ensure that your SQL code is reusable, well-documented, and easily interpretable by other members of the team.
You'll work closely with stakeholders across the organization, using your data expertise to help guide decision-making processes and ensure that data-driven insights are at the forefront of our business strategy. You'll also represent the data perspective in cross-functional discussions, ensuring that our decisions are based on the best available information.
In this role, you'll have the opportunity to work with a variety of data sources and tools, and to collaborate closely with stakeholders across the organization. You'll be at the forefront of our efforts to understand and delight our customers, and you'll play a critical role in driving business impact through data-driven insights and recommendations.


Why you can make the difference?

You’re an enthusiastic team player who lives and breathes analytics. The ideal candidate for this role has a strong analytical mindset, a passion for customer-centricity, and excellent communication and collaboration skills. You have experience working with SQL and dashboarding tools like Tableau/Looker Studio and are comfortable navigating and analyzing large, complex datasets. You’re also able to work effectively with cross-functional teams, and have a knack for translating complex data insights into clear, actionable recommendations.

3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out


- Discomfort working with data on a daily basis This role requires a strong analytical mindset and a willingness to work with large, complex datasets.
- Prefer working independently over collaborating with others This role involves working closely with stakeholders across different teams and functions, so strong communication and collaboration skills are essential.
- Lacking the technical skills required for the role You will be responsible for building data pipelines, creating dashboards, and conducting advanced analyses to drive business impact. If you are not open to getting technical and enjoy working more on the business side of things, this may not be the ideal fit for you.
+ A passion for data-driven problem solving and collaboration. You love working with data and are passionate about using data to drive business impact. You enjoy digging into complex datasets and using your analytical skills to uncover insights that help drive decision-making.
+ You enjoy collaborating with stakeholders across different teams and functions. You're a strong communicator who can translate technical information into non-technical language, and you enjoy working with others to drive projects forward.
+ Strong commitment to delivering high-quality analytics that drive business impact. You understand that data-driven insights are only valuable when they are accurate, reliable, and actionable. You are always striving for excellence in your work and take pride in the impact your insights have on the business.


This is where you’ll work

Your new role will be part of the Customer Analytics team at bol.com, where you will collaborate with 6+ talented analytics professionals. Together, you will support a variety of teams across Product, Marketing, Strategy, and Finance, driving customer loyalty, growth, and profit for the company. The Customer Analytics team has a rich history at bol, and has built a modern data stack on the Google Cloud Platform, including technologies like BigQuery, Git, Airflow, dbt, and Tableau, as well as a range of Python libraries that enable advanced analytics. You’ll be joining a team that is passionate about data and committed to quality, using cutting-edge tools and techniques to drive meaningful insights and business impact.

It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.

Title: Data Strategist
Description:
About TCS

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is a global leader in IT services, digital, and business solutions that partners with its clients to simplify, strengthen, and transform their businesses. We ensure the highest levels of certainty and satisfaction through a deep-set commitment to our clients, comprehensive industry expertise, and a global network of innovation and delivery centers.




TCS operates on a global scale & has over 6,08,985 of the world’s best-trained consultants representing 152 nationalities in 53 countries. TCS established its presence in the Netherlands in 1992 and works with leading Dutch Customers across industry sectors, including several NL20 companies. TCS has been ranked #1 in customer satisfaction, among IT services providers in the Netherlands in a survey by Whitelane Research and is recognized as a Top Employer in the Netherlands, Europe & also Global by the Top Employers Institute




For more information, visit www.tcs.com




Role description

A Data Strategist is responsible for defining, implementing, and driving the data strategy across the organization to enable data-driven decision-making. This role bridges the gap between business objectives and data initiatives, ensuring that data assets are leveraged effectively to achieve business goals. The Data Strategist works closely with executives, business leaders, data engineers, and analysts to create actionable insights, optimize data management processes, and build a culture of data literacy within the organization.




Responsibilities:

Data Strategy Development:

Lead the development and execution of the organization’s data strategy, aligning data initiatives with overall business goals and objectives.
Define long-term data strategies, including data collection, management, analysis, and usage, ensuring alignment with corporate priorities.
Identify key opportunities to leverage data as a strategic asset across the business.
Develop and maintain a roadmap for data initiatives that integrates various departments' needs (e.g., marketing, finance, operations, etc.).




Data Governance and Quality Management:

Establish and enforce data governance frameworks to ensure data quality, consistency, and compliance across the organization.
Define best practices for data collection, storage, access, and utilization to ensure data integrity.
Work with IT, data engineering, and other teams to ensure data privacy and security standards are followed, meeting compliance requirements (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
Oversee the implementation of data management policies and procedures that promote transparency, trust, and accountability in the organization’s data usage.




Collaboration with Business Leaders:

Serve as the primary point of contact for all data-related initiatives across business functions.
Work with business stakeholders to understand their data needs, translate those into actionable data strategies, and ensure data solutions are aligned with business objectives.
Translate complex data issues into clear, actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders, enabling informed decision-making at all levels of the organization.
Work closely with leadership teams to ensure data strategies support long-term business growth and innovation.




Data Analytics and Insights:

Provide guidance on data analytics best practices and methodologies, enabling teams to extract actionable insights from data.
Ensure that business teams are utilizing data effectively for operational, tactical, and strategic decision-making.
Champion data-driven decision-making across the organization by identifying key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics that align with business priorities.
Leverage advanced analytics, including predictive models and data visualizations, to help guide business decisions and strategies.




Data Infrastructure and Tools:

Collaborate with data engineering and IT teams to ensure that the organization has the right tools, platforms, and technologies for collecting, analyzing, and visualizing data.
Identify gaps in data infrastructure and recommend improvements or new technologies to enhance data capabilities.
Stay up-to-date on the latest advancements in data analytics tools and technologies, and drive the adoption of relevant tools to improve data workflows.




Performance Monitoring and Reporting:

Track and monitor the effectiveness of data strategies, ensuring data initiatives deliver measurable business value.
Design and implement reporting systems and dashboards to track key business metrics and performance indicators.
Provide regular reports to executive leadership and key stakeholders, summarizing data trends, insights, and the impact of data initiatives on business performance.




Training and Data Literacy:

Foster a data-driven culture by promoting data literacy across the organization.
Lead training initiatives to increase understanding and effective use of data across departments.
Create and implement programs to help teams at all levels develop their data skills, from basic data interpretation to advanced analytics.




Data Innovation and Continuous Improvement:

Explore and experiment with emerging data technologies, techniques, and methodologies to continuously improve data processes and strategies.
Drive innovation within the organization by exploring new ways to leverage data for competitive advantage.
Ensure that data practices are continuously evolving and adapting to industry trends, new challenges, and the evolving business environment.




Skills and Qualifications:

Educational Background:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Information Management, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).




Technical Skills

Proven experience with data analytics, data management, and business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Strong knowledge of data modeling, data architecture, and data governance frameworks.
Familiarity with data processing frameworks, such as SQL, Python, R, or other programming languages used for data manipulation and analysis.
Experience with data management platforms (e.g., Hadoop, AWS, Google Cloud Platform, or Azure).
Knowledge of data security and compliance regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
Strong ability to analyze large datasets, identify trends, and provide actionable insights.
Proven experience in identifying and developing KPIs and metrics that drive business performance.
Ability to apply advanced statistical methods, machine learning algorithms, or predictive analytics models to solve complex business problems (preferred but not required).




Soft Skills:

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience presenting executive leadership and guiding strategic decision-making.
The ability to translate business problems into data-driven solutions that are both practical and impactful.
Strong leadership and project management skills, with the ability to drive data initiatives across multiple teams.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams, including business leaders, data engineers, data scientists, and IT professionals.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment.
Ability to think strategically about how data can be used to meet business goals and drive organizational change.
Experience in developing and implementing long-term data strategies that support business transformation.




Experience:

Experience with advanced analytics, such as machine learning, AI, or automation in a business context.
Experience working with cloud-based data platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and big data solutions.
Familiarity with agile methodologies and how they can be applied to data strategy initiatives




Work Environment:

Collaborative and fast-paced work environment.
Opportunity to work with state-of-the-art technologies.
Supportive and dynamic team culture




Privacy Notice

Privacy Note: https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice




Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an equal opportunity employer. We truly believe that employing a diverse workforce is pivotal to our success. Please note, recruiting decisions are always based on applicant’s skills, competencies & experience and potential fitment to the available role

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about bridging the gap between business needs and IT data solutions? Do you enjoy translating business needs into actionable insights through tools in BI and reporting? Are you excited about joining a new, innovative role in an international environment where your advice will drive impactful change?

We are expanding our Data team! In this exciting new role, you will play a key part in driving value for our organization by acting as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions, specializing in the Business Intelligence (BI) and Reporting domain. This is a unique opportunity to shape your role, taking on significant responsibility and making a direct impact on the business. You will advise and implement strong technical solutions, contributing to the growth and success of the organization.

What makes this role even more exciting is the diversity of your stakeholders: ranging from headquarters to regional teams and local businesses. You will be involved in innovative projects, taking on new challenges that offer great opportunities for personal and professional growth.

We are looking for a talented new colleague to join us as our next:

Data Analyst

In this role you will be part of a talented and skilled data team. You will report to the Lead BI and EAI and collaborate closely with various stakeholders across our dynamic and growing company.

The tasks and responsibilities are:


Collaboration with business stakeholders for the definition and establishment of KPIs, metrics, and analytical requirements.
Translation of complex data requirements into clear, actionable recommendations for the business.
Coordination with Data Engineering teams for smooth workflow and data integration.
Design and development of automated reports and dashboards using Power BI.
Analysis of large datasets for the identification of trends, patterns, and insights for decision-making.
Assurance of data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across all reports.
Streamlining of processes for data collection and reporting.
Training and support for teams in the use of reports and dashboards.
Presentation of findings and insights to senior management and stakeholders.



About You


We are looking for a data wizard with strong business and people skills with the following background and experience:
You have at least a Bachelor degree in IT, Data science or a related field.
At least 4 years of working experience in a Data/Business Analyst or similar role.
Strong proficiency and interest in SQL & Python for querying, data extraction, and analysis.
Expertise in data visualization and reporting tools, particularly Power BI.
Experience with Agile/Scrum teams and working with SAP ECC or SAP S4HANA is a plus.
Excellent proficiency in the English language, both spoken and written.
You are strong in ‘translating’ technical data to non-technical teams and the other way around.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
You are data savvy, pragmatic and enjoy to work with different various and international stakeholders.



What We Offer


A competitive reward package, including bonus eligibility.
A collaborative, international, and commercial environment where you can make a meaningful impact.
Opportunities for continuous professional development and growth.
A dynamic team culture that values integrity, efficiency, and open communication.



We are the creator of drinks. We take great pride in creating world-class beverages, partnering with top retailers and brands across Europe, North America, and Australia to produce drinks that you love every day.

Do you want to see your drinks on every table? Do you want to join our exciting journey?

 

Recruitment process

Are you interested in this open position, feel free to send your application!

In case of any questions with regards to the position, you may reach out to Yasimin Harput (Corporate Recruiter Group/HQ)

Phone: 010 440 5100

E-mail: yasimin.harput@refresco.com

Additionally: we have great pleasure in getting in touch with potential new employees directly. For this reason we are fully managing the search for this role in-house and will not be needing any external assistance (agencies e.g.).

In this exciting new role, you will play a key part in driving value for our organization by acting as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions, specializing in the Business Intelligence (BI) and Reporting domain. This is a unique opportunity to shape your role, taking on significant responsibility and making a direct impact on the business. You will advise and implement strong technical solutions, contributing to the growth and success of the organization.

What makes this role even more exciting is the diversity of your stakeholders: ranging from headquarters to regional teams and local businesses. You will be involved in innovative projects, taking on new challenges that offer great opportunities for personal and professional growth.

We are looking for a talented new colleague to join us as our next:

Data Analyst

In this role you will be part of a talented and skilled data team. You will report to the Lead BI and EAI and collaborate closely with various stakeholders across our dynamic and growing company.

The tasks and responsibilities are:

  • Collaboration with business stakeholders for the definition and establishment of KPIs, metrics, and analytical requirements.
  • Translation of complex data requirements into clear, actionable recommendations for the business.
  • Coordination with Data Engineering teams for smooth workflow and data integration.
  • Design and development of automated reports and dashboards using Power BI.
  • Analysis of large datasets for the identification of trends, patterns, and insights for decision-making.
  • Assurance of data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across all reports.
  • Streamlining of processes for data collection and reporting.
  • Training and support for teams in the use of reports and dashboards.
  • Presentation of findings and insights to senior management and stakeholders.


About You

  • We are looking for a data wizard with strong business and people skills with the following background and experience:
  • You have at least a Bachelor degree in IT, Data science or a related field.
  • At least 4 years of working experience in a Data/Business Analyst or similar role.
  • Strong proficiency and interest in SQL & Python for querying, data extraction, and analysis.
  • Expertise in data visualization and reporting tools, particularly Power BI.
  • Experience with Agile/Scrum teams and working with SAP ECC or SAP S4HANA is a plus.
  • Excellent proficiency in the English language, both spoken and written.
  • You are strong in ‘translating’ technical data to non-technical teams and the other way around.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • You are data savvy, pragmatic and enjoy to work with different various and international stakeholders.


What We Offer

  • A competitive reward package, including bonus eligibility.
  • A collaborative, international, and commercial environment where you can make a meaningful impact.
  • Opportunities for continuous professional development and growth.
  • A dynamic team culture that values integrity, efficiency, and open communication.


We are the creator of drinks. We take great pride in creating world-class beverages, partnering with top retailers and brands across Europe, North America, and Australia to produce drinks that you love every day.

Do you want to see your drinks on every table? Do you want to join our exciting journey?

 

Recruitment process

Are you interested in this open position, feel free to send your application!

In case of any questions with regards to the position, you may reach out to Yasimin Harput (Corporate Recruiter Group/HQ)

Phone: 010 440 5100

E-mail: yasimin.harput@refresco.com

Additionally: we have great pleasure in getting in touch with potential new employees directly. For this reason we are fully managing the search for this role in-house and will not be needing any external assistance (agencies e.g.).

Title: Analytics and Insights Internship
Description:
As an Analytics & Insights Intern at Armada Music, you’ll work closely with our Analytics & Insights team, while also supporting the Marketing team with data-driven strategies. You’ll dive into streaming and audience data, track artist and campaign performance, and help enhance internal reporting tools. This internship is perfect for someone with a strong analytical mindset, a passion for music, and an interest in how data fuels both artist development and marketing strategy in today’s music industry.




What You’ll Do

Work with large datasets from streaming platforms, social media, and internal sources to analyze artist, track, and campaign performance.
Write and optimize SQL queries to extract insights, automate reporting, and improve data visibility.
Help track KPIs across streaming, playlisting, audience growth, and campaign effectiveness.
Support predictive and trend analysis to uncover growth opportunities and marketing impact.
Segment audiences and develop listener insights to inform marketing and promotional strategies.
Present findings through clear, insightful reports and visualizations for the A&R, Marketing, Digital, and Catalog teams.




Who You Are

Currently enrolled in or recently completed a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Marketing Analytics, or a related field.
Proficient in Excel and SQL, with experience working with large datasets.
Comfortable with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or Google Data Studio) and storytelling with data.
Strong analytical thinker with great attention to detail and a proactive, problem-solving attitude.
Passionate about music and how data can influence decision-making across the industry.
Based in (or within commuting distance of) Amsterdam and enrolled at a Dutch university for the duration of the internship (starting April 2025).

Bonus Skills (Nice to Have)

Experience with Python or R for data analysis and automation.
Familiarity with music and marketing data sources (Spotify for Artists, Chartmetric, Meta Ads, Google Analytics).
Understanding of API integrations for data extraction and automation.




What You’ll Get in Return

Hands-on experience in analytics and business intelligence in the music industry.
Access to real-world data and collaboration with key teams like A&R, Marketing, Digital, and Catalog.
A fast-paced, open, and creative working environment at one of the world’s leading dance music labels.
Skill development in SQL, forecasting, and data storytelling.
A unique opportunity to contribute directly to artist development and marketing decisions.




About Armada

Armada Music is the biggest independent dance music label in the world, founded in 2003 by Armin van Buuren, Maykel Piron and David Lewis (AR-MA-DA). Promoting dance music all over the world from its offices in Amsterdam (HQ), New York and London, Armada Music represents and cultivates the creative exploits of some of the biggest players in the electronic music game, including Armin van Buuren, Lilly Palmer, D.O.D, Hannah Laing, ARTY, Audien, Giorgia Angiuli, Yulia Niko, Brando, Cat Dealers, Loud Luxury, Tensnake, Eelke Kleijn, Jan Blomqvist, Joris Voorn, KI/KI, Sunnery James & Ryan Marciano and THEMBA.

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Bedrijfsomschrijving

Een positieve toekomst voor iedereen, daar werken we bij Sopra Steria aan. Met meer dan 56.000 collega’s in 30 landen zijn we Europa’s toonaangevende aanbieder van digitale oplossingen. Wij geloven dat het niet alleen technologie is die transformatie aandrijft, maar dat mensen de kern vormen van verandering. Daarom staan mensen centraal in alles wat we doen, zowel individueel als in teamverband. De wereld is hoe we haar vormgeven. Laten we haar samen vormgeven.

Vacatureomschrijving

Als BI Consultant help je onze klanten complexe data-uitdagingen op te lossen. Je verzamelt data uit verschillende bronnen, optimaliseert datasets voor visualisatie en ontwikkelt inzichtelijke en gebruiksvriendelijke dashboards.

Met behulp van je eigen expertise en de design-thinking methodologie van Sopra Steria, verhoog je de kwaliteit van rapportages en visualisaties bij onze klanten. De "actionable insights" uit de rapporten en visualisaties helpen de klanten om de juiste strategische, tactische en operationele beslissingen te nemen.

Naast de waardevolle bijdrage die je levert aan de klant, draag je ook bij aan de visie en ontwikkeling van de praktijk en de eenheid.

Functie-eisen

Wij zijn op zoek naar gepassioneerde collega’s die graag de grenzen verleggen op het gebied van digitale transformatie en technologieconsultancy. Bij Sopra Steria krijg je de kans om je vaardigheden verder te ontwikkelen in een constructieve, samenwerkende teamomgeving, waarbij je werkt aan impactvolle projecten die verandering teweegbrengen voor onze klanten. Als je gedijt op uitdagingen en (de meeste van) de onderstaande kwalificaties bezit, kijken we uit naar je sollicitatie!

Type dienstverband: Hybride

Locatie: Nieuwegein

Aantal uren: 32-40 uur werkweek

Contracttype: Vast

Opleiding: Je hebt een HBO- of WO-opleiding afgerond in de richting van IT

Talen: Nederlands (vereist) en Engels

Je hebt kennis en ervaring van de volgende zaken:


vanaf ongeveer 3jaar ervaring met ten minste één van de volgende tools en kunt dit aantonen via je portfolio of certificaten:
o Power BI
o Tableau
o Qlik
o D3.js
Ervaring met het optimaliseren van de prestaties van dashboards
Creatief, maar pragmatisch met oog voor detail
Kennis van best practices en visuele ontwerpprincipes
Kennis van programmeertalen zoals JavaScript, Python, C# is een voordeel
Kennis en gevoel voor UX-design is een extra pluspunt
Je geniet ervan om expert te zijn en collega's en klanten te coachen
Je kunt gemakkelijk communiceren, zowel met je collega’s als met de klant en eindgebruikers van je visualisaties
Het toevoegen van je dashboards of portfolio aan de sollicitatie is een voordeel


Aanvullende informatie

Als onderdeel van een van Europa’s grootste aanbieders van digitale oplossingen profiteer je van uitgebreide carrièremogelijkheden, zowel lokaal als internationaal. Bij de Sopra Steria Academy maak je deel uit van een dynamisch netwerk van 56.000 professionals in verschillende stadia van hun loopbaan. Je wordt onderdeel van een toonaangevende techspeler in Europa, erkend voor zijn consultancy, digitale diensten en softwareontwikkeling.

Binnen de area Data creëren wij duurzame waarde bij onze klanten op het gebied van data. Wij helpen bedrijven om wendbaar te blijven in de transitie door data en techniek onderdeel te laten zijn van zowel de dagelijkse operatie als de strategische besluitvorming. Hiermee helpen wij onze klanten de verandering voor te zijn met behulp van data. Het is onze ambitie om organisaties te laten excelleren met data. Je werkt in een hightech omgeving met focus op kennis en innovatie, een open no-nonsense bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor eigen initiatief. De area bestaat uit 5 practices: Data Governance & Data Management, Data Visualisation, Data Science & AI, Data Engineering & Data Migrations en Spatial Intelligence. Elk met een duidelijke signatuur en focus op inhoud en bijbehorende solution. Binnen deze area zijn ruim 170 professionals werkzaam in een voor hen logische en passende vakinhoudelijke practice.

Onze medewerkers staan bekend om hun gedurfde keuzes en het leveren van resultaten. Werk samen met hooggekwalificeerde professionals die voorop lopen in bedrijfs-softwareoplossingen en innovatie bij Europa's toonaangevende aanbieder van digitale diensten.

Wij bieden een aantrekkelijk arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket, waaronder:


Locatie onafhankelijk en flexibel werken;
Onbeperkte ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden;
Een laptop, telefoon en thuiskantoor;
Een aantrekkelijk salaris;
Keuze tussen een bedrijfsauto of een mobiliteitsbudget;
De mogelijkheid om je eigen voordelen aan te passen via Flex Benefits:
Vakantiegeld en winstdeling;
27 verlofdagen (20 wettelijke en 7 bovenwettelijke vakantiedagen).

______

Sopra Steria is een werkgever die gelijke kansen biedt. Alle gekwalificeerde sollicitanten worden in aanmerking genomen voor een job zonder rekening te houden met leeftijd, afkomst, nationaliteit, huidskleur, verlof voor familie- of medische zorg, geslachtsidentiteit of -uitdrukking, genetische informatie, immigratiestatus, burgerlijke staat, medische toestand, nationale herkomst, fysieke of mentale handicap, politieke voorkeur, beschermde veteranen- of militaire status, ras, etniciteit, religie, geslacht (inclusief zwangerschap), seksuele geaardheid of enig ander kenmerk dat wordt beschermd door toepasselijke lokale wetten, voorschriften en verordeningen. We koesteren een werkomgeving die inclusief is en alle verschillen respecteert.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
HTML:
Over het bedrijf

Deze organisatie op opgericht in de jaren 80' en sinds begin deze eeuw actief in Nederland, met een kantoor gevestigd in de regio Utrecht. Het biedt diensten aan een diverse groep zakelijke klanten, variërend van kleine ondernemers tot grote multinationals.

Het primaire doel is om klanten te ondersteunen bij het optimaliseren en verduurzamen van hun wagenpark. Daarom omvat het aanbod een breed scala aan duurzame mobiliteitsoplossingen, waaronder elektrische auto's en deelauto's.


Over de functie

Als Business Intelligence specialist werk je samen met je team om gegevens te vertalen naar inzichten die direct bijdragen aan strategische beslissingen. Je speelt een rol in projecten waarbij de verschillende afdelingen betrokken zijn, waarbij je optreedt als expert op het gebied van gegevensstructuren en rapportagemogelijkheden. Vervolgens onderzoek je zelfstandig bestaande verzoeken voor rapportages, waarbij je de behoefte, haalbaarheid en volledigheid vaststelt. Daarnaast initieer je proactief de verkenning van nieuwe mogelijkheden om effectief relevante gegevens te rapporteren.


Verantwoordelijkheden

  • Actief doorvragen en meedenken bij rapportage aanvragen en bijdragen aan toevoegingen aan relevante data;
  • Verzamelen van informatie via diverse tools voor presentatie in rapportages en dashboards;
  • Onderzoeken van beste benaderingen voor interne en externe rapportagewensen;
  • Betrokkenheid en advies bij de keuze en ontwikkeling van nieuwe tooling;
  • Optreden als sparringpartner voor zowel IT als de Business, met een adviserende rol.


Wat wordt er gevraagd

  • HBO werk- en denkniveau
  • Je spreekt en schrijft vloeiend Nederlands
  • 1 tot 3 jaar ervaring in een vergelijkbare rol
  • Je bent gewend op project basis te werken
  • Je kunt zelfstandig werken en bent analytisch sterk


Wat wordt er geboden

  • Een salaris tussen €3.300 en €3.700, afhankelijk van je ervaring;
  • Jaarlijkse winstbonus afhankelijk van behaalde targets;
  • Premievrij pensioen, 8% vakantiegeld en minimaal 25 vakantiedagen;
  • Hybride werken en een thuiswerkvergoeding;
  • Een thuiswerkbudget van €847 voor het inrichten van je werkplek;
  • Laptop en iPhone 14;
  • Profiteer van onze sportregeling, vers fruit, teamuitjes en de jaarlijkse party.


Heb je interesse in deze positie? Upload je cv, dan nemen we contact met je op!

Title: BI Specialist
Description:
Eurofiber Cloud Infra biedt toonaangevende cloud infrastructuurdiensten en maakt deel uit van de Eurofiber Group. Wij bieden slimme, open en toekomstbestendige cloud infrastructuuroplossingen aan bedrijven, overheden en non-profitorganisaties.





Vacatureomschrijving



BI Specialist



Wil jij impact maken met data en bijdragen aan strategische inzichten binnen onze organisatie? Ben jij analytisch, leergierig en klaar om je BI-skills verder te ontwikkelen? Dan zoeken wij jou!



Jouw rol



Als BI Specialist werk je aan het analyseren, structureren en visualiseren van data om onze teams te ondersteunen bij datagedreven beslissingen. Je helpt bij het opzetten en onderhouden van dashboards en rapportages en denkt mee over het verbeteren van onze data-infrastructuur. Je werkt nauw samen met verschillende teams, zoals Sales, Operations en IT, en rapporteert aan de Business Controller.



Jouw verantwoordelijkheden



Inventariseren van de databehoeften bij business stakeholders en deze vertalen naar rapportages en dashboards.
Ontwikkelen en verbeteren van datamodellen in Power BI en andere BI-tools.
Ondersteunen bij de inrichting van ons Datawarehouse (DWH) in samenwerking met IT en Business Control.
Meedenken over de verdere automatisering van rapportages en processen.
Analyseren van data om inzichten te creëren die bijdragen aan betere strategische en operationele beslissingen.
Samenwerken met de business om data-driven werken verder te stimuleren.

WAAROM JE BIJ EUROFIBER CLOUD INFRA WILT WERKEN



Eurofiber Cloud Infra geeft je vertrouwen. Dat geeft je de vrijheid om zelf te bepalen hoe je je werk doet en samen met je collega's je doelen bereikt. Dat is onze leidraad. Jij zit in de driver's seat, dus hoe jij je persoonlijk en professioneel ontwikkelt is aan jou.



Als het gaat om het bereiken van je volledige potentieel, bieden we geen one-size-fits-all concept. We bieden je een hybride werkaanpak, waarbij we je de ondersteuning geven die je nodig hebt om uit te blinken.



Dit betekent:



Een salaris afgestemd op jouw talent, en een bonus;
Een gezonde work/life balance;
Actieve ontwikkeling van je vaardigheden en competenties door middel van verschillende opleidingsmogelijkheden;
29 vakantiedagen per jaar, op basis van een 40-urige werkweek.


Functie-eisen



Wat breng je mee?



HBO werk- en denkniveau, bij voorkeur in een relevante richting (bijv. Business Intelligence, Data Science, Informatica of Bedrijfskunde);
Enkele jaren ervaring opgedaan met BI-tools zoals Power BI (of vergelijkbare tools);
Kennis van SQL en datamodellering is een pre;
Affiniteit met de samenwerking tussen sales en operations;
Analytisch sterk, proactief en communicatief vaardig;
Interesse in data-analyse en de ambitie om verder te groeien binnen BI;
Ervaring met data-architectuur en governance is een plus, maar geen vereiste.


Aanvullende informatie



Over ons
Eurofiber Cloud Infra is een onderdeel van de Eurofiber groep en specialiseert zich op het gebied van cloud infrastructuur oplossingen en diensten zoals colocatie, connectiviteit, cloud, IaaS, Kubernetes en andere zaken. Wij helpen klanten met consultancy, implementatie en beheer van hun cloud infrastructuur en alle strategische keuzes die daarmee gepaard gaan. We werken met een sterk groeiend team van nu ongeveer 70 personen aan innovatieve cloudtechnologie voor klanten als Asics, TeamBlue, Meneba, verschillende gemeentes, andere overheidsinstellingen en financiële organisaties. Het team is multicultureel en bestaat uit enthousiaste professionals vol drive en ambitie. De cultuur is dynamisch en snel. Dit heeft geleid tot een innovatieve mindset en we blijven continu opzoek naar verbetering.




Klaar voor je volgende stap?
Iedereen heeft talent, en we zijn ervan overtuigd dat Eurofiber Cloud Infra een bedrijf is waar dat talent helemaal tot uiting kan komen. Heb jij interesse? Stuur dan jouw cv zo snel mogelijk.



Heb je nog vragen? Bel dan zeker naar (+31) 030-2428720.



DIVERSITEITSBELEID
Als motor van de digitale samenleving helpen we mensen hun potentieel ten volle te benutten. Bij Eurofiber Cloud Infra vormen waarden zoals diversiteit, gelijkwaardigheid en inclusie de kern van dat potentieel. Ons engagement op dat vlak is van cruciaal belang. We zijn ervan overtuigd dat verschillende standpunten binnen een team ons helpen om slimme oplossingen voor bedrijven, overheidsinstanties en non-profitorganisaties te ontwikkelen. Daarom willen we graag kennismaken met kandidaten die unieke vaardigheden, opinies en ideeën aan de dag leggen. Kandidaten die gewoon zichzelf zijn en kunnen samenwerken met en leren van anderen. Of je nu aan de slag gaat bij ons IT- of engineeringteam, we zijn altijd op zoek naar nieuwe collega's die onze kernwaarden hoog in het vaandel dragen en die elke dag opnieuw toepassen in hun werk.

Show more
HTML:
Eurofiber Cloud Infra biedt toonaangevende cloud infrastructuurdiensten en maakt deel uit van de Eurofiber Group. Wij bieden slimme, open en toekomstbestendige cloud infrastructuuroplossingen aan bedrijven, overheden en non-profitorganisaties.



Vacatureomschrijving

BI Specialist

Wil jij impact maken met data en bijdragen aan strategische inzichten binnen onze organisatie? Ben jij analytisch, leergierig en klaar om je BI-skills verder te ontwikkelen? Dan zoeken wij jou!

Jouw rol

Als BI Specialist werk je aan het analyseren, structureren en visualiseren van data om onze teams te ondersteunen bij datagedreven beslissingen. Je helpt bij het opzetten en onderhouden van dashboards en rapportages en denkt mee over het verbeteren van onze data-infrastructuur. Je werkt nauw samen met verschillende teams, zoals Sales, Operations en IT, en rapporteert aan de Business Controller.

Jouw verantwoordelijkheden

  • Inventariseren van de databehoeften bij business stakeholders en deze vertalen naar rapportages en dashboards.
  • Ontwikkelen en verbeteren van datamodellen in Power BI en andere BI-tools.
  • Ondersteunen bij de inrichting van ons Datawarehouse (DWH) in samenwerking met IT en Business Control.
  • Meedenken over de verdere automatisering van rapportages en processen.
  • Analyseren van data om inzichten te creëren die bijdragen aan betere strategische en operationele beslissingen.
  • Samenwerken met de business om data-driven werken verder te stimuleren.

WAAROM JE BIJ EUROFIBER CLOUD INFRA WILT WERKEN

Eurofiber Cloud Infra geeft je vertrouwen. Dat geeft je de vrijheid om zelf te bepalen hoe je je werk doet en samen met je collega's je doelen bereikt. Dat is onze leidraad. Jij zit in de driver's seat, dus hoe jij je persoonlijk en professioneel ontwikkelt is aan jou.

Als het gaat om het bereiken van je volledige potentieel, bieden we geen one-size-fits-all concept. We bieden je een hybride werkaanpak, waarbij we je de ondersteuning geven die je nodig hebt om uit te blinken.

Dit betekent:

  • Een salaris afgestemd op jouw talent, en een bonus;
  • Een gezonde work/life balance;
  • Actieve ontwikkeling van je vaardigheden en competenties door middel van verschillende opleidingsmogelijkheden;
  • 29 vakantiedagen per jaar, op basis van een 40-urige werkweek.

Functie-eisen

Wat breng je mee?

  • HBO werk- en denkniveau, bij voorkeur in een relevante richting (bijv. Business Intelligence, Data Science, Informatica of Bedrijfskunde);
  • Enkele jaren ervaring opgedaan met BI-tools zoals Power BI (of vergelijkbare tools);
  • Kennis van SQL en datamodellering is een pre;
  • Affiniteit met de samenwerking tussen sales en operations;
  • Analytisch sterk, proactief en communicatief vaardig;
  • Interesse in data-analyse en de ambitie om verder te groeien binnen BI;
  • Ervaring met data-architectuur en governance is een plus, maar geen vereiste.

Aanvullende informatie

Over ons
Eurofiber Cloud Infra is een onderdeel van de Eurofiber groep en specialiseert zich op het gebied van cloud infrastructuur oplossingen en diensten zoals colocatie, connectiviteit, cloud, IaaS, Kubernetes en andere zaken. Wij helpen klanten met consultancy, implementatie en beheer van hun cloud infrastructuur en alle strategische keuzes die daarmee gepaard gaan. We werken met een sterk groeiend team van nu ongeveer 70 personen aan innovatieve cloudtechnologie voor klanten als Asics, TeamBlue, Meneba, verschillende gemeentes, andere overheidsinstellingen en financiële organisaties. Het team is multicultureel en bestaat uit enthousiaste professionals vol drive en ambitie. De cultuur is dynamisch en snel. Dit heeft geleid tot een innovatieve mindset en we blijven continu opzoek naar verbetering.


Klaar voor je volgende stap?
Iedereen heeft talent, en we zijn ervan overtuigd dat Eurofiber Cloud Infra een bedrijf is waar dat talent helemaal tot uiting kan komen. Heb jij interesse? Stuur dan jouw cv zo snel mogelijk.

Heb je nog vragen? Bel dan zeker naar (+31) 030-2428720.

DIVERSITEITSBELEID
Als motor van de digitale samenleving helpen we mensen hun potentieel ten volle te benutten. Bij Eurofiber Cloud Infra vormen waarden zoals diversiteit, gelijkwaardigheid en inclusie de kern van dat potentieel. Ons engagement op dat vlak is van cruciaal belang. We zijn ervan overtuigd dat verschillende standpunten binnen een team ons helpen om slimme oplossingen voor bedrijven, overheidsinstanties en non-profitorganisaties te ontwikkelen. Daarom willen we graag kennismaken met kandidaten die unieke vaardigheden, opinies en ideeën aan de dag leggen. Kandidaten die gewoon zichzelf zijn en kunnen samenwerken met en leren van anderen. Title: Junior Consultant Data & Samenwerking
Place: Capelle aan den IJssel, South Holland, Netherlands
Description:
Over ons

Bij Optimale Samenwerking ondersteunen we organisaties in de zorg, het sociaal domein en de overheid met innovatieve, datagedreven oplossingen. Wij combineren technologie, Data Science en menselijke interactie om complexe vraagstukken op te lossen op het gebied van samenwerking, strategie en organisatieontwikkeling.

Wij werken met geavanceerde platforms zoals INKIS AI Studio en INKIS IO Factory, waarmee we data-analyse, machine learning en business intelligence toepassen om impact te maken. Ons team is gedreven, deskundig en nauw op elkaar ingespeeld.

 

Jouw rol

Als Junior Consultant Data & Samenwerking werk je aan uiteenlopende projecten waarin data en technologie een centrale rol spelen. Binnen de projecten ondersteun je bij het analyseren van data, het opstellen van adviezen en het ontwikkelen van slimme technologische toepassingen voor klanten. Je komt te werken werken in een dynamische omgeving waarin je snel groeit en steeds meer verantwoordelijkheid krijgt. Jij denkt mee, zoekt naar slimme oplossingen en draagt bij aan het succes van onze projecten!

 

Wat ga je doen?

Analyseren en vertalen van data naar inzichten voor praktische oplossingen.
Ondersteunen bij adviestrajecten over strategie, samenwerking en organisatieontwikkeling.
Het faciliteren van workshops en bijeenkomsten met opdrachtgevers.
Rapporteren en presenteren van de resultaten aan klanten.




Wie ben jij?

Je hebt een afgeronde wo-opleiding in Technische Bedrijfskunde, Data Science of Bestuurskunde.
Je hebt affiniteit met data-analyse, machine learning of business intelligence.
Je bent analytisch sterk en weet complexe vraagstukken helder uit te leggen.
Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden: "zeg wat je doet en doe wat je zegt."
Je hebt een proactieve houding en wilt jezelf ontwikkelen in een dynamische omgeving.

 

Wat bieden wij?

Een uitdagende functie binnen een groeiend en dynamisch bedrijf.
Ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling en opleidingen.
Een marktconform salaris + bonusregeling.
Auto van de zaak + thuiswerkvergoeding.
Laptop.
Flexibele werktijden en hybride werken.
Een inspirerende werkomgeving met gedreven collega’s.

 

Enthousiast geworden?

Stuur je motivatiebrief en cv naar John Goede via j.goedee@optimalesamenwerking.nl.

Maak impact met data & samenwerking – Solliciteer nu!

Title: Analytics Expert
Description:
Are you our new colleague?

We’re looking for a Analytics Expert at Randstad Global

Diemen - Netherlands, hybrid, fulltime




BR&AF

The business risk and audit function (BR&AF) provides assurance and recommendations to the Executive Board and the Audit Committee on Randstad Group’s (risk) management, control and governance practices. Therefore the department facilitates in setting governance standards. It provides advice on internal control improvements, it conducts audits, special investigations and assignments worldwide on request of the Executive Board and Audit Committee. BR&AF’s responsibility includes the quarterly reporting based on: the risk and internal control self assessments, audit results, discussions on internal control weaknesses and analysis of the key risks reported throughout the company's management structure. This also substantiates the Group’s in-control statements.




The global function consists of team members operating through hubs spread over 4 continents. The team is organized in a matrix consisting of control & audit focus teams on business and functional areas (e.g. digital, talent, client, back office & shared service centers and fraud & forensics) and partners that are the linking pin to operating units (business risk & audit partners) with a global view. A support group is set up for professional practice, learning & development, quality improvement & methods, analytics and PMO.




Representatives of the different groups (Focus teams, BR&A Partners and support group) form the BR&AF core management team that reports to the Managing Director BR&AF.




how you will contribute

You are part of the Business Risk & Audit Function (BR&AF) that covers all business operations related to Clients, Talents and our (shared) Back-, Mid- and Front offices, as well as our Accounting & Reporting and other specialist functions like HR. With your data analytics experience you enhance BR&AF's delivery to management bringing insight on Randstad's in-control situation.




As analytics expert you:

support building and rolling out the BR&AF analytics roadmap.
perform technical data analytics, including data visualization, data reports, data cleansing scripts, and data validation as part audits, risk management, internal controls support and combined assurance projects and activities.
assist in taking the audit projects in Randstad to the next level through researching and evaluating new analytics concepts and technologies (e.g. generative AI/machine learning) in support of BR&F practices.
collaborate as an integrated part of audits teams in the definition and execution of analytics.
support non analytics professionals within the function growing their capabilities enabling them to leverage analytics more effectively.
are willing to travel. As the standard office locations for the BR&AF team are organized in hubs, like in the country mentioned, travelling is estimated to be about 20% to 30% of the job.




what you will be doing

as co-creator support the analytics lead in the development and roll out the data analytics roadmap
lead the build out of the control structures to ensure sustainable analytics technology including data retention and clean up logic
participate in risk assessments, periodic sampling, and data-driven root cause analysis.
perform data analysis procedures, including data profiling, data mining, trend analysis, and predictive modeling. Apply statistical techniques and visualization tools to analyze large volumes of data and identify patterns, anomalies, and potential audit risks.
perform data collection, clean, analyze and report processes from various internal and external applications and databases, as well as other data sources when necessary.
interpret the results of data analysis and provide meaningful insights to audit teams and BR&AF management.
review and validate data analytics work performed by audit teams.
identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions as needed.
act as a resource for colleagues with less expertise.




who will you work with

business risk & audit partners
partners/communities within applications operations and data management both at randstad global as well as in our operating companies
external co-source partners
IT security, data protection, information security and business continuity communities within the Randstad organization.
BR&AF stakeholders/clients within the business including local MT's, process and control owners




what you will bring

You bring a hands-on and in depth understanding of data science and analytics concepts and structures combined with a drive to develop and roll out impactful analytics. With your drive for results you are able to balance short term delivery needs with mid term needs for standardization and sustainability of solutions. You understand the people, process, and technology dilemma's that go into building out analytics and are able to translate this into practical business cases both within the risk & audit function as well as over other functions.




As an Analytics Expert you:

have minimum 8 years of relevant experience
have minimum a master degree in business information management, computer science, or Mathematics and related accreditation (e.g. CAP/CDMP/CISA/CISSP)
have level BEC B1/B2 or higher Business English preferably combined with proficiency in one of the following languages: Dutch, Spanish, French, Italian and /or German
have a strong independent mindset
are experienced in international stakeholder management & change
are an innovative thinker that challenges the status quo
have an agile and flexible working style and passion for on the job coaching and development
have a pragmatic, realistic yet ambitious vision on analytics
deliver on the roll out of analytics through the 3 pillars of people, process and technology.
integrate technological developments into practices (e.g. generative AI)
effectively connect and take people with different backgrounds allowing non analytics experts to take ownership of initiatives and results




your competencies

Within Randstad we defined the following Human Forward Leadership competencies:

delighting people: connect people (client, talent, employee, society), building strong client relationships and delivering client-centric solutions.
performing today: resourcefulness securing and developing resources effectively and efficiently.
leading change: manages ambiguity operating effectively, even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clear.
securing the future: drives vision and purpose painting a compelling picture of the vision and strategy that motivates others into action.
creating clarity: showing line of sight: making sense of complex, high quantity and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems and provides direction, is delegating and removing obstacles to get work done
courage to challenge: shows courage and confidence to speak up skillfully, challenging others even when they are confronted with resistance or unfamiliar circumstances
collaborates, reaches out, you excel in organizational sensitivity: manoeuvering comfortably through complex policy, process and people-related organizational dynamics recognizing the value that different perspectives and cultures bring to an organization




what’s in it for you

We put people at the heart of everything we do. Our employment conditions reflect this and are in accordance with the applicable (local) Randstad employment policies and related personnel guide.

We want our teams and talent to reflect the rich diversity of the societies we serve. We thrive for an environment of belonging, safety and confidence. So everyone can bring their whole selves to work and flourish. Learn more about equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging at randstad here.




people at the heart of everything we do

Working at Randstad is unlike working at any organization. Because at Randstad we put people at the heart of everything we do. This goes for our clients, our talent, our employees and society. We combine our passion for people with the power of today’s technologies. This helps us support people and organizations in realizing their true potential. We call this human forward.

Learn more about our mission, history and values on our website: www.randstad.com




If you recognize yourself in the profile above, we invite you to apply for this role. For more information you can reach out to our recruitment business partner: jennifer.roberts@randstadsourceright.co.uk




The recruitment procedure consists of a screening and at least two interviews. Later in the process, an (online) assessment and a job offer conversation take place.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
This is Worldline




Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.




The Opportunity




We're looking for a Business Analyst to provide insights across our multiple products, countries and large merchants. You’ll work within a freshly consolidated datalake in Azure in a growing international team. You will be able to make an immediate impact on our performance by transforming petabytes of data into clear, precise and relevant information.




Day-to-Day Responsibilities​




Working within a team of business analysts on weekly and monthly reporting in PowerBI
Writing SQL queries in Databricks to deliver various analyses
Helping identify anomalies in our performance and triggering conversations on potential fixes
Preparing visuals for compelling storytelling to various stakeholders across the organization
Simplifying some of our ways of working to ensure scalability




Who Are We Looking For




We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:




You have an eye for detail
You have an appetite for tackling problems both big and small
You have a knack for following through
You are keen to share your findings with others support our growth
You've got substantial knowledge of Power BI and SQL
Bonus points for experience with Databricks and/or Salesforce
You can communicate effectively to a wide variety of audiences







Perks & Benefits




At Worldline you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:

A rewarding salary
Opportunity to develop yourself in a rapidly growing and agile global organization.
Be part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide.
Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career







Shape the evolution.




We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.







Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com







We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.
