Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Acast

Since 2014, Acast has been building the world’s most valuable podcast marketplace, creating the technology that connects podcast creators, advertisers, and listeners. Its marketplace spans more than 140,000 podcasts, 3,300 advertisers, and one billion quarterly listens. Crucially, those listens are monetized wherever they happen—across any podcast app or listening platform.

About The Role

Join our team of business experts who are merging their business acumen with technical proficiency to equip our internal customers with the data, insights, and intelligence they need to enhance decision-making at Acast. We are on a journey to construct the "Acast BI Hub," a platform that will empower every Acast employee to access the data and insights they require, supported by GenAI-based reporting.

The ideal candidate will possess a unique blend of business understanding, technical skills, and communication abilities, and be passionate about using data to drive business success.

What You´ll Do


Data Handling and Optimization: Collaborate with a cross-functional team, including data engineers, product managers and other data analysts to design, implement, and maintain robust data pipelines and architectures that support the efficient processing and analysis of massive datasets generated by millions of daily listeners.
BI Requirement Fulfillment: Work closely with colleagues across various departments, including marketing, sales, and content, to understand their business intelligence needs and translate them into actionable insights and reports.
Data Interpretation and Analysis: Identify trends, changes and anomalies, providing actionable insights to customers to inform business decisions and strategies.
Ad Hoc Analysis: Conduct in-depth, exploratory analyses to investigate new or unusual data patterns, uncover root causes, and provide explanations to stakeholders.
Data Transformation and Preparation: Develop and implement data cleaning, transformation, and aggregation processes to ensure data is accurate, consistent, and ready for analysis and consumption by BI tools and dashboards.
Requirements Gathering: Engage directly with customers to gather and document their reporting requirements, ensuring a deep understanding of their business needs and priorities.
Predictive Modeling: Develop and implement statistical models to forecast business metrics, such as listener engagement, churn, and revenue, enabling proactive decision-making and resource allocation.
Growth Modeling: Design and implement data-driven models to understand and predict future growth trajectories, identify potential bottlenecks, and inform growth strategies and investment decisions.
Quality Assurance: Establish and maintain data quality standards and metrics, implement anomaly detection mechanisms, and continuously improve the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of datasets used for BI and reporting purposes.


Who You Are

You have a strong foundation in data analysis and are proficient in using tools such as SQL, DBT, Qlik, and Looker to extract, transform, and visualize data. Your experience in data modeling and ETL processes enables you to design and implement efficient data pipelines.

You are a proactive and self-directed individual who can take ownership of your work and drive projects forward independently. You are comfortable working autonomously and can manage your time and priorities effectively.

You possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills, allowing you to collaborate seamlessly with colleagues across different teams and departments. You are adept at building relationships, sharing insights, and presenting findings in a clear and concise manner. You are also open to feedback and willing to learn from others.

Where you will be

For this role you can be located anywhere in Sweden. Today, our team is entirely remote with team members spread across Malmö, Gothenburg, Stockholm and Poland. If you prefer to work from an office, you can do so if you’re based in or around Stockholm.

Culture

Acast is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin or any of the other wonderful characteristics that make us different.

Culture is our number one priority as a business. We believe people come first, and we work every day to enable autonomy, continuous improvement and bring out the best in people. We’re global and have remote teams, so it’s even more important that we strive for an open, inclusive and caring environment where everyone feels visible and welcome.

We consider ourselves a modern organization driven by strong values to create the best, most fulfilling and nurturing culture.

We very much look forward to finding the next great person to join our cause!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for a curious and collaborative Data Analyst to join our team and help turn data into direction.

As a Data Analyst, you’ll be at the heart of how we understand game performance and player behaviour. You’ll work closely with teams across the company — from game designers and producers to business leads — transforming data into insights that shape decisions.

You’ll have space to grow your skills, contribute your voice, and help us build better games and experiences for players everywhere.

Responsibilities:


Create, maintain and present dashboards in Tableau
Deliver regular reports on game and business performance
Dive into data to identify trends, spot opportunities, and solve problems
Join product and business team discussions as the go-to person for insights and recommendations



Requirements:


You’ve got experience with Tableau and know how to tell stories with data
You have basic Python or R skills, or you're keen to pick them up
You're comfortable presenting insights to different audiences — from analysts to creatives
You have a solid understanding of core statistical concepts
You’re curious, methodical, and collaborative — and you care about making work meaningful



Nice to have


Appreciation/interest for game design



Interview process:


30-minute introductory video call with a member of our Talent Acquisition team
60-minute video call with our Data and Insights Director and Head of Commercial
60-minute onsite interview (for those that are local) or video call with our Creative Marketing Director and a member from the design team.



About Starbreeze

At Starbreeze, we believe games are more than just entertainment—they’re a way to bring people together. From the pulse-pounding, cooperative heists of PAYDAY to our upcoming Dungeons & Dragons adventure, we create experiences that thrive on teamwork, strategy, and the thrill of emergent gameplay. Our mission is to build vibrant games that offer infinite replayability, allowing players to forge their own stories and adventures together.

Every Starbreeze employee helps shape this vision. Whether you’re crafting intricate game worlds or developing the systems that bring players together, your creativity and passion will drive the future of cooperative gaming. Join us in our journey to create innovative, immersive experiences that unite players and redefine what gaming can achieve.

Starbreeze values diversity and inclusion, and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome you as who you are, no matter where you are from or what games you play. If there are preparations or accommodations that we can make to help ensure that you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

What more do we offer?


Competitive salaries with annual reviews, generous occupational pension, and referral bonuses.
Comprehensive benefits, including private medical insurance, annual wellness benefit, and 30 days of paid vacation.
Unique perks such as free monthly office massages, weekly D&D club and other fun activities!



Sound good? Then we can’t wait to see your CV and look forward to meeting you. We recommend that you apply as soon as possible as selection and interviews are held continuously. Please submit your CV and cover letter in English.

Recruitment agencies may not submit CVs through this website or directly to hiring managers. Starbreeze Entertainment does not accept unsolicited recruitment agency CVs, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with us.

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Everything we do, starts with you. Together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. To enable everyone’s future financial growth.




We are looking for a Data Analyst (m/f/d)

(unlimited, full-time) Join our team at our location in Berlin, Verl, Baden-Baden, Oslo or Stockholm – hybrid working conditions available.




Key Responsibilities:

Explore large datasets, evaluate the data quality and model data
Apply statistical methods to understand consumer behavioral patterns relevant for product development and operational efficiency
Analyze problems to understand their root cause
Work with Data Scientists and Data Engineers to build and implement analytical solutions
Collaborate on data-related projects
Visualize data and turn data into stories
Derive actionable insights, provide decision support, and make recommendations based on data-driven insights
Consult business units and functional units, such as product or commercial teams in data related questions
Drive, manage and lead data related projects while fostering a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organization.




Your Profile:

Master/MBA degree in numerate subject (e.g. Data Science, Mathematics, Informatics, Economics, Natural Science or Engineering)
3+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis roles within Data & Analytics solutions
Proficient in a programming language such as SQL, Python or R
Experience in cluster analysis, machine learning
Understanding of how to perform data extraction and manipulation
Advanced in collecting, organizing, analysing, and disseminating significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to identify issues, structure and conduct necessary analysis, and draw well-informed conclusions
Consulting skills, especially strong ability to provide insights and recommendations
Extraordinary communication skills to effectively convey complex information and collaborate with diverse teams
Ability to balance multiple priorities, be detail-oriented, work independently, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Excellent Team player




Nice if you have:

Experience within the payments, risk, debt collection or factoring space
Experience with modern data stacks, preferably Databricks
Experience in quantitative research

#EUR33




Thrive at Riverty with great benefits:

Immerse yourself in a welcoming, trust-filled atmosphere as part of our agile teams and explore the fantastic opportunities within the Bertelsmann Group.
Put your health first by engaging in a variety of supported sports and leisure activities – it's important to us!
Empower your growth and professional development with Riverty’s training sessions and customized development plans. Together, we'll learn, evolve, and achieve success.
Know that you're appreciated with plenty of employee benefits & discounts just for you.
Experience the best of both worlds with our flexible working arrangements, which let you mix on-site teamwork and remote work to create the perfect professional experience that suits your life.

Please note, benefits could be different depending on location or agreement details, and they may alter over time. We'd be delighted to explore these benefits in greater depth during an interview.

About Us

We are Riverty. And we believe everyone should be in control of their financials. We ask you to join in. Because together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. We build on experience of more than 50 years. More than 5,000 people in 13 countries drive our company and contribution to society. And we have their backs. We make sure they feel supported and included: Across teams, across physical and invisible borders and across the globe.

Our world is growing. And we’re here. Together, we’re finding smarter, simpler, seamlessly connected ways to manage money. By leveraging data and financial technology, our holistic solutions provide flexible payments, smarter accounting, and fair debt collection, all aimed at fostering everyone's financial growth.

And. Everything we do, starts with you. Join us and let‘s build a more sustainable financial future, together.

We keep what we promise:

More information on riverty.com/careers. Are you already convinced? Then we look forward to receiving your online application – with just a few clicks.

We look forward to applications from candidates who contribute to the diversity of our company. We relate diversity in particular to the dimensions of cultural or social origin, religion, age, disability, gender and sexual identity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join us in our mission to deliver mobility data insights that empower people to do more with less! At ABAX, we're transforming the telematics industry in Europe. We help businesses with mobile workforces work smarter by reducing costs, optimizing operations, and improving sustainability, efficiency, and safety.




As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in transforming raw data into actionable insights that shape our strategic direction. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs, analyze complex datasets, and present your findings to stakeholders at all levels.




Some of the things you will be working on:

Gather, clean, and analyze large datasets from various sources using statistical methods and data visualization tools.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to communicate key performance metrics and trends to stakeholders.
Collaborate with departments such as finance, marketing, and operations to identify opportunities for data-driven improvements.
Utilize advanced analytical techniques to identify patterns, predict outcomes, and provide strategic recommendations.
Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies in the data analytics field to continuously improve processes and tools.




Essential Skills:

Advanced SQL Proficiency – Expertise in querying, optimizing, and managing large datasets using BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake, etc.
Statistical & Predictive Analytics – Strong proficiency in Python, R, etc., for advanced data modeling, forecasting, and analytics.
Business Intelligence & Data Visualization – Experience with industry-leading tools such as Tableau, Looker Studio, Qlik, Power BI, etc., to create insightful reports and dashboards.




We believe you have:

A bachelor’s or master’s degree in Engineering, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
3+ years of relevant experience in data analysis.




Other Information:

Start date: As soon as possible / As agreed
Work extent: Full-time
Location: Stockholm or Larvik




Our Hiring Process:

The Hiring Managers will review your application profile. The first interview will be conducted by our Talent Acquisition Specialist.
If we decide to move forward, we will send you a recruitment test from our supplier Alva Labs for objective screening.
Interviews on Teams and/or in person, for a mutual understanding of the benefits of working together.
Possibly a case/problem set, when relevant.
Digital reference check through our supplier RefApp.
Please note that a background check may be conducted simultaneously with the reference check.
Offer and celebration!




Background Check and Reference Verification:

Successful employment is contingent upon ABAX receiving satisfactory references.

As part of our hiring process, we perform a digital reference check through RefApp, an advanced online solution for managing this procedure.

Please be aware that a background check may be conducted simultaneously with the reference check.




Equal Opportunities:

At ABAX, we are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment for all our colleagues. This commitment extends to ensuring that our recruitment practices and processes are as inclusive as possible. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to join us in strengthening our focus on equality and diversity in the workplace.




About ABAX:

We operate across Europe, with over 350 employees working from our facilities in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, the Netherlands, Belgium, Poland, and the UK. Our Head Office is in Larvik, Norway.

Show more
HTML:
Join us in our mission to deliver mobility data insights that empower people to do more with less! At ABAX, we're transforming the telematics industry in Europe. We help businesses with mobile workforces work smarter by reducing costs, optimizing operations, and improving sustainability, efficiency, and safety.


As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in transforming raw data into actionable insights that shape our strategic direction. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs, analyze complex datasets, and present your findings to stakeholders at all levels.


Some of the things you will be working on:

  • Gather, clean, and analyze large datasets from various sources using statistical methods and data visualization tools.
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to communicate key performance metrics and trends to stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with departments such as finance, marketing, and operations to identify opportunities for data-driven improvements.
  • Utilize advanced analytical techniques to identify patterns, predict outcomes, and provide strategic recommendations.
  • Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies in the data analytics field to continuously improve processes and tools.


Essential Skills:

  • Advanced SQL Proficiency – Expertise in querying, optimizing, and managing large datasets using BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake, etc.
  • Statistical & Predictive Analytics – Strong proficiency in Python, R, etc., for advanced data modeling, forecasting, and analytics.
  • Business Intelligence & Data Visualization – Experience with industry-leading tools such as Tableau, Looker Studio, Qlik, Power BI, etc., to create insightful reports and dashboards.


We believe you have:

  • A bachelor’s or master’s degree in Engineering, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
  • 3+ years of relevant experience in data analysis.


Other Information:

  • Start date: As soon as possible / As agreed
  • Work extent: Full-time
  • Location: Stockholm or Larvik


Our Hiring Process:

  1. The Hiring Managers will review your application profile. The first interview will be conducted by our Talent Acquisition Specialist.
  2. If we decide to move forward, we will send you a recruitment test from our supplier Alva Labs for objective screening.
  3. Interviews on Teams and/or in person, for a mutual understanding of the benefits of working together.
  4. Possibly a case/problem set, when relevant.
  5. Digital reference check through our supplier RefApp.
  6. Please note that a background check may be conducted simultaneously with the reference check.
  7. Offer and celebration!


Background Check and Reference Verification:

Successful employment is contingent upon ABAX receiving satisfactory references.

As part of our hiring process, we perform a digital reference check through RefApp, an advanced online solution for managing this procedure.

Please be aware that a background check may be conducted simultaneously with the reference check.


Equal Opportunities:

At ABAX, we are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment for all our colleagues. This commitment extends to ensuring that our recruitment practices and processes are as inclusive as possible. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to join us in strengthening our focus on equality and diversity in the workplace.


About ABAX:

We operate across Europe, with over 350 employees working from our facilities in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, the Netherlands, Belgium, Poland, and the UK. Our Head Office is in Larvik, Norway.

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?

Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.


Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


As a Staff Data analyst in the Messaging team, you’ll be responsible for the team's quantitative insights. From understanding our data, identifying problems, to working with product, tech and design on hypothesizing solutions. You’ll be the driver of our experimentation and learning efforts. Messaging team sits at the very core of Truecaller experience, so you’ll have plenty of opportunities to work with other teams and the executives.

The impact you will create:


Understanding Truecaller's data, particularly related to the Messaging team.
Taking ownership of quantitative insights for the Messaging team, playing a crucial role in product development.
Defining experiments, overseeing their setup, and analyzing their results to drive decision-making.
Developing and maintaining key performance indicators (KPIs) for the team, ensuring their tracking, reliability, and reporting.
Creating data pipelines and dashboards to measure the team's KPIs and effectively communicate insights to both the team and leadership.
Coaching and mentoring the team on experimentation and data-driven product development processes, fostering a culture of data-driven decision-making.


What you bring in:


6-10 years experience in Data Analytics
Experience in using SQL to extract, transform and analyse data
Experience in data visualisation tools like Looker (preferred), QlikSense, Tableau, or PowerBI
Experience in mentoring, coaching and evangelsing about data in product development
Experience in digging into different data sources to understand why specific customer behaviours happen
Fluent in spoken and written English


It would be great if you also have:


Big data query tools (we use BigQuery).
Experience with data from mobile applications.


Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/

Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.

This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

We only accept applications in English.

What we offer:


A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There is something for everyone!


Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We Care, We Challenge, We Commit, We Collaborate

Join Scrive and be part of an international, fast-growing company headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden. Collaborate with smart, caring, and driven colleagues across Europe as we shape the Scrive story. 🚀




The opportunity

We’re now expanding our Data & Analytics capabilities and are looking for a versatile Data Analyst to join our small but impactful team. In this role, you’ll take the lead in modernizing our reporting infrastructure, enhancing data pipelines, and acting as a critical link between data and the rest of the organization.




You’ll work closely with stakeholders across Revenue, Product, Finance, Development, and more, with the shared goal of unlocking smarter decision-making through data. This is a hands-on role where you’ll help shape our tools, processes, and the way we work with data—while ensuring accuracy, clarity, and accessibility every step of the way.




The role can be based fully remote anywhere in EU, or hybrid/onsite at any our offices (Stockholm, Copenhagen, Amsterdam, Berlin, Oslo or Brno). You will report to the Director of R&D.




What you will do

Drive the migration of data reporting from Count to Python-based Streamlit applications
Maintain, improve, and troubleshoot existing reports during the transition period
Collaborate closely with stakeholders to understand business needs and define data requirements
Build and maintain a list of team-supported reports with clear ownership and expectations
Support better product tracking by implementing and promoting data contracts
Proactively identify data collection opportunities and work with developers to capture the right events
Refactor and document datasets to improve reliability, consistency, and usability




What we’re looking for

To thrive in this role, you’re a problem-solver who enjoys building sustainable, scalable data solutions and translating data into insights that matter. You are structured, communicative, and curious.




We expect you to bring:




3+ years of experience in data analysis, engineering, or a related field
Proficiency with SQL and data modeling concepts
Strong Python programming skills, particularly with data manipulation libraries (Pandas)
Experience with interactive dashboard development (Streamlit experience is a plus)
Ability to translate business questions into data requirements
Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical audiences
Self-motivated with a proactive approach to identifying data opportunities
EU Residency or work permit




🌟 Bonus points if you have:

Background in data governance or data quality initiatives
Experience with managing a Data pipeline
Possibility to work hybrid/on-site at any of our offices
Knowledge of best practices in data documentation and metadata management
experience with Software development in a team (releases, deployment, versioning, reviews)
Feeling for User Experience
Experience with GitHub Actions, CI/CD




Our Tech Stack

Data Warehousing: Snowflake
BI Tools: Count.co, Tableau
Data Processing: DuckDB, dbt
Workflow Orchestration: Prefect
Collaboration: Jira, Confluence, Git, G Suite




Don’t meet every single requirement? Apply anyway! Studies show that women and people from underrepresented groups are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every qualification. At Scrive, we value diverse perspectives and encourage anyone who is excited about this role to apply.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Business Performance
Description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.




About the Business Performance Analytics team

The Business Performance Analytics team supports key business stakeholders such as Operations, Commercial, and Finance. Our mission is to empower data-driven decision-making by delivering actionable insights that drive merchant growth, customer satisfaction, and operational efficiency. We continuously strive to improve analytics capabilities, optimize resources, and foster a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organization.

About the role

As a Senior Data Analyst at Trustly, you will look at the breadth of our data with an analytical mindset. Through your analytics skills and proficiency in handling data, you will uncover patterns and provide data-driven answers to complex strategic challenges. Depending on the stakeholder’s requests, you will choose adequate solutions to present your insights, ranging from dashboards in our BI tool to deep-dive analysis. In close collaboration with our Data Foundation team, you will be involved in building a strong and reliable data platform that will support the analytics needs.




What you’ll do
Take full ownership of end-to-end analytical projects, from defining objectives with stakeholders to delivering actionable insights and recommendations
Perform in-depth data analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that drive business growth and efficiency
Choose adequate analytical methods and tools to convey complex findings in a clear and concise manner
Collaborate closely with the Data Foundation team to ensure the reliability and scalability of our data infrastructure
Continuously and proactively identify opportunities to improve our analytics capabilities 
Actively participate in establishing the data-driven culture at Trustly
Communicate complex findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders





Who you are
Master’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field
At least 3 years of experience in the analytics field; Experience within payments, fintech, or a high-growth tech company is a plus 
Strong ability to work independently and take ownership of complex analytical challenges
Solid and broad analytical skill set
Advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis
Experience with BI tools such as Qlik Sense or Tableau
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Thrives in a fast-growing, dynamic environment and enjoys working cross-functionally








Our Fantastic Benefits

🌴 20 to 30 days of holiday (depending on location) to support a healthy work-life balance

🥳 Monthly team outing allowance to enjoy social events with your colleagues

👶 Parental leave top-up additional support for new parents

🥐 Daily breakfast and on-site perks to make your workday smoother

💚 Well being support our health allowance covers gym memberships, massages, and much more to help you feel your best

PLUS additional benefits designed to enhance your work-life experience!

Shape Your Role and Make an Impact

Join a dynamic environment where you can take ownership, drive change, and continuously embrace new challenges. We’re looking for dedicated and highly motivated individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy collaborating across different areas of the organisation.

If your skills and experience align with this role, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now and submit your CV in English.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Rovio is part of the SEGA family and world famous for our flagship IP Angry Birds - want to know more about Rovio as an employer? Click here.

Data is at the heart of everything we do at Rovio. It enables us to continuously improve our games and provide incredible experiences for the millions of users. All of this data is only valuable if it can be used to guide our day to day operations and the mission of the Data and Analytics craft is to turn that raw data into actionable insights.

We are now looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our flagship Angry Birds 2 game in the Stockholm studio. Coming into this role, you will build an understanding of the game and different business levers and use that knowledge to build new game features, optimise the existing ones and to structure vague problem statements into testable hypothesis. You will be working as a part of a feature development pod, supporting it as a dedicated resource.

The team is located in our studio in the centre of Stockholm and works in a hybrid mode with weekly onsite presence. Currently not based in Sweden? No problem at all, we will help you with the relocation and work permit if needed!

You will have impact and fun at work by:


Working with the team members of your pod, participating in the end to end process of new feature development from planning, research and testing to launch and post launch evaluation
Bringing an objective perspective and recommendations to all phases of decision making, leveraging your technical skills to mine raw data for valuable information
Constantly designing and running in-game A/B test experiments, helping the team to find options leading to better game monetization performance and higher audience satisfaction
Creating dashboards and reports to help the game team understand your findings
Proactively working with data exploration and looking for opportunities to improve gameplay experience
Working closely with peer Data Analysts, Product Managers and Designers and Producers to continuously improve how we are interpreting game metrics and making decisions
Coaching and sharing best practices between colleagues in the data craft and whole game teams


Experience and skills we are looking for:


High proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python or R
Solid understanding of statistics (hypothesis testing, regression, analysing bias)
Experience in product analysis and experiments design, including A/B testing
Excellent presentation and collaboration skills with proven ability to present data and provide actionable recommendations to senior stakeholders
Prior experience as an analyst in mobile games or apps with large audiences
Passion for mobile games and an understanding of what makes a successful feature


Please apply with your CV in English. We look forward to meeting you!

We welcome applicants to use the name they want to be addressed by in the application form, regardless of whether it is their legal name.

At Rovio, we are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities or conditions in our working environment and job application procedures. We are committed to continuously improving workplace accessibility. If you have any questions before applying, please write to us at recruitment@rovio.com.

What to expect when you join us

Meet the Rovians

Hiring process at Rovio

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Rovio

Title: Data Analyst / Engineer
Description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.

Job Responsibilities

Today this team consists of four data engineers, mainly focusing on the back-end operations. You will be complementing the team by focusing more on the front-end part of the operations while also supporting the Product Owner communicating and onboard users, meanwhile also understand their needs to ensure those are being reflected in our roadmap. Our team is a front-runner on enabling data-driven development at Scania and you can be a key player in forming that journey by:



Facilitating engaging demo sessions to showcase and explaining the latest features, ensuring users have a clear understanding of their benefits.
Supporting internal customers (e.g., mechanical engineers, software developers, system owners) by helping them leverage their data through suitable tools, methods, and models tailored for their specific use case.
Assisting the product owner in identifying use cases and refining the product by incorporating insights from customer feedback sessions.
Providing support for cross-referenced data contextualization and automated analytics.
Enabling shorter feedback loops for product and embedded SW development.



Who You Are

Technical curiosity is important, and you enjoy sharing newfound knowledge with team members and other peers. You have a customer-first mindset, and you can adjust your communication to the knowledge level of your customer.

With a creative approach to problem-solving, you are able to find solutions to existing use cases and can identify new use cases without relying on a pre-defined problem.

You see the benefits of working with a data-driven approach and encourage other people to realize the possibilities of this way of working.

Relevant background



MSc or higher in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, or similar.
Proficiency in Python and SQL, meritorious with experience of MATLAB.
Experience in relational databases, with hands-on experience in Snowflake.
Solid understanding of software development principles, including coding standards, testing and deployment practices.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with team members and stakeholders.



Merit:



Experience working in the automotive industry.
Experience with working with analyzing millisecond time-resolved data or other large-scale tabular data sources.
Experience in an analytic role.



This Is Us

Our team aims to provide seamless and secure access to logger data for sustainable data driven development allowing TRATON to have best transport solutions in the world.

Our department is driving continuous, data-driven innovation to create real value for our customers. By building a modular, software-defined vehicle and solution platform, we’re transforming the transport system — and we’re doing it together with the combined strengths of TRATON and our global partners

Scania Offers

We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.

Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.

Application

Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.

Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-04-24. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.

We look forward to your application!


Show more

Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Title: Analytical Consultant
Description:
Job Description

We are currently searching for an Analytical Consultant for the Customer Success, Industry Insights team in Stockholm, Sweden.

NIQ Customer Success team is focusing on building great customer experience by offering insights on category development and consumer buying behavior, in a timely and consistent manner. This role drives loyalty and empowerment by enhancing our customers' use of our data and tools through specialty expertise and engagement.

If you wish to work in a truly global company with an ambitious and positive work environment and a high focus on self-development, this position will be a perfect fit for you. As an Analytical Consultant you work with client support of any data and platform related issues as well as business solution-driven analyses, presentations and recommendations for one of today’s leading global FMCG companies.

Responsibilities


Improve the customer engagement and satisfaction of your assigned client by offering outstanding client support including data platform and analytical support
Develop valuable business issue analyses and category presentations
Deliver insights and recommendations to your client based on your analytical work
Generate sales leads based on your knowledge about your client’s business
Train your client in NIQ’s new cloud-based data platform Discover to increase their understanding and usage of the tool
Participate actively in building a positive and engaging team culture in our Nordic team


The role is based in our Stockholm office and reports to the Nordics Customer Success Leader. You will be part of a team of eight team members in total.

Qualifications


First and foremost a burning desire and ability to create and drive a commercial analytical base for identifying what's next for your client.
We expect 2-3 years of experience in the FMCG industry within business analysis, market research and/or category management
A commercial degree in Economics with proven graduation results
Strong Business English knowledge, both verbal and written and fluent in Swedish
Advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills are a clear advantage
Experience with conducting presentations and good communication skills.


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst till ICA Sverige
Description:
Vill du vara med och driva datadrivna beslut genom analys och visualisering? Som Data Analyst på ICA Sverige får du arbeta med en av Sveriges största databaser och skapa insikter som påverkar affärsstrategier. Här får du kombinera teknisk skicklighet med affärsförståelse och bidra till att utveckla innovativa lösningar inom dataanalys.

Om jobbet som Data Analyst  

Teamet du kommer jobba i består av ca 30 fantastiska Data Analyst kollegor och tillhör vår Data & Analytics funktion i Solna, men du kommer också arbeta i ett leveransteam med mixade data & analytics roller där man tillsammans stöttar ett av ICAs sponsorsområden – i detta fall Sortiment och Inköp.

  

Du som Data Analyst utgör en kritisk faktor när vi nu tar ICAs datadrivna arbete till nya nivåer och tvärs hela bolaget. I den här tjänsten kommer du att få möjlighet att arbeta med en av Sveriges största databaser och utvecklas inom analytiska metoder tillsammans med skickliga, likasinnade kollegor. Du kommer att arbeta med hela värdekedjan inom analys – allt från att definiera behov, samla in, bearbeta och modellera data till visualisering och kommunikation av resultaten. Du kommer att samla data från olika källor och kombinera dessa för att skapa nya möjligheter till insikter och beslut. Vi arbetar med en modern tech stack som bl.a. inkluderar GCP, BigQuery, dbt och Tableau för att skapa innovativa lösningar inom dataanalys.

 

Är du den vi söker?

Vi söker just nu en Data Analyst som har jobbat minst 3 år i en liknande roll. Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av och är trygg med att utveckla i SQL och är van med att arbeta med stora datamängder och kombinerar data från olika källor. Vi ser även att du har erfarenhet av Tableau eller liknande BI visualiseringsverktyg. Det är ett plus om du har erfarenhet av GCP, Looker studio, GitHub, BigQuery och Python.

För att trivas på ICA ser vi att du är en affärsmässig och ansvarstagande person som har en god förmåga att arbeta både detaljorienterat och inta ett helikopterperspektiv. Du har lätt för att inspirera och coacha andra i det du brinner för - data data data! För dig är ingen fråga för stor eller för liten och du räds inte att själv söka svar på frågor i de djupaste av datalager. 

För att vara aktuell för denna roll måste du tala svenska och engelska obehindrat.

Vad händer nu?

Frågor om tjänsten besvaras av rekryterande chef Matilda Davidsson 076 861 77 81, och frågor om processen besvaras av ansvarig rekryterare, Klara Himmelstrand på 072 050 78 44.   

Ansök så snart som möjligt, då vi gör löpande urval, dock senast 21/4.  

Vi ska spegla våra kunder såväl som samhället i stort och är beroende av medarbetare med olika kompetenser. Vi strävar efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund och värdesätter den kunskap och erfarenhet det medför. Vi värnar om goda förutsättningar för ett hållbart arbetsliv för våra medarbetare med god arbetsmiljö och möjlighet till ständig utveckling. Vi tillämpar kompetensbaserad rekrytering. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.
Show more

Vad händer nu?

Frågor om tjänsten besvaras av rekryterande chef Matilda Davidsson 076 861 77 81, och frågor om processen besvaras av ansvarig rekryterare, Klara Himmelstrand på 072 050 78 44.   

Ansök så snart som möjligt, då vi gör löpande urval, dock senast 21/4.  

Vi ska spegla våra kunder såväl som samhället i stort och är beroende av medarbetare med olika kompetenser. Vi strävar efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund och värdesätter den kunskap och erfarenhet det medför. Vi värnar om goda förutsättningar för ett hållbart arbetsliv för våra medarbetare med god arbetsmiljö och möjlighet till ständig utveckling. Vi tillämpar kompetensbaserad rekrytering. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.

Title: Analytiker
Description:
Är du student i slutskedet av din kandidat- eller masterutbildning och söker ett utvecklande extrajobb? Är du vass på att samla information & redovisa den? Vill du testa på något nytt?




Vi på Stellar erbjuder nämligen en unik möjlighet att hjälpa oss med dataanalys och research inom olika projekt. 




Om oss

Stellar accelererar företags lönsamhet genom digital marknadsföring. Från första kontraktet till lojala kunder – vi är med genom hela kundresan. För första gången samlar vi spetskompetenser inom CRM, analys, kreativt innehåll och försäljning under ett och samma tak. Våra experter samarbetar tillsammans för att attrahera, konvertera och bygga långsiktig kundlojalitet.  




Om rollen

Hos oss kommer du att arbeta med varierande projekt vid behov tillsammans med våra analytiker. Arbetsuppgifterna kan exempelvis inkludera:

Analys och sammanställning av insikter från intervjudata.
Beräkning av kundbasens livstidsvärde.
Implementering av maskininlärningsmodeller för att förutse marknadstrender.
Analys av marknadsresearch.
Skapande av nya datakällor och databaser utifrån kundens behov, exempelvis genom intervjuer och research.




Kvalifikationer

Vi söker dig som har:

Erfarenhet av programmering med fokus på statistisk analys (ex. Python, R, Matlab)
Kompetens inom dataanalys och paketering i Office-paketet (Excel, PowerPoint)
Erfarenhet av databashantering (ex. AWS, BigQuery) och analys i verktyg som Power BI, Azure, Qlik och Google Analytics
Kunskap om avancerade matematiska modeller, statistiska metoder och datahantering
Förmåga att identifiera mönster i stora datamängder, formulera hypoteser och visualisera insikter med relevanta metoder och modeller.




Anställningen

Anställningen är kontraktsbaserad, och projekt fördelas utifrån efterfrågan.




Ansökan

Låter detta intressant? Ansök nu! Vi rekryterar löpande. 




Frågor?

Mejla oss på hello@wearestellar.se återkopplar vi inom kort. 




Med vänliga hälsningar,

Team Stellar

Show more
HTML:
Är du student i slutskedet av din kandidat- eller masterutbildning och söker ett utvecklande extrajobb? Är du vass på att samla information & redovisa den? Vill du testa på något nytt?


Vi på Stellar erbjuder nämligen en unik möjlighet att hjälpa oss med dataanalys och research inom olika projekt. 


Om oss

Stellar accelererar företags lönsamhet genom digital marknadsföring. Från första kontraktet till lojala kunder – vi är med genom hela kundresan. För första gången samlar vi spetskompetenser inom CRM, analys, kreativt innehåll och försäljning under ett och samma tak. Våra experter samarbetar tillsammans för att attrahera, konvertera och bygga långsiktig kundlojalitet.  


Om rollen

Hos oss kommer du att arbeta med varierande projekt vid behov tillsammans med våra analytiker. Arbetsuppgifterna kan exempelvis inkludera:

  • Analys och sammanställning av insikter från intervjudata.
  • Beräkning av kundbasens livstidsvärde.
  • Implementering av maskininlärningsmodeller för att förutse marknadstrender.
  • Analys av marknadsresearch.
  • Skapande av nya datakällor och databaser utifrån kundens behov, exempelvis genom intervjuer och research.


Kvalifikationer

Vi söker dig som har:

  • Erfarenhet av programmering med fokus på statistisk analys (ex. Python, R, Matlab)
  • Kompetens inom dataanalys och paketering i Office-paketet (Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Erfarenhet av databashantering (ex. AWS, BigQuery) och analys i verktyg som Power BI, Azure, Qlik och Google Analytics
  • Kunskap om avancerade matematiska modeller, statistiska metoder och datahantering
  • Förmåga att identifiera mönster i stora datamängder, formulera hypoteser och visualisera insikter med relevanta metoder och modeller.


Anställningen

Anställningen är kontraktsbaserad, och projekt fördelas utifrån efterfrågan.


Ansökan

Låter detta intressant? Ansök nu! Vi rekryterar löpande. 


Frågor?

Mejla oss på hello@wearestellar.se återkopplar vi inom kort. 


Med vänliga hälsningar,

Team Stellar

Title: Working Students - Data Science
Description:
Om tjänsten

Would you like to work for Vattenfall, one of Europe’s leading energy companies with trading activities in the global energy markets? Do you want to contribute to the success of the trading function using your analytical capabilities, programming skills, and commercial comprehension? In that case this student job could be the right one for you.

For our office in Stockholm we are looking for 1-2 Working Students Data Science (m/f/d) in the Trading Analysis & Algorithms department.

The Trading Analysis & Algorithms department within the Business Unit (BU) Trading works closely with the trading desks and takes the leading role in providing market insights, (fundamental and quan­titative) analysis, and ultimately commercial decision support across all commodity areas. As part of the department, the Algorithmic Trading desk works closely with the other trading desks and the Algo Infrastructure team and takes the leading role in algorithmic trading and automated trade execution across BU Trading from the intraday to term horizon.

Your main tasks and responsibilities as Working Student Data Science:


Supporting the energy traders and trading analysts in
Maintaining data feeds and pipelines for market or fundamental data
Identifying, reviewing, and integrating (new) information and sources/feeds for market or fundamental data, e.g., building web scrapers or data quality monitoring tools
Visualizing data and analyses in dashboards
Tackling programming challenges in Python
Further developing and automating routines, procedures, and applications for analysis-related information and data flows
Further developing the fundamental and mathematical market modelling, incl. utilizing machine learning approaches
Conducting commercially relevant quantitative analyses by using advanced analytics
Be part of the Trading Analysis & Algorithms department and contribute to its analysis output.


Din bakgrund

Our ideal Working Student Data Science:


Student enrolled at a university in a quantitative subject like data science, statistics, computer science, engineering or natural sciences – with a remaining duration of studies of at least 1 year and a willingness to work primarily from our office (home office possible occasionally)
Strong programming (esp. Python), statistical, and analytical skills
Ability to work with large, complex data sets in various formats
Knowledge of Git and Azure DevOps advantageous but not required
Good English language skills (both written and spoken)
Strong communication skills with the ability to communicate with various internal stakeholders and the willingness to share knowledge
Result oriented, independent, and structured working method with high reliability and readiness to take on responsibility
Proactive team player with eagerness to learn.


Mer information

Our offer

This is an excellent opportunity for ambitious and talented students who wants to gain experience in the commodity business and data science field with a challenging and changeable student job within a leading company in its field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues.

Our organization

Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 21,000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes, and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We now want to make fossil-free living possible within one generation. To be able to reach this ambitious goal we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission – people like you.

Business Area (BA) Markets maximises the value of Vattenfall’s portfolio by optimising and dis­patching, hedging, and sourcing for Vattenfall's assets and sales positions. We offer power purchase agree­ments to operators of wind or solar parks, optimise 3rd party batteries, and enter into origination deals within the B2B segment. We serve as Vattenfall’s single market access to energy commodity markets trading in electricity, emissions, fuels, freight, and renewable certificates. We are responsible for generating profits by taking positions within defined risk mandates and limits. We are active across Europe with around 500 professionals working from Sweden, Germany, The Netherlands, and The UK.

Within Markets the Business Unit (BU) Trading is the energy trading hub of the Vattenfall Group.

Business Unit Trading is responsible for all trading activities around Vattenfall´s asset and customer flows to maximize value creation and improve sourcing costs. It provides all market access services for standard OTC and exchange-based energy commodities for the Vattenfall Group, which means managing all hedge flows, from generation assets or customers, by our market access function. Next to handling our flow business, BU Trading also has a proprietary mandate.

Location

Solna

For more information about the position and the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter Amanda Pehrsson, amanda.pehrson@vattenfall.com

The trade union representatives in Sweden can be reached via Vattenfall´s switchboard +46 8 739 50 00. Sven-Gunnar Gremlin, Akademikerna and Anders Bohlin, Unionen.

We welcome your application in English no later than 4th of May

We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website. You apply quickly and easily by answering screening questions and attaching your CV.

At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.

Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.

We look forward to receiving your application!

Om oss

Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 21,000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years.

Title: Conversion Analyst
Description:
We are currently looking for a Conversion Analyst to our exciting customer Procter & Gamble. This is a consultancy opportunity, a 6-month contract starting May 5th 2025, with the possibility for an extension.The office is located in Stockholm.




About the company:

P&G is a fortune 500 company in the FMCG industry. It is the home of iconic, trusted brands that make every-day life a little bit easier. The insight, innovation and passion of their talented teams has helped them to grow to a global company that supports good causes and protects the environment.




About the role:

We are looking for a detail-oriented Conversion Analyst to help support our Product Master Data Team.

In this execution-focused role, you will be supporting new product launches and managing data changes for existing products. The scope focuses on data entry, issue identification and resolution, and master data accuracy management.

You will primarily work with SAP and Excel to update, set up, and communicate essential master data for new product launches. Additionally, you will utilise Power BI reports to effectively prioritise your tasks.

Your typical working day will be divided into two:

Mornings: assisting the team in troubleshooting and resolving issues within our daily order cycle. This requires swift root cause analysis and prompt action to meet customer expectations.

Afternoons: engaging in a variety of tasks to ensure that product master data is accurate and communicated effectively, thereby supporting the launch of new products. This involves working with the Global Data Synchronisation Network (GDSN), orientation to detail, and accuracy.

This role is ideal for someone with strong communication and analytical skills. A successful candidate comprehends instructions, acts independently, and multitasks effectively.




Key Responsibilities:

Own daily work activities ensuring master data is accurately maintained in line with industry deadlines across several business areas.
Execute daily tasks with a high level of accuracy and accountability
Work within a tight-knit team of Product Master Data experts to ensure data flows via GDSN and support them in their daily work
Root cause, identify and resolve any issues that are reported
Work cross-functionally to ensure issues are resolved and business critical tasks are carried out in a timely manner.




Your Profile:

Qualifications:

BSc or MSc in any discipline, with a preference for Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) and Supply Chain Management degrees.
Proven experience of identifying root causes, proposing and actioning solutions
Very strong attention to detail
Strong communication & comprehension skills, both verbally and written
Ability to balance deadlines and own workload according to business priorities
Fast learner and strong sense of ownership & accountability

Technical Skills:

Advanced in Microsoft Excel (Pivot tables etc.)
Experience using SAP or similar
Proficient in Power BI for reporting
Proven analytical experience with multisource and large data sets.
Business English required
Swedish beneficial but not a requirement




Interested?

If you are up for the challenge and think it suits you, we´d like to hear from you. Apply today, the position might be filled before the application deadline.

Title: Sustainability Analyst
Description:
YOUR MISSION AT VOI

As the Sustainability Analyst you will report to our Head of Sustainability and collaborate closely with internal and external stakeholders to drive the development and implementation of our global sustainability strategy and communication, work proactively to ensure sustainability performance and compliance with environmental regulations and industry standards, and contribute to building the Voi brand sustainability content. This will include:




Sustainability strategy: Collaborate closely with the Head of Sustainability and other colleagues to define and implement Voi’s sustainability strategy, including optimising resource use to reduce environmental impact, and drive progress to position Voi as a global leader in sustainability.
Monitoring & supporting change: Work continuously to stay up to date on sustainability related regulations, industry peer activity, academic research, assess risk associated with the sustainability goals, and initiate and support change initiatives to achieve key sustainability goals.
Data collection: Collaborate with internal stakeholders and external suppliers to collect data related to sustainability metrics, e.g. carbon emissions, energy consumption and waste management, ensuring transparency, traceability, accountability and compliance with regulations, e.g. CSRD, CBAM and the EU taxonomy.
Analysis & reporting: Analyse data and develop recommendations for sustainability management and sustainability performance reports.
Communication: Support the sustainability-, tender-, investor relations- and marketing teams in crafting and delivering the Voi sustainability narrative based on the strategic sustainability direction and progress.




WHAT YOU NEED TO EMBARK

We’re looking for an analytical, thorough and solution oriented sustainability professional, with the ability to manage and sanity check large data sets, and collaborate efficiently with diverse stakeholders. Apart from being fluent in English, self-sufficient and goal-oriented, we believe the right person has:




B.Sc. in Engineering or Business, preferably with a sustainability specialisation
Experience from management consulting, sustainability consulting or a similar position in a fast-paced dynamic environment
Experience from managing data collection, data analysis and projects with multiple stakeholders
Experience from working with large data sets and data bases, experience using SQL and python is a merit
Experience of sustainability-, CSR or ESG controlling/reporting, industry standards (e.g. GRI, CSRD) and environmental management system (e.g.ISO 14001) is a merit
Experience with sustainable procurement and audits of external suppliers is a merit




WHY VOI?

Working at Voi is more than just a job; Our People Promise includes a personal voyage where you will grow as a professional and be a part of a team and culture that builds something meaningful for society. In addition to this you’ll have the opportunity to:




Join Europe’s #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest growing scaleups
Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program
Have a direct impact on Voi’s sustainability strategy, brand sustainability content and position as a global leader in sustainability
Collaborate with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution




Are you ready to become a Voiager?

Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.




Diversity Matters

As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

Title: Junior Analytics Engineer
Description:
IPercept Technology AB

Job Title:  Junior Analytics Engineer

Job Type: Starting with an internship, with the potential to turn into full-time employment

Location: Stockholm, Sweden 

Job Summary

We are looking for a motivated Junior Analytics Engineer to join our team, starting as an intern with the opportunity to transition into a full-time role in the summer. This is a great opportunity for a recent graduate or final-year student with a strong technical background and a passion for analytics in mechanical and production systems.

We are looking for someone with a keen interest and knowledge in the following areas: 

What You’ll Do


Work with mechanical systems and production machinery data
Develop analytics solutions using Python and signal processing techniques (FFT, filters, etc.)
Assist in extracting insights from machine data to improve efficiency and performance
Collaborate with engineers to enhance data-driven decision-making


Must-haves 


Knowledge of mechanical systems  
Understanding of production machinery
Python 
Signal Processing (FFT, Filters, etc.) 


Nice to have


Software Engineering Fundamentals
SQL


What’s in it for you?   


Being a young company it’s all about the people - we’re a bunch of passionate and driven people with whom you will have a great time.   
Psychological safety and internal trust - flexible working hours, high expectations combined with a humane approach to work/life balance.  
Flat organization - we hire you because we believe in you. So challenge what we take for granted, express yourself and wear what you always dreamed of wearing to work, have fun, participate and make this the company you always dreamed of working for. 


How To Apply   

Submit a resume and cover letter outlining your interest and relevant experience

About IPercept

Imagine knowing the mechanical health of a machine without touching it, being alerted well in advance before something breaks, understanding how a machine is truly being used, and identifying what needs attention on a component level before visiting the machine.

At IPercept, we make this possible. Our insights help manufacturers understand their machines’ true state and usage throughout the machine life-cycle, achieving a 30% increase in efficiency. This quick ROI is realized by minimizing downtime, enhancing productivity, and reducing scrap rates, tooling costs, maintenance parts, and energy consumption.

In just two years, over 20 of Europe’s largest manufacturers have trusted us, and none have looked back.

We look forward to seeing your application!

/ IPercept Team

We are looking for someone with a keen interest and knowledge in the following areas: 

What You’ll Do

  • Work with mechanical systems and production machinery data
  • Develop analytics solutions using Python and signal processing techniques (FFT, filters, etc.)
  • Assist in extracting insights from machine data to improve efficiency and performance
  • Collaborate with engineers to enhance data-driven decision-making

Must-haves 

  • Knowledge of mechanical systems  
  • Understanding of production machinery
  • Python 
  • Signal Processing (FFT, Filters, etc.) 

Nice to have

  • Software Engineering Fundamentals
  • SQL

What’s in it for you?   

  • Being a young company it’s all about the people - we’re a bunch of passionate and driven people with whom you will have a great time.   
  • Psychological safety and internal trust - flexible working hours, high expectations combined with a humane approach to work/life balance.  
  • Flat organization - we hire you because we believe in you. So challenge what we take for granted, express yourself and wear what you always dreamed of wearing to work, have fun, participate and make this the company you always dreamed of working for. 

How To Apply   

Submit a resume and cover letter outlining your interest and relevant experience

About IPercept

Imagine knowing the mechanical health of a machine without touching it, being alerted well in advance before something breaks, understanding how a machine is truly being used, and identifying what needs attention on a component level before visiting the machine.

At IPercept, we make this possible. Our insights help manufacturers understand their machines’ true state and usage throughout the machine life-cycle, achieving a 30% increase in efficiency. This quick ROI is realized by minimizing downtime, enhancing productivity, and reducing scrap rates, tooling costs, maintenance parts, and energy consumption.

In just two years, over 20 of Europe’s largest manufacturers have trusted us, and none have looked back.

We look forward to seeing your application!

/ IPercept Team

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - OKQ8
Description:
Hela samhället ställer om mot en fossilfri framtid. Vi vill leda utvecklingen i branschen genom att driva förändring och arbetar aktivt för att minska vårt eget klimatavtryck, såväl som att hjälpa våra kunder att göra bättre och mer hållbara val utifrån sina förutsättningar. Vill du vara med och bidra till hållbar utveckling på riktigt? Välkommen att följa med på vår resa!

Som BI Analytiker hos OKQ8 kommer du att ingå i vårt Business Intelligence team som har en central roll i att förvalta och omvandla vår data till praktiska insikter. Arbetet sker i nära samarbete med tvärfunktionella team inom verksamheten för att förstå affärsbehoven.

OKQ8 har idag en diversifierad verksamhet med en stor mängd system som tillhandahåller data och transaktioner. Därav är förmågan att sätta sig in i nuvarande miljö och skapa sig en övergripande förståelse av stor vikt. BI, Data och Analytics inom bolaget bygger till största del på Microsofts komponenter såsom exempelvis Power BI, Fabric, Power Platform, Azure Synapse etc.

Du kommer att ansvara för att designa, utveckla och underhålla data, rapporter och dashboards för att hjälpa OKQ8 att fatta välgrundade beslut och optimera vår verksamhet.

Ansvarsområden:


Utveckla och underhålla Power BI Appar/Dashboards/rapporter för att visualisera och stötta datadrivna insikter och beslut
Använda Fabric, Azure och Profisee för att hantera och integrera data
Samarbeta med verksamheten för att förstå affärskrav och översätta dem till tekniska lösningar
Bistå kring dataanalys och datamodeller för att stödja våra affärsmål
Säkerställa datakvalitet, stringens och säkerhet i våra lösningar
Hålla dig uppdaterad kring ny teknik, nya lösningar och nya möjligheter


Vi tror att du är fokuserad, lösningsorienterad och analytisk. Du kan arbeta självgående och du brinner för ditt område och vill ha möjligheter att vidareutvecklas. Du tar eget ansvar för att hitta lösningar och driva ständiga förbättringar. Vi ser gärna att du har ett par års erfarenhet i roller inom Data, exempelvis; BI-utvecklare, Data Analyst, Data Engineer, Data Scientist eller liknande. Har du dessutom erfarenhet och intresse av AI så är det meriterande.

För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har/är:


Kandidatexamen i datavetenskap, informationsteknologi eller ett närliggande område
Goda kunskaper i Engelska och Svenska eller Danska
Utmärkt analytisk och problemlösningsförmåga
Stark kommunikationsförmåga för att interagera med tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter
Engagerad, kan prioritera och balansera mellan arbetsuppgifter samt hålla deadlines
Lagspelare som även kan arbeta självständigt
Ordningsam och strukturerad


Meriterande kvalifikationer:


Dokumenterad erfarenhet som BI/Data Analyst, Data Engineer, Data Scientist eller liknande
God kunskap inom Power BI, Fabric, Power Platform, Azure Synapse eller Profisee
God kunskap inom programmeringsspråk såsom DAX, Python, R eller SQL
God kunskap inom statistik
God kunskap inom ordinarie MS 365-applikationer


Vi uppmuntrar dig att ansöka även om du inte känner att du uppfyller alla ovan nämnda kvalifikationer. Det viktigaste är att du har ett starkt driv, engagerad, skärpt och vill vara med och bidra till hållbar utveckling på riktigt!

Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Jörgen Forsman via

eller People Business Partner Johanna Scarlett via

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

Vi erbjuder Hos oss på OKQ8 får du arbeta i en flexibel miljö där vi uppmuntrar samarbete, innovation och utveckling . Vi erbjuder kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och möjligheten att vara en del av vår resa mot en mer hållbar framtid. Här får du växa, utmanas och göra verklig skillnad , samtidigt som vi stöttar varandra för att nå de bästa resultaten.

OKQ8 Scandinavia arbetar för att vara en jämställd arbetsplats med medarbetare som trivs och utvecklas och där olikheter uppmuntras. Vi vill vara ett företag som speglar samhället, med en inkluderande kultur som hjälper till att minska utanförskap och bidrar till mångfald.

 I rekryteringsprocessen ingår både psykometriska tester och kompetensbaserade intervjuer, med syfte att främja en rättvis utvärdering för alla kandidater.

Om företaget Ditt livs kanske viktigaste jobb. På riktigt.

Vi vet att det är en vågad sak att säga, men vi menar verkligen varje ord. Oavsett om det handlar om ditt första jobb, ditt sista jobb, eller om du har modet att anta en ny utmaning, tror vi att du kan få ditt livs kanske viktigaste jobb här hos oss. På riktigt.
