Title: Data Business Analyst/Sr. Data Business Analyst for the Nordics
Place: Høje Taastrup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a great career opportunity in BNP Paribas, one of the leading financial institutions in the Nordics?




Right now, we are looking for a data business analyst who will join the Data office team that is in charge of developing, deploying and maintaining our DWH and generating reports used for the purpose of decision making by different departments. The role involves supporting our business in coming up with functional specification documents. Is that you?




Are you passionate about data and analytics?

Joining us at our Copenhagen office, you will become part of our Data Office department and work alongside other data analysts. We are passionate about data, and we are looking forward to having you on our team.




Our purpose is to give the company a strategic data overview of the entire organisation and help us make new, valuable insights. As our business is built on data, we need to manage this asset in a responsible way. You will be supporting our business in the Nordics (Norway, Sweden and Denmark).




Create business value through strategic data

As part of our team, you write functional specification documents that will enable the data engineers to code data applications. The roles also involves doing some retro documentation of existing applications and working with our referential officer to ensure that we capture business definitions. Taking on an outgoing role, you will collaborate with all our different data users in ensuring they are able to test and sign off on deliverables.




More specifically, you will:




Support the product owner/technical team in analyzing business needs and estimate the time needed to deliver the expected deliverables.
Write the expected deliverables (functional specification, test book, etc.).
Update the data dictionary.
Clarify the needs from a critical and constructive point of view and, if necessary, challenge the expressed need of the Business.
Contribute in the deployment of applications in our production batch system by ensuring the functional documentation is up to date.
Provides support to the data engineers in the analysis of anomalies detected in production to enable corrective actions to be implemented.
Support users on functional questions linked to the functional domain.
Look into the entire data life cycle and ensure that controls are in place to ensure data quality.
Assist the business where data quality in deficient to implement remediation action plans and put in place controls.




A unique opportunity to develop your skills with us

You will become part of a dynamic, multinational team with many exciting opportunities and challenges. When it comes to career opportunities, we are eager to support your professional development.




You are tech-savvy and a great communicator

Furthermore, you have:




Previous experience as a Data Analyst (at least 3 years) or as Data Engineer.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills, which enables you to work with different stakeholders within the organisation.
Great analytical skills and maybe even a good understanding of banking processes.
Experience in data querying languages such as SAS or oracle is an added advantage.
Fluency in English as this is our business language.




Interested?

If you have any questions about the position or the recruitment process, please contact Sara Åkerström, Recruitment Director at ProScout ApS, +45 53 56 33 83.




Please apply as soon as possible via LinkedIn as we will close the advert when the right candidate has been found.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you ready to play a crucial part in transforming data into actionable insights that drive strategic decisions and improve operational efficiency across the business service organization? Then we would love to hear from you!

The role will be based in Billund campus, Denmark. Please note there is no relocation budget for this position.


Core Responsibilities





Collect, clean, and analyze large sets of data from various sources.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using BI tools, full proficiency in Power BI tool, including DAX and Power Query is a requirement.
Identify business trends and provide insights for process improvement.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand their data requirements and provide actionable insights (Global Process Owner, IT & other stakeholders)
Present findings and recommendations to leadership in a clear and concise manner.
Perform creation, maintenance, documentation, improvement & decommissioning of reports
Drive reporting standardization and definitions alignment
Assist with the design and implementation of data-driven strategies for business growth.
Training and daily support of users in BI reporting, governance and data-analysis
Stay updated on BI best practices, tools, and technologies.




Play your part in our team succeeding

You will be based in Billund and joining Service Experience team within Business Service Organization (BSO), covering Business Account Management, Service Management, Continuous Improvement & Business Process Management, Insights Hub and Experience Hub teams.

In this role, you will need to define and facilitate delivery of reporting requirements as well as participate in projects requiring Business Intelligence knowledge.

Do you have what it takes?

You bring several years of hands-on experience in Business Intelligence and data analysis, with a proven ability to develop in BI tools like Power BI and Tableau. You've used these skills to turn complex data into clear, impactful visual stories that support better decision-making. Along the way, you've also gained familiarity with the Databricks platform, which has strengthened your ability to navigate large-scale data environments. You're passionate about uncovering insights and applying data visualization best practices to communicate them effectively. Known for your sharp analytical thinking, you thrive in collaborative settings and have a natural talent for translating technical concepts into language that resonates with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

  • Present findings and recommendations to leadership in a clear and concise manner.
  • Perform creation, maintenance, documentation, improvement & decommissioning of reports
  • Drive reporting standardization and definitions alignment
  • Assist with the design and implementation of data-driven strategies for business growth.
  • Training and daily support of users in BI reporting, governance and data-analysis
  • Stay updated on BI best practices, tools, and technologies.



Play your part in our team succeeding

You will be based in Billund and joining Service Experience team within Business Service Organization (BSO), covering Business Account Management, Service Management, Continuous Improvement & Business Process Management, Insights Hub and Experience Hub teams.

In this role, you will need to define and facilitate delivery of reporting requirements as well as participate in projects requiring Business Intelligence knowledge.

Do you have what it takes?

You bring several years of hands-on experience in Business Intelligence and data analysis, with a proven ability to develop in BI tools like Power BI and Tableau. You've used these skills to turn complex data into clear, impactful visual stories that support better decision-making. Along the way, you've also gained familiarity with the Databricks platform, which has strengthened your ability to navigate large-scale data environments. You're passionate about uncovering insights and applying data visualization best practices to communicate them effectively. Known for your sharp analytical thinking, you thrive in collaborative settings and have a natural talent for translating technical concepts into language that resonates with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you thrive at the intersection of data and strategy? Are you excited about turning complex analytics into impactful marketing insights? Then you might be our new Marketing Data Analyst, ready to join our dynamic and international marketing team!

First, who on earth is Dalux?

Dalux is an innovative Contech company committed to push the boundaries of how technology can secure a smarter and more efficient construction and real estate industry. Today we provide our user-friendly digital tools and BIM Technology (3D information models) to leading contractors and advisors in more than 147 countries. And we are not slowing down our expansion journey anytime soon, so this is a great time to join us and directly influence the future of Dalux! Today we are present in 24 countries and counting, and therefore this is a great time to join us, and directly influence the future of Dalux!

Awesome! But what will my new role be?

In this role, you’ll work at the intersection of data and marketing, analyzing and interpreting data from a wide variety of marketing channels such as ads, social media, website performance, webinars, events, and more. Your insights will drive decision-making, shape marketing strategies, and optimize performance across the organization.

Your responsibilities will include:


Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data from various marketing sources (e.g., Google Analytics, Google Ads, social platforms, events, webinars).
Developing and maintaining dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, SQL, and Access.
Providing actionable insights to optimize campaign performance and achieve marketing goals.
Collaborating with Performance Marketing and other teams (Content, Events, Commercial Revenue Operations) to align on data-driven strategies.
Monitoring and reporting on KPIs, campaign ROI, and trends to guide both short-term and long-term planning.
Identifying areas of opportunity and proposing data-informed strategies for growth and efficiency.


Sure, sounds exciting! How can I be considered for this role?

You have experience in marketing data analysis or a related field, with proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Microsoft Access. Strong knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Ads dashboards, as well as analytical and problem-solving skills, are essential. Experience visualizing data for non-technical stakeholders and strong collaboration skills are also key.

Preferred qualifications include experience in performance marketing or commercial revenue operations, familiarity with A/B testing, and additional data visualization tools.

If you’re collaborative, curious, and eager to learn, you’ll thrive in our supportive and creative environment.

Why Choose Dalux?

At Dalux, we care—not just about our work and customers but about each other. We believe in creating a work environment that is light-hearted, informal, and welcoming, with room for everyone. Forget fancy titles and rigid dress codes; we’re here to make your work life both rewarding and enjoyable.

At our HQ in Østerbro, you’ll join a team of 17 skilled colleagues dedicated to driving high customer engagement. Networking with our users is our passion, and we deliver great content, engaging events, and cutting-edge ConTech insights.

Being part of a social company, you’ll also enjoy activities like wine tasting, running club, knitting club, and more. At Dalux, your personal and professional growth is important to us.

Application deadline:

As soon as possible
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Copenhagen)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Ageras, we are redefining how entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking, and administrative tasks. Through seamless tools and innovative accounting & banking solutions, we help them focus on what matters most: growing their businesses.

Our vision is to become the best friend of every small entrepreneur across Europe. 💚

Over the years, Ageras has grown through the merging of top European FinTechs like Shine (🇫🇷), Kontist (🇩🇪), Tellow (🇳🇱), and more. Today, we’re a team of nearly 500 people, including 150 talented engineers, working together from Paris, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, and Berlin.




👀 Data at Ageras

At Ageras, we're revolutionizing the way entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking and administrative tasks. Operating in the ever-evolving FinTech space, we face one of the industry's most intricate challenges: building a robust, reliable architecture to enable seamless data collection, analysis, and visualization. Unsurprisingly, our Data team plays a pivotal role in driving Ageras' success!

Our Data department is organized into three specialized squads: Data Analytics, Data Modeling, and Data Platform, ensuring optimal efficiency and focus.

We are now seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics team, currently composed of 4 data analyst and 1 lead data analyst.

As for our tech stack, we work with Python, AWS, Snowflake, Big Query, Meltano, Terraform, Dagster, and dbt for data modeling. If you're passionate about leveraging these tools to shape the future of FinTech, we'd love to hear from you!

📋 Your Role as a Senior Data Analyst

Data analysis at Ageras means working with a large volume of data across diverse domains (payment transactions, user behavior and conversion, product usage, ticket volume, revenue, marketing...), and and draw business insights from it to support or impact the company strategy 💥




Your Responsibilities Will Include

Data Analysis & Visualization
Build and optimize analytical data models using dbt.
Develop and maintain dashboards on Looker Studio and Metabase to empower teams with actionable insights.
Analyze complex datasets to solve business challenges and provide recommendations.
Collaboration & Strategy
Work closely with Business, Tech, and Data teams to align on priorities and insights.
Translate stakeholder needs into effective data solutions.
Deliver clear, data-driven insights to support strategic decision-making.
You will work closely with Product team on the product roadmap and help them on applying analysis like A/B test
Team Development & Best Practices
Help grow and structure the Data Analytics team by sharing knowledge and mentoring junior members.
Advocate for and implement best practices in data analysis, visualization, and architecture.
Stay on top of emerging tools and methodologies to optimize our processes.




🔎 About you

You have 5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst with advanced skills in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Metabase, Tableau).
You have significant experience with modern data stacks (BigQuery, dbt) and a strong focus on detail and precision.
You simplify complex findings into clear, actionable insights for diverse stakeholders and decision-makers.
You demonstrate adaptability and proactivity, enabling you to thrive in dynamic and challenging work environments.
Teamwork is key for you: you enjoy mentoring others while continuing to grow and learn.
You are fluent in English and excited to work in an international team.




🎉 Our Perks

Remote Work Culture: Located in Paris with possibility of two remote working days per week but also you can you can work in all Ageras offices: Berlin, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, Poland
Office Perks: Complimentary tea, coffee, refreshments, fruits, and snacks available daily.
Career Growth Opportunities: Build a successful career with ample opportunities for professional growth within the firm.
Team Building and Events: Participate in biannual team-building activities and summer/winter corporate events.




💚 Our recruitment process

1️⃣ A 45’ introductory call with Annaïg (Talent Acquisition Specialist) to learn more about each other and give you an overview of Ageras.

2️⃣ A 90’ interview with Saghar (Lead Data Analyst) to discuss your experience, dive into the role, and evaluate your SQL skills.

3️⃣ A 30' business case presentation, where you’ll showcase your technical expertise and problem-solving abilities.

Show more

3️⃣ A 30' business case presentation, where you’ll showcase your technical expertise and problem-solving abilities.

Title: Mid-level Data Analyst (B2B Product)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way—but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

Become part of a team that's exploring data to enhance online trust. As a member of Trustpilot's B2B Product Analytics team, you'll be integrated into an engaging environment where your insights will directly contribute to product strategy and drive innovation. We work together to solve complex challenges and uncover opportunities that elevate the experiences of businesses and consumers globally.

At Trustpilot, data isn't just an asset, it's the lifeblood of our platform. We leverage tools and technologies like BigQuery, DBT, Looker, Amplitude, and advanced statistical modelling to understand user behaviour, optimise product performance, and drive data-informed decisions across the business. You'll be working alongside a team of analysts, data scientists, product managers, engineers, and designers, collaborating to build impactful solutions that enhance the value of Trustpilot for businesses worldwide. Our goal is to create an inclusive environment where diverse perspectives are appreciated and everyone’s contributions are valued.

What You’ll Be Doing


Drive product strategy with data: Conduct in-depth analyses to understand user behaviour, identify opportunities for product improvement and innovation, and measure the impact of product changes
Promote data-driven decision-making: Collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, and designers to translate data insights into actionable recommendations that influence product roadmap and development
Build and maintain data infrastructure: Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and other data visualizations in Looker and Amplitude to track key product metrics and provide ongoing visibility into product performance
Conduct in-depth experimentation: Design and analyse A/B tests to evaluate the effectiveness of new features and product enhancements, ensuring data-driven decisions are at the core of product development
Communicate effectively: Present your findings and recommendations to diverse audiences, clearly articulating the value and impact of your work to both technical and non-technical stakeholders up to C-suite level


Who You Are


You are an experienced mid-level Product Analyst
You leverage data to solve complex product challenges. You're curious and motivated to uncover the 'why' behind the data, constantly seeking new knowledge and exploring different perspectives.
Skilled in product analytics: You have prior experience working with key analytical and statistical methodologies, including cohort analysis, A/B testing, and model-based analyses (regression, clustering, etc.)
Experienced in data visualization and reporting: You have built insightful dashboards and reports using BI/product analytics tools such as Looker and Amplitude.
A skilled communicator: You can effectively communicate complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences, translating data into compelling narratives that drive action and business challenges into technical requirements
An effective team contributor: You thrive in a collaborative environment, working closely with cross-functional teams to reach shared goals
You possess proficient SQL skills and some experience in DBT. You’re comfortable working with scripting languages like Python or R for data analysis


What's in it for you?


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 64 million monthly active users on average across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst, Global Operations
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join our Operational Excellence team and contribute to our purpose of implementing process excellence initiatives. We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to be responsible for developing and maintaining Power BI reports that empower our management team to make informed decisions based on accurate data analysis. Are you curious, please read on.

The team you will be part of

You will collaborate with various teams to gather data and understand reporting needs, facilitating effective communication, and aligning on operational goals and performance metrics.

The Operational Excellence team is a newly established team supporting our EMEA Regional Operations in process automation, data analysis and reporting.

Your contribution is appreciated, and you will:


build and maintain reports and advanced analytical tools (PowerBI and Excel)
support EMEA Regional Operations team with data analyses and support management with KPI definitions and measurements to build and maintain KPI dashboards
prepare business review slide decks for management team
ensure data alignment and transparency across the functions and advise business with data-driven decisions
ensure operations data models integrity and alignment on operations data point definitions cross-functionally


To perform well in the role, we imagine that you:


are a data or supply chain specialist with an interest in BI excellence
have a couple of years of work experience with BI and analytics
have a relevant master’s degree in business or in a technical field such as informatics, data sciences, supply chain or similar
have experience in working with data modelling, data warehouses (such as SAP, Azure or similar), visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau or Qlik), and the development of complex dashboard solutions
have experience with SQL for data extraction and manipulation
understand systems and data architecture principles enabling you to build and implement the BI road map
understand the business value of reporting and prioritize efforts accordingly
good communication skills, both written and verbal, and thrive working in a collaborative international environment


We encourage you to apply

Even if you don’t match all the above-mentioned skills, we welcome your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value a mindset and motivation that align with our core values, to not only ensure growth for you, but for your team and the wider GN organization as well.

We are focused on an inclusive recruitment process

All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment. As such, we encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

Should you have any special requirements for the interview, please let the Hiring Manager know upon accepting invitation to interview.

How to apply?

Use the ‘APPLY’ link no later than 25 April 2025. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so don’t wait to send yours.

On a time crunch? Feel free to only submit your up-to-date CV including a few sentences outlining your motivation for applying – quick and easy.

If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Head of Operational Excellence Tatjana Matthaiou on mobile +45 5268 6733.

Join us in bringing people closer

GN brings people closer through our advanced intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. Inspired by people and motivated by innovation, we deliver technology that enhance the senses of hearing and sight. We enable people with hearing loss overcome real-life problems, improve communication and collaboration for businesses and provide great experiences for audio and gaming enthusiasts.

We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application.


Show more
HTML:
Join our Operational Excellence team and contribute to our purpose of implementing process excellence initiatives. We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to be responsible for developing and maintaining Power BI reports that empower our management team to make informed decisions based on accurate data analysis. Are you curious, please read on.

The team you will be part of

You will collaborate with various teams to gather data and understand reporting needs, facilitating effective communication, and aligning on operational goals and performance metrics.

The Operational Excellence team is a newly established team supporting our EMEA Regional Operations in process automation, data analysis and reporting.

Your contribution is appreciated, and you will:

  • build and maintain reports and advanced analytical tools (PowerBI and Excel)
  • support EMEA Regional Operations team with data analyses and support management with KPI definitions and measurements to build and maintain KPI dashboards
  • prepare business review slide decks for management team
  • ensure data alignment and transparency across the functions and advise business with data-driven decisions
  • ensure operations data models integrity and alignment on operations data point definitions cross-functionally

To perform well in the role, we imagine that you:

  • are a data or supply chain specialist with an interest in BI excellence
  • have a couple of years of work experience with BI and analytics
  • have a relevant master’s degree in business or in a technical field such as informatics, data sciences, supply chain or similar
  • have experience in working with data modelling, data warehouses (such as SAP, Azure or similar), visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau or Qlik), and the development of complex dashboard solutions
  • have experience with SQL for data extraction and manipulation
  • understand systems and data architecture principles enabling you to build and implement the BI road map
  • understand the business value of reporting and prioritize efforts accordingly
  • good communication skills, both written and verbal, and thrive working in a collaborative international environment

We encourage you to apply

Even if you don’t match all the above-mentioned skills, we welcome your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value a mindset and motivation that align with our core values, to not only ensure growth for you, but for your team and the wider GN organization as well.

We are focused on an inclusive recruitment process

All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment. As such, we encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

Should you have any special requirements for the interview, please let the Hiring Manager know upon accepting invitation to interview.

How to apply?

Use the ‘APPLY’ link no later than 25 April 2025. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so don’t wait to send yours.

On a time crunch? Feel free to only submit your up-to-date CV including a few sentences outlining your motivation for applying – quick and easy.

If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Head of Operational Excellence Tatjana Matthaiou on mobile +45 5268 6733.

Join us in bringing people closer

GN brings people closer through our advanced intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. Inspired by people and motivated by innovation, we deliver technology that enhance the senses of hearing and sight. We enable people with hearing loss overcome real-life problems, improve communication and collaboration for businesses and provide great experiences for audio and gaming enthusiasts.

We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application.

Title: Data Science Internship
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Lenus is looking for a Data Science Intern for our Copenhagen Office.

Join the health revolution!

At Lenus we are fundamentally energized by our shared vision: making the world a healthier and happier place. Could you see yourself working for a great purpose in a dynamic, global culture? Then we might be a great match.

Ready to advance your career while helping others achieve their full potential?

At Lenus, we’re passionate about supporting others and driving growth in our coaches' businesses and employees development, providing opportunities for everyone to thrive. Through our internship program, we’re excited to train aspiring talent and support their journey to becoming future product and business leaders.

Throughout this internship, you’ll immerse yourself in our inclusive, growth-oriented company culture and gain real project experience alongside passionate teams across the business. Our supportive leaders will offer mentorship and collaboration opportunities to help you build skills and confidence as you start your career.

You’ll have the chance to make a meaningful impact on the business and help us achieve our mission of making the world a healthier and happier place.

The Role

As a Data Science Intern, you will focus on prompt engineering and optimising AI model performance. Your work will involve analysing data, extracting insights, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure data quality and accessibility. This role provides hands-on experience in AI, data analysis, and cross-functional teamwork.

Key Responsibilities


Optimise AI model performance through prompt engineering and experimentation.
Conduct statistical analyses to extract insights and inform decision-making.
Collaborate with data teams to ensure data quality and accessibility.
Support data science initiatives and contribute to model evaluation.
Document best practices and stay informed about AI advancements.


Who are we looking for:

We value diverse experiences and backgrounds. While not all qualifications are mandatory, the ideal candidate should possess:

Basic Requirements:


Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, AI, Statistics, Engineering or a related field.
Collaborative mindset with strong communication and teamwork skills.
Analytical thinking and problem-solving ability.
Basic knowledge of AI/ML concepts and prompt engineering.
Strong interest or experience in Python, statistics and SQL.
Creative and solution-oriented approach to challenges.


Bonus skills and traits:


Experience with statistical analysis and data exploration.
Knowledge-sharing mindset and structured working style.
Familiarity with Python and SQL


We encourage you to apply even if you don't tick all the boxes!

Meet the Team

Join our Data Team, a diverse group of Data Scientists, Engineers, and BI Specialists who transform data into actionable insights. Our mission is to ensure everyone at Lenus has the right data to work smarter and more efficiently. We believe in collaboration, problem solving and keeping the workplace engaging. If you enjoy working with data and being part of a dynamic, social environment, you’ll fit right in!

Your Internship experience:


Be paid to learn: Full time compensated internship to learn, grow, and thrive
Strengthen Your Skills: Dive into learning new tools and techniques to expand your expertise
Achieve meaningful goals: Work on real projects in the Data team
Guidance & Growth: Regular development feedback sessions and mentorship from industry leaders who will help you raise the bar on your future
Wellbeing & Activities: Optional gym classes, sports & activities, like paddle tournaments, Workout Wednesdays, run & Dip, football & more
Have fun!: Join us for team events, monthly socials and company wide gatherings including our annual Lenus summer party
Daily fuel: Our offices are set up with fruits, snack bars, and a selection of drinks
Tools for success: A Macbook and other hardware to support you in your daily work


We'll be going through applications frequently, so if this sounds like a great opportunity for you, hit apply and our Talent Acquisition Team will go through it and be in touch with you!

Key details:


Internship length: 6 months
Ideal start date: 1st June 2025
Interview steps:
Introductory call - A conversation with our Talent Acquisition team.
Interview with Hiring Manager - A chance to discuss your skills and interests.
Coffee chat - A casual chat with future colleagues.

About Lenus

Lenus was founded in Denmark by Bertram Thorslund, in 2016. We are a health technology company that empowers health coaches to scale their businesses through the use of pioneering technology and our in-house business, health, and innovation expertise.

We’re inspiring a new generation of health coaches. People who have the power to move not only bodies but minds too. We are at the forefront of an industry under rapid transformation and our strategic innovations pave the path for the change we want to see. Happier and healthier people.

In 2021, Lenus received the largest series A funding round in Denmark’s history. Since then the company has grown from 5 to over 350 employees and today, Lenus is headquartered in Copenhagen, with offices in New York, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Hamburg, Madrid, Helsinki, Oslo, Toronto, Miami, Southern California & beyond.

At Lenus, we value diverse perspectives and experiences. Even if you don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply. Your unique skills and background could be just what we need to make a difference together.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

We care about your privacy, personal data and information at Lenus.

For specific details on how your personal data and information is processed by Lenus during any recruitment process, please see our privacy policy.

Specific to EU applicants:

Lenus will treat all personal information collected during the recruitment process with the utmost confidentiality and in line with current data protection legislation. We rely on the lawful basis of Art. 6 (1) (b) of the GDPR to process the information provided by you in the recruitment process.

Specific to California applicants:

Lenus will treat all personal information collected during the recruitment process with the utmost confidentiality and in line with current data protection legislation.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
It’s an exciting time to join Tactile. We're a diverse team of storytellers, puzzle enthusiasts and casual mobile game creators. Our story began in 2008 in the heart of beautiful Copenhagen, and since then we have experienced continuous growth, establishing ourselves as one of the largest gaming companies in Denmark. In more recent years, we have been scaling fast, in big part thanks to the success of a little game called Lily’s Garden. Now we’re on a mission to solidify our position as one of the leaders in creating out-of-the-ordinary casual puzzle games.




🚀 Your role & impact




We are currently growing our Analytics team and are on the search for Game Analysts to support our Product and LiveOps functions.




Our analysts are embedded directly within our game teams, ensuring each team has dedicated experts who understand the intricacies of data and their unique needs. Your role will be crucial in validating decisions with data, offering valuable insights to shape product roadmaps, and fostering a culture of backing up decisions with data. This means you will have a real impact on the game and contribute to enhancing our players’ experience.




So, if you are super passionate about games or mobile tech and have data deeply embedded in your DNA, then you might just be our missing piece! 🧩




📍 This role is based in our beautiful Copenhagen office, as we truly believe that when talented people work closely together, amazing things happen!




Here’s what you'll do on the day-to-day:

Analyse the performance of the game to help the Product/LiveOps team understand player behaviour, what to improve in the game and what is the estimated impact of each improvement
Create compelling dashboards to monitor key metrics of the game
Work closely with the Product/LiveOps team to design, analyse and derive conclusions from A/B tests
Help game designers and product specialists to balance game features
Work with developers to define the necessary tracking data points in the game
Present your findings to stakeholders (product or LiveOps team members) and propose courses of action or improvements to the game
Work closely with the rest of the game analysts on the team and brainstorm on how to solve problem




What we’re looking for:

Strong background in data analytics
Proficiency with SQL
High proficiency in presenting analyses and results to all audiences, from senior stakeholders to junior colleagues and in particular to non-technical teammates
Experience applying analytic techniques in order to understand user behaviour and their interactions
A good understanding of applied statistics (such as sampling, hypothesis testing and ab testing)
Experience with data visualisation tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau)




You'll make us extra excited if you also have:

Prior experience working within gaming/mobile apps
Python/R knowledge




What’s in it for you?

🌆 Beautiful office space with probably the best view in Copenhagen

🩺 Pension and private health insurance

💻 A chance to work with the latest tools and technology

📚 Opportunities for individual growth with development talks as well as workshops, books and courses

🌮 Daily, healthy organic breakfast and lunch prepared by our professional chefs in-house

🥳 Social activities, including game nights, book club, Friday bar and more

🔍 Free Danish lessons with our in-house Danish teacher




We look forward to receiving your application! 👋

Show more

  • Experience with data visualisation tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau)


You'll make us extra excited if you also have:

  • Prior experience working within gaming/mobile apps
  • Python/R knowledge


What’s in it for you?

🌆 Beautiful office space with probably the best view in Copenhagen

🩺 Pension and private health insurance

💻 A chance to work with the latest tools and technology

📚 Opportunities for individual growth with development talks as well as workshops, books and courses

🌮 Daily, healthy organic breakfast and lunch prepared by our professional chefs in-house

🥳 Social activities, including game nights, book club, Friday bar and more

🔍 Free Danish lessons with our in-house Danish teacher


We look forward to receiving your application! 👋

Title: Data Analyst in PS AM Business Intelligence & Analytics team
Description:
Do you have a passion for turning complex data into actionable solutions? Do you strive for using your excellent data skills in solving complex problems?

Then come and join the BI&Analytics team in Product Supply Aseptic Manufacturing (PS AM) - Business Development and Support!

The position
Your primary responsibility will be to drive the digital transformation of Product Supply Aseptic Manufacturing (PS AM) through implementation of relevant digital solutions, strong quality data foundation and analytics mindset.

Your main stakeholder will be the PS AM Manufacturing Strategy unit. This unit has the goal of ensuring that the optimal configuration of the AM manufacturing network is sustained in the long-term horizon so that a significantly higher number of patients can be reached.

You will be a key player on the team, being the responsible to bring into life digitalisation products that support senior management to drive the right decision towards optimisations and improvements across business processes in the organisation.

We will be relying on your analytical skills to understand a complex business setup, facilitate strategy development through data analytics and to drive bold targets for our business as well as for an even stronger LEAN culture.

Qualifications

To be successful in the role we expect you:



Have master’s degree in IT, Engineering, Data Science, Business Analytics, Supply Chain Management, or another relevant subject.
Recognise yourself as digital-savvy, comfortable manipulating and analysing complex and high-volume data assets from varying data sources; and you see challenges such as technical troubles or knowledge limitations as an opportunity to learn more.
Have proven knowledge in data preparation, blending, and automation tools such Alteryx, Tableau, PowerBI, Qliksense will be required
Have solid language skills in English and strong communication skills written and verbally




We welcome an individual who has strong communication skills and see themselves as an executer who gets the job done on time without compromising the quality in your deliverables. You enjoy building new solutions for your customers and you take a pride in helping your colleagues across various functions in a global oriented business. You deliver solutions when they are needed and enjoy working in an informal atmosphere where flexibility and responsibility goes hand in hand.

Furthermore, you will be expected to navigate and partner with a broad and complex stakeholder portfolio, focusing on data analytics and creating transparency on operational challenges. Thus, the role requires a combination of strong analytical mindset and data-oriented background, with excellence communication skills, problem-solving expertise and change management capabilities.

About The Department

The PS AM BI&Analytics team is a central function within PS AM Business Development Support that sets the framework for analytics across the PS Aseptic Manufacturing SVP area. Our team ensure that our factories and their senior management deliver a robust performance through strong data foundation, digital innovation, and analytical insights across the different functional areas.

Working at Novo Nordisk
At Novo Nordisk, we don’t wait for change. We drive it. We’re a dynamic company in an even more dynamic industry, and we know that what got us to where we are today is not necessarily what will make us successful in the future. We embrace the spirit of experimentation, striving for excellence without fixating on perfection. We never shy away from opportunities to develop, we seize them. From research and development, through to manufacturing, marketing and sales – we’re all working to move the needle on patient care.

Contact
For further information, please contact Senior Manager Raquel Cacho Zurrunero, at rchz@novonordisk.com

Deadline
16 April 2025

Please note that applications will be reviewed continuously, and interviews will be planned as soon as a suitable candidate is identified.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo to your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more

Title: Junior Analyst (Student) – Operational Excellence Team
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Unlock the Full Potential of Offshore Wind to Power the World

If you are looking to advance your offshore wind career or explore our industry further, this is your chance to be part of market-leading, and groundbreaking projects.

COP is at the forefront of offshore wind development, leading projects from origination and development through construction and operations in new and established markets around the world. Founded in 2015, our team is comprised of some of the most experienced professionals from the renewable energy and associated sectors, all working together to unlock the full potential of offshore wind to power the world. We are the exclusive offshore wind development partner to Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners, the world’s largest green energy fund.

The role: 

We are looking for a Junior Analyst (Student) to support our Operational Excellence function. This is a new function in our organization, and you will play a pivotal role in its growth journey. This role is ideal for students of Management, Strategy, Business Analytics, or Engineering. You will be based in COP’s CFO Area, which includes our finance, legal, digital, and IT capabilities.

Your Key Responsibilities Will Include


Take ownership of our CFO Excellence capabilities, to support the reporting of key performance indicators that enable data-driven decision-making
Conduct data analysis to identify focus areas for improvement initiatives
Interface with managers and department staff in the collecting of key departmental operational data, including in operational health, service-level, and team engagement
Collaborate with the Digital Delivery team in data visualisation and business intelligence solutions
Support the Operational Excellence Lead in the implementation of frameworks enabling internal improvement across the organisation


Your experience: 


You are a current student in Management, Strategy, Business Analytics, Engineering, or a related field, and you have demonstrated exceptional performance among your peers
You are proactive – ready to take ownership of key business processes, and drive development as you see fit
You demonstrate excellent analytical skills, and careful consideration of details
You are highly organised, and possess strong time-management capabilities
You are eager to learn and contribute to a team dynamic


What Is It Like To Work Here

We are proud of the unique career experiences we offer at COP and have taken great care to build a culture that supports our ambitions. Here’s what you can expect from your time with us:


You will be at the heart of the action – Work on projects that shape the future of our evolving industry, collaborating with industry leaders and influencing change on a global scale.
You will be encouraged to be brave – Move at pace, make bold decisions, and drive the energy transition forward.
Be trusted to thrive – Work with autonomy in a diverse, respectful, and empowering environment where contributions are valued and your growth matters.


What You Can Expect


Competitive salary and benefits package adapted to market.
Flexibility & Autonomy – The freedom to shape your workday to balance professional and personal commitments.
Career Growth & Development – Learn from industry leaders, take ownership of your career path, and be exposed to the full offshore wind project lifecycle.
International Exposure – Work across multiple markets, engage with global stakeholders, and build an international network of industry leaders.
A Global & Inclusive Culture – Join an international team where diverse perspectives are valued, and collaboration is at the heart of everything we do.


Ready to go further than you ever imagined? Apply now using the like below.

We will conduct ongoing interviews; therefore, early application is encouraged. As a part of our commitment to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable recruitment process, we request that you do not include a personal photo on your CV. 

If you have any questions concerning this position, please contact  recruitment@cop.dk .  We will handle your information with confidentiality and handle all personal data in accordance with our Privacy Notice.  

Please Note

We unfortunately are not considering staffing agency inquiries or submissions for open opportunities for our team. We appreciate your respect for our current approach and if future opportunities arise where we require external assistance, we will reach out to selected agencies directly.
Show more

Title: Senior Applied Statistician
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
HTML:
About Agreena

Agreena is an exciting, dynamic, and purpose-oriented organisation united in a mission to mobilise farmers and corporations to unlock the value of nature and help restore the planet. While we’re rooted in agriculture, finance, and technology, our team of experts range from soil carbon scientists and software developers to market strategists and regulatory affairs experts. Over 160 employees across more than 30 nationalities are gathered under the common Agreena flag – either working from our headquarters in Copenhagen, offices in London, or remotely across Europe.

As a rapidly scaling climate agtech, Agreena provides solutions that drive both environmental and financial sustainability in farming. We have helped farmers across 20 countries in their journey from conventional agriculture to regenerative farming practices to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and remove CO2 from the atmosphere, storing it in soil. Our company offers a supportive and positive work environment with opportunities for learning, leading and growth no matter where you are in your professional journey. We believe in giving our employees a lot of responsibility, and we encourage new thinking, innovation and fun.

We are looking for an in-house Senior Applied Statistician to assist our Programme and Data teams. Across both, we are looking to better understand and explain our data in order to bolster our scientific rigour. You will sit between both teams and should be confident working with different types of statistical analysis, process-based modelling, and sampling/stratification.

Equally, you should have a good understanding of statistical modelling and bring a fresh perspective to our machine learning and process-based approaches. Thus, you will be a strong communicator capable of translating complex analysis into simplified insights to both internal and external stakeholders.

The Programme and Data teams are integral to the scientific operations of the company, and you will work closely together with them and our Product teams to ensure state of the art science drives our world leading carbon platform. As such, you will be part of a dynamic and high-paced work environment constantly subject to innovation.

How Will You Make An Impact

  • Estimating uncertainty and error propagation in our models;
  • Applying Bayesian methods for the calibration of complex process-based models;
  • Designing sampling strategies for our data collection campaigns;
  • Evaluating the quality and quantity of our data;
  • Communicating and visualising key insights;

Who We’re Looking For

  • Self-driven individual capable of collaborating in a multi-disciplinary environment;
  • Minimum Bachelors in Statistics, Mathematics, or appropriate science/engineering field;
  • 3+ years of experience working in a relevant field, with experience in some or all of the following:
  • Experience translating statistical models from notation form (e.g. research papers) into clean re-usable code
  • Working with temporal and spatial data;
  • Experience coding in R;
  • Handling unstructured and messy data.
  • Strong scientific writing, report creation and communication skills to audiences with a range of technical expertise.

Bonus Points If You Have

  • Masters or PhD in one of the relevant Science fields mentioned above;
  • A baseline understanding of greenhouse gas accounting frameworks and methodologies;
  • Strong theoretical background in Bayesian Statistics;
  • Knowledge or experience working with crop, pedometrics, or process-based models;
  • Experience coding in Python;

What’s In It For You

  • A unique opportunity to join and help shape a fast-growing tech scale up with the determination and ambitious mission to reverse climate change;
  • A truly global environment where you can collaborate and socialise with diverse and passionate colleagues;
  • Competitive compensation package and holidays;
  • Centrally located modern office in Copenhagen or London and the option to work from home a couple days a week;
  • Team events throughout the year;
  • An exciting purpose-led culture and mission;
  • Open communication and supportive feedback culture.

🌱 Not quite what you're looking for?

Stay connected with us by following our Agreena LinkedIn page. It's the best way to stay updated on our latest content, articles, and exciting new opportunities.

Plus, if you want to be the first to know about job openings in the departments you're interested in, you can subscribe to our job alerts talent pool.

🌍 Be your best self every day at Agreena

At Agreena, we are devoted to building an environment that promotes equality, inclusion, and diversity. As we embark on our journey of expansion and growth, we recognise the value of celebrating and embracing everyone's uniqueness. This diversity is crucial to our success and innovation. We aspire to build a product that is loved by our customers and we want the same to be reflected in our teams.

With this in mind, we're dedicated to ensuring that Agreena remains a welcoming and diverse environment for all.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hjælp verdens mest innovative virksomheder med at forbedre deres AI-modeller ved at give menneskelig feedback. Er du en erfaren matematikekspert, der gerne vil give din ekspertise til at træne AI-modeller?

Om Muligheden

Vi leder efter en talentfuld matematikekspert til at hjælpe med at træne generative kunstig intelligens-modeller. Denne freelancemulighed er fjern, og arbejdstiden er fleksible, så du kan arbejde, når det passer dig bedst. Du kan bidrage med din ekspertise ved at...

Vurdering af faktualitet og relevans af domænespecifik tekst produceret af AI-modeller

Udarbejdelse og besvarelse af spørgsmål relateret til matematik

Evaluering og rangering af domænespecifikke svar genereret af AI-modeller

Eksempler På Ønskelig Ekspertise

En bachelor eller højere grad i matematik eller et beslægtet fag

Erfaring med at arbejde som matematikprofessionel

Evne til at skrive klart om begreber relateret til matematik på flydende engelsk og Dansk

Betaling

Priserne varierer baseret på ekspertise, kompetencevurdering, placering, projektbehov og andre faktorer. For eksempel kan højere takster tilbydes ph.d.er. For ikke-kernearbejde, såsom under indledende projektonboarding eller projektoverarbejde, kan lavere takster gælde. Visse projekter tilbyder incitamentsbetalinger. Gennemgå venligst betalingsbetingelserne for hvert projekt.

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Er du klar til at dykke ned i de nyeste teknologier i Azure og Microsoft Fabric? Hos Kvik A/S har vi en mission: Vi vil bygge et vindende hold og skabe exceptionelle forretningsindsigter gennem data og applikationer. Vores mål er at vækste virksomheden og realisere vores ambitiøse digitale rejse.

Hvad tilbyder vi?


Hybrid arbejdsplads (minimum 2 dage på kontoret)
Hands-on erfaring med Microsoft Fabric
Spændende projekter samt et sjovt og udfordrende arbejdsmiljø
Muligheder for personlig og faglig udvikling
Fokus på jobtilfredshed i en åben og ærlig atmosfære
Ansvar og indflydelse i et selvstændigt team


Arbejdsområder

Som BI Consultant hos Kvik A/S vil du have følgende arbejdsområder:


Analyse og afdækning af forretnings behov
Løfte og udvikle eksisterende cloud platform til Fabric setup
Design, udvikling og implementering af BI-løsninger
Sikring af datakvalitet
Rådgive og understøtte stakeholders i brugen af BI-værktøjer
Identificere og implementere muligheder for automatisering og optimering
Tværfagligt samarbejde med andre teams om dataintegration og -analyse projekter
Vedligeholdelse og fejlfinding i eksisterende BI-systemer
Bidrage til at udforme og forbedre BI-strategier og -processer


Den ideelle kandidat

Vi ser den ideele kandidat besidde følgende:


Erfaring med SQL, Azure Data Factory, Microsoft Fabric, Python og datamodellering
Generel forståelse for agile arbejdsprincipper (DevOps) og git
Solid forretningsforståelse til at understøtte dialog med stakeholders


Om vores team

Vi er et ungt og dygtigt team, der trives med samarbejde, innovation og et omskifteligt landskab. Vi omfavner den agile metode og tror på at udfordre grænser, lære af fejl og fejre succeser sammen.

Din profil

Er du proaktiv og ansvarsfuld? Vi søger en kollega, der ikke er bange for at udfordre normen. Som BI Consultant kombinerer du teknisk viden med forretningsbehov.


Ansvar og initiativ: Du tager ansvar for dine opgaver
Nysgerrighed: Du stiller de svære spørgsmål og udforsker nye løsninger
Formidling af tekniske løsninger: Du kan oversætte komplekse tekniske begreber til forståeligt sprog for stakeholders
Samarbejde: Du trives med tværfagligt samarbejde
Minimum 2 års erfaring


For yderligere detaljer om denne fantastiske mulighed, kontakt vores Senior BI Architect, Victor D. K., på telefonnummer 22600424. Denne fuldtidsstilling er baseret hos Kvik A/S, Mosevej 3, 8240 Risskov. Der kan forekomme kørsel til hovedkontoret i Vildbjerg.
Show more

Title: Reporting Assistant (Interim Staff)
Description:
NTU International is a leading international consulting firm providing programme management and advisory services for development projects worldwide. For almost three decades, NTU has been delivering sustainable development projects and advisory services within engineering, policy, economics, and social fields.




We are currently compiling a pool of qualified professionals interested in the role of (Interim) Reporting Assistant to potentially support Frontex, an EU Institution based in Poland and a prospective client of NTU. Please note that this announcement does not represent a confirmed job offer. However, if NTU is awarded the tender procedure, individuals from the pool whose profiles align with the specific needs of the project will be contacted for potential engagement.




About the Position:

An esteemed EU institution is seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Reporting Assistant to provide temporary support in data analysis and statistical reporting. The selected candidate will assist in transforming data into clear, insightful reports to support decision-making processes within a dynamic, multicultural environment.




Key Responsibilities:

• Complete and oversee a variety of assignments involving the systematic collection, compilation, and interpretation of numerical data.

• Produce charts, tables, and graphs to visually represent statistical analysis.

• Prepare comprehensive statistical reports, including the interpretation of data sets.

• Assist in evaluating and interpreting research results.

• Develop sampling techniques and processes that are easy to analyze and interpret.




Requirements:

• Experience in data collection, statistical analysis, or reporting, preferably within an EU institution or public sector organization.

• Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and data visualization tools.

• Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail and accuracy.

• Ability to present data in a clear and accessible format for diverse audiences.

• Knowledge of statistical methods and techniques.

• Good written and verbal communication skills.

• Knowledge of EU working procedures and languages (English required, other EU languages are an asset).




What We Offer:

• A dynamic and multicultural work environment.

• Competitive remuneration based on experience and EU guidelines.

• Opportunity to gain experience within an EU institution.

We encourage applications from qualified individuals of all backgrounds.




Other information:

If you are interested in this position, please apply via LinkedIn and we will include you in the pool of interested candidates. When we have a job that fits your profile, we will contact you directly.




Only selected candidates will be contacted.

Show more
HTML:
NTU International is a leading international consulting firm providing programme management and advisory services for development projects worldwide. For almost three decades, NTU has been delivering sustainable development projects and advisory services within engineering, policy, economics, and social fields.


We are currently compiling a pool of qualified professionals interested in the role of (Interim) Reporting Assistant to potentially support Frontex, an EU Institution based in Poland and a prospective client of NTU. Please note that this announcement does not represent a confirmed job offer. However, if NTU is awarded the tender procedure, individuals from the pool whose profiles align with the specific needs of the project will be contacted for potential engagement.


About the Position:

An esteemed EU institution is seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Reporting Assistant to provide temporary support in data analysis and statistical reporting. The selected candidate will assist in transforming data into clear, insightful reports to support decision-making processes within a dynamic, multicultural environment.


Key Responsibilities:

• Complete and oversee a variety of assignments involving the systematic collection, compilation, and interpretation of numerical data.

• Produce charts, tables, and graphs to visually represent statistical analysis.

• Prepare comprehensive statistical reports, including the interpretation of data sets.

• Assist in evaluating and interpreting research results.

• Develop sampling techniques and processes that are easy to analyze and interpret.


Requirements:

• Experience in data collection, statistical analysis, or reporting, preferably within an EU institution or public sector organization.

• Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and data visualization tools.

• Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail and accuracy.

• Ability to present data in a clear and accessible format for diverse audiences.

• Knowledge of statistical methods and techniques.

• Good written and verbal communication skills.

• Knowledge of EU working procedures and languages (English required, other EU languages are an asset).


What We Offer:

• A dynamic and multicultural work environment.

• Competitive remuneration based on experience and EU guidelines.

• Opportunity to gain experience within an EU institution.

We encourage applications from qualified individuals of all backgrounds.


Other information:

If you are interested in this position, please apply via LinkedIn and we will include you in the pool of interested candidates. When we have a job that fits your profile, we will contact you directly.


Only selected candidates will be contacted.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Nabla Technologies er en mindre energy trading virksomhed beliggende midt i Aarhus. Vi specialiserer os i modelbaseret og automatiseret kortsigtet energy trading på de fleste amerikanske energimarkeder.




Vi søger en dygtig Quantitative Analyst, der kan blive en del af vores team og bidrage til den fortsatte udvikling af vores modelleringssetup. Som Quantitative Analyst vil du arbejde med alle faser af udviklingen af automatiserede handelsmodeller – fra feature engineering og design af deep learning-modeller til udarbejdelse af budstrategier og meget mere.




Dine kvalifikationer

Uddannelse inden for Data Science, Datalogi, Matematik, Statistik, Økonomi, Ingeniørvidenskab eller lignende.
Erfaring med modellering i PyTorch, TensorFlow og/eller JAX.
Gerne forståelse for finansielle markeder og erfaring med finansiel modellering.
Evne til at arbejde selvstændigt.




Om os

Nabla Technologies blev etableret i slutningen af 2021 og fokuserer på kortsigtet energy trading på de fleste amerikanske energimarkeder. Vores team består af specialister med stærke baggrunde inden for økonomi, statistik og datalogi. Vi opererer udelukkende med automatiserede tradingsystemer uden manuelle tradere.




Hos Nabla Technologies værdsætter vi personlig frihed og en sund work-life balance højt. Vi tilbyder fleksible arbejdstider og dyrker en positiv og afslappet atmosfære. Trods vores beskedne størrelse har vi opnået betydelige resultater.




Alle medarbejdere hos Nabla Technologies får fra starten et stort ansvar og gode muligheder for personlig og faglig udvikling. Vores arbejdsmiljø giver medarbejdere friheden til selv at strukturere deres arbejdstid på den måde, der bedst passer deres individuelle behov og kalender.




Vi har ikke ambitioner om at vokse til en stor organisation, men foretrækker at bevare en mindre og højkompetent gruppe af medarbejdere. Denne struktur holder os agile, innovative og tæt forbundne. Vi sætter stor pris på hver enkelt medarbejders ekspertise og arbejder kontinuerligt sammen om at forbedre vores teknologi og processer. Vores ambition er at være på forkant inden for automatiseret energy trading, samtidig med at vi nyder godt af et samarbejdende, støttende og inspirerende arbejdsmiljø.




Praktiske oplysninger

Startdato: Hurtigst muligt
Lokation: Fysisk på vores kontor i Aarhus eller delvist remote
Kompensation: Konkurrencedygtig løn med mulighed for bonus og/eller medarbejderaktier
Arbejdstider: Fleksible, men primært inden for normale kontortider.




Kontakt os

Hvis du mener, at du er et godt match til denne stilling, bedes du sende din ansøgning, CV, samt karakterblad hvis du har under to års erfaring, til thomas@nablatech.net. Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig. Undlad venligst at ansøge via "Easy Apply" på LinkedIn, da disse ansøgninger ikke vil blive taget i betragtning.




Hvis du har spørgsmål, er du også velkommen til at kontakte Thomas Hoffmann Nielsen på thomas@nablatech.net.

Show more
