Title: Data Engineer (Student Assistant)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Management PrimeServ DK

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Student Assistant Data Engineer to join our Data Management department. This role offers an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data engineering, working with cutting-edge technologies and contributing to the development of our data infrastructure.

As a Student Assistant Data Engineer, you will support the team in managing and optimizing our data systems, ensuring data quality, and developing data pipelines. You will work closely with experienced data engineers and analysts to deliver high-quality data solutions.

You Will Play An Important Role In


Assisting in the design, development, and maintenance of data pipelines (ETL/ELT processes) using Azure services.
Writing and optimizing SQL queries for data extraction and transformation.
Supporting data modeling efforts to ensure data is structured effectively for analysis.
Implementing data quality checks and monitoring data integrity.
Developing and deploying machine learning and AI models in the cloud.
Collaborating with stakeholders to gather data requirements and deliver data solutions.
Assisting in the development and maintenance data products documentation.
Conducting research and staying updated on the latest data engineering, AI, and cloud development trends and technologies.
Providing support in data visualization and reporting tasks.


We Imagine That You


Are currently enrolled in a university program (preferably in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, or a related field that includes Business Analytics or AI).
Have a basic understanding of core data concepts, including data types, quality, governance, and security.
Have had an introduction to SQL and have touched upon concepts such as data modeling and pipelines.
Have some experience with programming languages such as Python.
Have an interest in AI and machine learning, with some knowledge of basic ML concepts.
Are familiar with data tools (e.g., Power BI or Excel) and can create basic reports and dashboards.
Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Are able to work independently and as part of a team.
Have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Are fluent in English.


Benefits


Gain hands-on experience in data engineering and data management.
Help solve real business problems using ML or AI models.
Work in a dynamic and supportive environment.
Flexible working hours to accommodate your academic schedule.
Opportunity to contribute to significant data and AI projects and make an impact.


Welcome to Data Management in PrimeServ DK

Our department is dedicated to managing and optimizing the organization's data assets. We work collaboratively to ensure data quality, develop data solutions, and support data-driven decision-making across the organization. Our team values innovation, continuous learning, and teamwork.

Unleash your potential: Join us towards a carbon-neutral future

We offer you an opportunity to help shape the world of tomorrow – whether you are just starting out, taking your first career steps after graduation, or looking for the next big career challenge.

At MAN Energy Solutions, we focus on diversity and equality to create a creative and inclusive culture. We believe that a diverse workforce with a mix of gender, nationalities, and perspectives will drive innovation, creativity and productivity. We are committed to our employees’ well-being, and you will have the opportunity to join different social activities from yoga and fishing to creative clubs.

We prioritize work-life balance, offering flexible working hours, the possibility of working from home, and mental well-being including health insurance and focus on work atmosphere. Here you have opportunities for growth, development, and mentorship.

In 2027, MAN Energy Solutions will move to Trekroner in Roskilde. Here we will consolidate all our current locations on Zealand into one large site.

About The Student Network

The MAN Student Network is a community made for students by students at MAN Energy Solutions Denmark. The network has the purpose of connecting students in Denmark with the benefit of establishing strong academic and social relationships across group departments, but also as an opportunity to expand the academic network, which ultimately may prove to provide the first full scale step toward a future career at MAN Energy Solutions.

The students within the network have the opportunity to provide recommendations and improvements and actively affect the concept of this network.

About MAN Energy Solutions


250 years of experience in advanced engineering
We deliver a unique portfolio of technologies and opportunities in the development of engines for use on ships and in power plants across the globe
We operate under the motto "Future in The Making" as it reflects our dedication to developing sustainable solutions and actively contributing to a carbon-neutral economy
We have over 15,000 employees worldwide. In Denmark, we are more than 2,500 passionate employees from over 55 nationalities


Build your own future

Please submit your application to us no later than Wednesday, the 30th of April, 2025. We will conduct interviews during the application period. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Francisco Moreano Lasso by phone (+45) 81 75 80 58. More information about the company can be found at www.man-es.com .

In MAN Energy Solutions, we strive for an inclusive and fair recruitment process for our job applicants based on equity. We encourage all qualified candidates, regardless of gender, age, religion, disability and ethnic background to apply for this position. Therefore, please refrain from attaching a photo to your CV or cover letter. Furthermore, assistive tools will be available when needed, for example for dyslexia.

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Lead & Shape the Future of Marketing Analytics at Lunar!

At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus and Stockholm 🚀

So who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both, breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.

As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Senior Marketing Data Analyst to lead and develop our marketing analytics function. This is a pivotal role where you will take full ownership of our marketing data strategy, driving advanced analytics and automation to optimize marketing ROI and scale our growth across the Nordics.

Be in the Driver’s Seat

As our new Senior Marketing Data Analyst, you won’t just be working with data—you will be shaping and evolving the way we leverage data across marketing. You will set the vision for how we use analytics to fuel our marketing efforts, establish best practices, and build a function that delivers high-impact insights and measurable business outcomes.

You’ll be based in Copenhagen, embedded within our Audience and Acquisition team, reporting to Sally Armstrong. The team currently comprises 5 amazing individuals focused on leveraging data-driven insights to fuel customer acquisition and engagement within the broader Marketing function, led by Manuel Douchez. But you’ll be the one steering the marketing analytics ship - driving strategy, developing methodologies, and making sure data is at the heart of every decision we make.

What Will You Do?

Set and drive the strategy for marketing analytics, defining how we measure and optimize marketing effectiveness.

Establish and implement best practices for data analysis, reporting, and visualization, ensuring marketing performance is continuously improved.

Lead and innovate in advanced attribution modeling, leveraging machine learning, MMM (Marketing Mix Modeling), and Bayesian techniques to optimize marketing investments.

Develop and champion best-in-class marketing measurement methodologies, ensuring data integrity and actionable insights.

Take ownership of incrementality testing and media experimentation to enhance ROI and inform strategic decision-making.

Collaborate cross-functionally with data teams in Commercial, Product, and Finance to ensure alignment in methodologies, shared learnings, and commercial impact.

Act as the key strategic partner for marketing leadership, providing data-driven recommendations that shape our marketing approach.

Automate marketing analytics processes, leveraging AI and cutting-edge tools to enhance efficiency and insight generation.

Serve as the go-to expert for marketing data, ensuring all marketing initiatives align with broader business intelligence efforts.

Curious About the Lunar Culture? 💚

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.

Is This You? Let’s Find Out!

We’re looking for someone who is eager to take ownership, build something incredible, and truly shape the future of marketing analytics at Lunar. If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you!

Proven experience in a marketing data analytics or business intelligence role, ideally with a strong commercial focus.

Expertise in advanced attribution models, including MMM, machine learning, Bayesian techniques, and media mix modeling.

Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools.

Experience with Looker, Funnel.io, dbt, AWS, Redshift, Airflow, Git, or similar technologies.

Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and executive-level reporting.

A passion for automation, AI-driven analytics, and streamlining marketing data processes.

Experience working cross-functionally, ensuring data-driven marketing decisions are aligned with commercial goals.

Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.

Experience in high-volume, complex data environments such as fintech, banking, or large-scale consumer technology companies.

Are You Ready to Build the Future?

Apply now and let’s explore how you can take Lunar’s marketing analytics to the next level!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰

Depending on the regulations in the country you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.

Lead and innovate in advanced attribution modeling, leveraging machine learning, MMM (Marketing Mix Modeling), and Bayesian techniques to optimize marketing investments.
Develop and champion best-in-class marketing measurement methodologies, ensuring data integrity and actionable insights.
Take ownership of incrementality testing and media experimentation to enhance ROI and inform strategic decision-making.
Collaborate cross-functionally with data teams in Commercial, Product, and Finance to ensure alignment in methodologies, shared learnings, and commercial impact.
Act as the key strategic partner for marketing leadership, providing data-driven recommendations that shape our marketing approach.
Automate marketing analytics processes, leveraging AI and cutting-edge tools to enhance efficiency and insight generation.
Serve as the go-to expert for marketing data, ensuring all marketing initiatives align with broader business intelligence efforts.




Curious About the Lunar Culture? 💚

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.

Is This You? Let’s Find Out!




We’re looking for someone who is eager to take ownership, build something incredible, and truly shape the future of marketing analytics at Lunar. If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you!

Proven experience in a marketing data analytics or business intelligence role, ideally with a strong commercial focus.
Expertise in advanced attribution models, including MMM, machine learning, Bayesian techniques, and media mix modeling.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools.
Experience with Looker, Funnel.io, dbt, AWS, Redshift, Airflow, Git, or similar technologies.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and executive-level reporting.
A passion for automation, AI-driven analytics, and streamlining marketing data processes.
Experience working cross-functionally, ensuring data-driven marketing decisions are aligned with commercial goals.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
Experience in high-volume, complex data environments such as fintech, banking, or large-scale consumer technology companies.




Are You Ready to Build the Future?

Apply now and let’s explore how you can take Lunar’s marketing analytics to the next level!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰




Depending on the regulations in the country you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.

Title: Data Intern
Description:
Data Intern

Step away from the books this fall and dive into something completely different... 




At Clearwater Denmark, we are on a mission to get smarter about using data and automating the repetitive stuff. We want to work smarter: From creating the most valuable data sets to freeing up time and brainpower for what really matters in M&A. We have some ideas but are missing the right person to turn them into reality and push us beyond the limits of Excel. 




That is where you come in. We are looking for a sharp, tech-savvy student to join our small (but ambitious) Deal Excellence team for a Fall 2025 internship. We have reserved a seat for you on the 17th floor and cannot wait to gather around the screen with a big mug of coffee and brainstorm new solutions.




Your responsibilities

Play a key role in fast-tracking and shaping our strategic efforts to work smarter 
Work on a wide variety of tasks, tailored to fit your skills and desired outcome of the internship
Build, improve, and update multi-source databases that are critical for winning and executing deals
Analyze, automate, and/or implement new processes to reduce workload and increase efficiency  




Your profile

Master student likely with a focus on tech, data, and/or analytics (eligible for internship) 
Structured, diligent, and detail-oriented
Quick learner
Passionate about optimizing how things work - especially via automation/use of technology
Tech lover and already an avid user of GenAI
Experienced user of Excel (incl. VBA) and potentially PowerBI
Curiosity for M&A is welcomed, but not a requirement




What you’ll get

Hands-on coaching and frequent feedback from working directly with the Head of Deal Excellence and COO at Clearwater Denmark
“Behind the scenes” insight into the dynamic world of M&A including how to run and scale a high-performing company
A fun, vibrant, and young environment with plenty of social activities: Weekly running club, monthly celebrations, epic parties, and much more
A warm and welcoming team culture where we look after each other
Daily “wow”-effect (and stunning ocean views) from working at our new office on the 17th floor
Freshly prepared meals every day - breakfast, lunch, and snacks - courtesy of our amazing in-house chef 




Do not tick all the boxes? Try applying anyways. We encourage everyone to apply regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, and background. 




Apply no later than May 2nd. Early applications are encouraged, as interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis.




Who is Clearwater?

Clearwater is the leading adviser in company acquisitions and divestments in the mid-market segment, with more than 425 experienced professionals in 21 offices across 12 European countries.




In Denmark, our 60 employees in Aarhus and Copenhagen form one of the country’s largest and most experienced corporate finance teams.

Over the past 30 years, we have advised business owners, private equity firms, and corporates, successfully completing 20+ transactions annually in Denmark in the last three years.




At Clearwater, our people are our greatest asset. We foster an environment that values industry expertise, diverse perspectives, and professional development—ensuring that we deliver high- quality strategic advice and solutions to help our clients achieve their objectives.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Commercial Strategy & Management (Private & Business Banking)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a data-driven strategist ready to fuel growth in a dynamic fintech environment? Lunar is revolutionizing Nordic banking, and we need a Senior Business Data Analyst to optimize monetization, sales, and partnerships across our private and business platforms.

At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus and Stockholm 🚀

So who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both, breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.

As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Senior Business Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision-making across monetization, sales, and partnerships so that we can optimize growth and commercial impact.

As our new Senior Business Data Analyst, you will be part of our Commercial team, reporting to Christian Sillesen, Head of Commercial. The team currently comprises a talented and ambitious group across Copenhagen and Stockholm, working on enhancing Lunar’s commercial performance through data-driven insights within the broader Commercial function, led by Mats Persson, Chief Commercial Officer.

What will you do?

Monetization Optimization: Analyze user behavior and optimize pricing, promotions, and revenue generation.

Sales Lead Generation & Performance: Leverage data to improve lead generation and develop predictive sales models.

Partnership Performance Analysis: Evaluate ROI and track performance of strategic partnerships.

Price & Deposit Analysis: Conduct pricing and deposit trend analysis and provide competitive insights.

Data-Driven Insights & Reporting: Extract, clean, and analyze data to generate actionable business insights.

Curious about the Lunar culture? 💚

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.

We're excited to welcome everyone to apply for this impactful role! We can’t wait to follow up with talents who we believe are the best fit based on the following criteria:

Who are you?

3-7 years experience as a Data Analyst (commercial/fintech/banking preferred).

Strong expertise in SQL (R, Python) and data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI).

Experience with statistical analysis and data modeling.

Ability to analyze large datasets and extract key trends.

Strong understanding of commercial KPIs.

Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Experience with HubSpot or similar CRM systems is a plus.

Familiarity with pricing analysis and working with data engineers is a plus.

Are you ready to join the journey? Apply now and let’s find out more!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰

Depending on the regulations in the country you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.

Title: Student Analyst
Description:
Nabla Technologies er en mindre energy trading virksomhed beliggende midt i Aarhus. Vi specialiserer os i modelbaseret og automatiseret kortsigtet energy trading på de fleste amerikanske energimarkeder.




Vi søger en engageret Student Analyst, der har flair for både datahåndtering og analyse. Du vil blive en del af vores dynamiske team, hvor du får mulighed for at arbejde med- og lære fra erfarne fagfolk inden for økonomi, statistik og softwareudvikling. Stillingen er ideel for dig, der ønsker at supplere dine studier med praksisnær erfaring inden for energy trading og databehandling.




Dine opgaver

Udvikling og automatisering af dataudtræk og rapporter
Analyser, der understøtter vores algoritmiske handelsaktiviteter
Mulighed for let Python-programmering til datahåndtering og scripting




Dine kvalifikationer

Solid erfaring med SQL
Kendskab til Python, gerne i forbindelse med dataanalyse eller scripting
Det er en fordel, hvis du er interesseret i finansielle og økonomiske emner
Du arbejder selvstændigt og tager ansvar for dine opgaver




Vi tilbyder

Fleksible arbejdstider, der passer til din studiekalender
Et inspirerende miljø med mulighed for at lære om automatiseret energy trading
Tæt samarbejde med et ambitiøst og hjælpsomt team
Mulighed for at omsætte teoretisk viden til praktisk erfaring




Om os

Nabla Technologies blev etableret i slutningen af 2021 og fokuserer på kortsigtet energy trading på de fleste amerikanske energimarkeder. Vores team består af specialister med stærke baggrunde inden for økonomi, statistik og datalogi. Vi opererer udelukkende med automatiserede tradingsystemer uden manuelle tradere.




Hos Nabla Technologies værdsætter vi personlig frihed og en sund work-life balance højt. Vi tilbyder fleksible arbejdstider og dyrker en positiv og afslappet atmosfære. Trods vores beskedne størrelse har vi opnået betydelige resultater.




Alle medarbejdere hos Nabla Technologies får fra starten et stort ansvar og gode muligheder for personlig og faglig udvikling. Vores arbejdsmiljø giver medarbejdere friheden til selv at strukturere deres arbejdstid på den måde, der bedst passer deres individuelle behov og kalender.




Vi har ikke ambitioner om at vokse til en stor organisation, men foretrækker at bevare en mindre og højkompetent gruppe af medarbejdere. Denne struktur holder os agile, innovative og tæt forbundne. Vi sætter stor pris på hver enkelt medarbejders ekspertise og arbejder kontinuerligt sammen om at forbedre vores teknologi og processer. Vores ambition er at være på forkant inden for automatiseret energy trading, samtidig med at vi nyder godt af et samarbejdende, støttende og inspirerende arbejdsmiljø.




Praktiske oplysninger

Startdato: Hurtigst muligt
Lokation: Fysisk på vores kontor i Aarhus eller delvist remote
Kompensation: Konkurrencedygtig løn med mulighed for bonus og/eller medarbejderaktier
Arbejdstider: Fleksible, men primært inden for normale kontortider.




Kontakt os

Hvis du mener, at du er et godt match til denne stilling, bedes du sende din ansøgning, CV, samt karakterblad hvis du har under to års erfaring, til thomas@nablatech.net. Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig. Undlad venligst at ansøge via "Easy Apply" på LinkedIn, da disse ansøgninger ikke vil blive taget i betragtning.




Hvis du har spørgsmål, er du også velkommen til at kontakte Thomas Hoffmann Nielsen på thomas@nablatech.net.




Show more

Title: Impact Analyzer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for an Impact Analyser to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.

How you can contribute and have an impact?


Follow and measure the impact of the incubators work and ensure the sustainability aspect within the projects and activities and to record/share learnings.
Impact Measurement: Develop and implement metrics and methodologies to measure the impact of incubator projects and activities.
Sustainability Assurance: Ensure that all projects and activities within the incubator are designed and executed with sustainability in mind.
Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of incubator initiatives.
Reporting: Prepare detailed reports on the impact and sustainability of projects, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
Knowledge Sharing: Record and share learnings from incubator projects with internal teams and external stakeholders to promote best practices and continuous improvement.
Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with project teams, mentors, and external partners to gather feedback and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.


What we look for:


Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
Business viability mindset.
New business model experience
Customer journey understanding.
Lifecycle management.
New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
Workshop animation.
Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.


Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands


Show more
HTML:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for an Impact Analyser to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.

How you can contribute and have an impact?

  • Follow and measure the impact of the incubators work and ensure the sustainability aspect within the projects and activities and to record/share learnings.
  • Impact Measurement: Develop and implement metrics and methodologies to measure the impact of incubator projects and activities.
  • Sustainability Assurance: Ensure that all projects and activities within the incubator are designed and executed with sustainability in mind.
  • Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of incubator initiatives.
  • Reporting: Prepare detailed reports on the impact and sustainability of projects, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
  • Knowledge Sharing: Record and share learnings from incubator projects with internal teams and external stakeholders to promote best practices and continuous improvement.
  • Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with project teams, mentors, and external partners to gather feedback and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
  • Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.

What we look for:

  • Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
  • Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
  • Business viability mindset.
  • New business model experience
  • Customer journey understanding.
  • Lifecycle management.
  • New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
  • Workshop animation.
  • Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
  • Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
  • Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.

Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands

Title: Data Analytics Business Partner
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified BCorp with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Tech offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 116 million registered users and 243,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 431+million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.165.000 tonnes of CO2e!

This role can be based either in Copenhagen or London.

Your mission

We are looking for a Data Analytics Business Partner to strengthen our knowledge around how to drive excellence in Operations.

While you will report directly to the Director of Analytics, you will work closely with our Strategy & Expansion teams, as well as members of the Global Management Team. Your mission will be to work as a trusted advisor to leadership in driving key strategic decisions, mapping strategy to data-driven ways of working, and championing scaled analysis across our Cluster Business Partnering team. You will be 1 of 6 Business Partners: while the others are dedicated to an Operational Leadership team in regional markets, you’ll be working on connecting the dots at the global level. The Business Partnering team works closely together to share cross-country insights in an efficient and scalable way.

Your role


Provide deep analytical insights to inform timely Sales, Strategy and Leadership decisions - either proactively, on a regular cadence (QBRs, MBRs), or through ad hoc projects
Mobilize the Cluster Business Partners to bring relevant & actionable insights from the rest of the Data & Analytics team to the Regional Operations leadership teams
Utilize the deep in-market expertise of the Cluster Business Partner team to proactively identify and build opportunities for scale and automation; prioritize and advocate for further scale via data products with our Solutions team
Elevate our Global Analytics specialisation by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects
Opportunity size and prioritise analytics ideas and questions from common themes across our markets and clusters, with the support of the COO, the Strategy team, and Operations VPs in our Expansion Markets


Requirements


You have significant experience in an analytical role supporting 2 or more of the following functions: Sales, Marketing, Operations, Finance, Strategy, Business Operations; or relevant work experience in Consulting
You are proficient in SQL, comfortable with Python or R, and proficient in manipulating data efficiently for ad-hoc analysis
You are experienced with Data Visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, PowerBI or similar
You are comfortable describing statistical uncertainty and educating non-technical audiences on how best to interpret and action off of new insights
You have proven experience in stakeholder management, with the ability to manage a high influx of requests in a structured way
You are driven by the “why” behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure you’re solving for the right thing
You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment
You have the ability to communicate effectively and convincingly in an English-speaking organisation
Previous experience in a hyper growth start-up environment will be valued


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


A rare opportunity to work in a social impact company (and certified B Corporation!) where you get to wake up every day knowing you’re achieving positive change.
The opportunity to truly drive impact within your domain towards a planet with no food waste.
The experience of being part of an international company with 1300 + enthusiastic and highly talented teammates across 19 countries (and counting) – always ready to share knowledge and support!
Strong personal as well as professional development in an intense and high-growth scale-up environment.
An open company culture where you have the independence and room to unleash your creativity.
A strong team culture where successes are celebrated together.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above.
Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Please submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Azure Data Engineer




Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses og MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi bruger teknologier som Databricks, Fabric, Spark, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory og Azure Synapse. Vi søger profiler med erfaring inden for enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som vil bygge innovative dataløsninger.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.




Hvilken rolle får du?




Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.




Din rolle bliver at




rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code, fx. Terraform
fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Du har en videregående uddannelse i software engineering, human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU samt erfaring i data engineering
Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring, kan skrive Python og har lyst til data engineering-delen - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
Du har erfaring med - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Spark - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling




Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere




Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.




Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.




Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.




Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Title: Student Assistant with a flair for Data modelling and Reporting
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in this role where you’ll will provide cost transparency, gather data, and generate reports for chargeback of infrastructure costs to the relevant applications / business units. You will provide accessible and timely reports and support the users with information on products and prices, as well as working with optimization of the data model and reporting process.

Welcome to DK CC Digital WP Engineering

You’ll be part of our infrastructure cost team (FinOps) where you, together with your colleagues, will work with IT- Finance to support management and teams in taking data driven decisions that creates business value.

As a team, we are a global diverse group and we’re focused on our team within the agile framework.

You’ll play an important role in:


Providing transparency of IT infrastructure costs through reporting
Gathering data and generate reports for chargeback of infrastructure costs to the relevant applications / business units
Working with data modelling in Power BI
Engaging in dialogue with business units for optimization of models for transparency of infrastructure costs
Supporting our colleagues by communicating information about IT infrastructure products and prices.


To succeed in the role, you:


are enrolled in a relevant study programme at, e.g., CBS, KU, ITU, or DTU
have an analytical mindset with strong quantitative and problem-solving skills, as well as an eye for details
possess strong communication skills, enabling you to communicate topics in a clear and concise manner both orally and in writing
have the ability to speak and write English fluently
have a strong personal drive and are able to work independently, while also being a genuine team player.


Maybe you’ve read the above and can see you have some transferable skills, even though they don’t quite match all the points. If you think you can bring something to the team, we still encourage you to apply.

Shape the future with us

Send your application to us as soon as possible. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we’ve found the right candidate.

As an applicant or employee, you may request reasonable work and position accommodation or adjustments via accommodation@orsted.com.

Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country. We don't take applications or inquiries from external recruiters or agencies into account for this position.

  • Supporting our colleagues by communicating information about IT infrastructure products and prices.

To succeed in the role, you:

  • are enrolled in a relevant study programme at, e.g., CBS, KU, ITU, or DTU
  • have an analytical mindset with strong quantitative and problem-solving skills, as well as an eye for details
  • possess strong communication skills, enabling you to communicate topics in a clear and concise manner both orally and in writing
  • have the ability to speak and write English fluently
  • have a strong personal drive and are able to work independently, while also being a genuine team player.

Maybe you’ve read the above and can see you have some transferable skills, even though they don’t quite match all the points. If you think you can bring something to the team, we still encourage you to apply.

Shape the future with us

Send your application to us as soon as possible. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we’ve found the right candidate.

As an applicant or employee, you may request reasonable work and position accommodation or adjustments via accommodation@orsted.com.

Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country. We don't take applications or inquiries from external recruiters or agencies into account for this position.

Title: Studiejob i Finans & Business Intelligence hos Foodpeople
Place: Kastrup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vil du have et studiejob, hvor du får hands-on erfaring med finans og business intelligence i en spændende fødevarevirksomhed? Foodpeople søger en skarp og analytisk studentermedhjælper, der vil være med til at styrke vores finans- og BI-funktion.




Om Foodpeople

Foodpeople er passionerede omkring godt brød og autentiske smagsoplevelser. Vi står bag en række stærke brands, herunder Il Fornaio og Jalm&B, og vi arbejder hver dag for at bringe kvalitetsprodukter til forbrugere, caféer og supermarkeder i- og udenfor Danmark.




Om jobbet

Som studentermedhjælper i Finans & Business Intelligence vil du få en vigtig rolle i at understøtte vores økonomi- og analysefunktion med data, rapportering og indsigt, der understøtter forretningens beslutninger. Dine primære opgaver vil være:

Assistere med finansiel rapportering og dataanalyse
Udarbejde BI-rapporter og dashboards i Power BI
Bidrage til løbende optimering af økonomiske processer
Supportere med ad hoc-analyser og projektopgaver




Hvad tilbyder vi?

Forståelse for hele værdikæden – Foodpeople driver hele forsyningskæden fra indkøb af råvarer til produktion og lagerstyring til salg og marketing. Dette giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med data og finansiel indsigt ved at få fuld forståelse af virksomhedens ERP system.
Et stærkt læringsmiljø – Du får mulighed for at arbejde tæt sammen med erfarne specialister inden for BI og finans, som vil dele deres viden og støtte din faglige udvikling.
Et fleksibelt studiejob (ca. 15 timer om ugen) med mulighed for at tilpasse arbejdstiderne efter dit studie
En dynamisk og uformel arbejdsplads med et engageret team
En unik mulighed for at få indsigt i en succesfuld fødevarevirksomhed i vækst




Hvem er du?

Vi søger en struktureret og analytisk studerende, der har en interesse for økonomi, data og forretningsanalyse. Derudover forestiller vi os, at du:

Er i gang med en relevant videregående uddannelse (fx økonomi, finans, business analytics, data science eller lignende)
Har flair for tal og dataanalyse samt en god forståelse for Excel og Power BI
Er detaljeorienteret, nysgerrig og har en proaktiv tilgang til opgaver
Har gode kommunikationsevner og kan formidle data på en letforståelig måde




Interesseret?

Hvis du vil være en del af vores team, så send din ansøgning og CV hurtigst muligt til ansogning@foodpeople.dk. Samtaler afholdes i starten af maj.

 

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!




 

Om Foodpeople – vores historie og vækst

Foodpeople blev grundlagt med en mission om at bringe ægte håndværksbrød til det danske marked. Med en passion for kvalitet og gode råvarer har virksomheden udviklet sig til en af Danmarks førende aktører inden for premium brødprodukter.

Vores brands, Il Fornaio og Jalm&B, er kendt for deres autentiske smag og bæredygtige tilgang til bagning. I dag leverer vi produkter til både detailhandel, foodservice og eksportmarkeder.

Foodpeople har de seneste år oplevet stærk vækst, og vi beskæftiger nu over 100 medarbejdere. Med en moderne produktion, en innovativ tilgang til fødevareudvikling og en stærk forankring i bæredygtighed og kvalitet er vi på en spændende rejse mod fortsat vækst.

Show more

Title: Business Analyst for Group Market Data
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you ready to facilitate strategic decision-making at Danske Bank? Join our dynamic team, collaborating with reputable firms like Bloomberg and MSCI, to optimize market data utilisation. Seize the opportunity to deepen your expertise in trading and investments, contributing to strategic projects and best-fit solutions in our organisation.

Join Group Market Data Management

The Group Market Data department at Danske Bank provides essential data for decision-making across the organisation. We are committed to providing accurate and timely market data to support trading, risk management, and strategic planning. Our team collaborates closely with traders, risk managers, and IT specialists to ensure seamless integration and optimal utilisation of market data, fostering innovation and enhanced performance.

As part of the Group Market Data team, you will join a dynamic group of professionals who are interested in applying the power of data. Our team works on key projects that enhance data accessibility and reliability, contributing significantly to the bank's strategic objectives. We value collaboration, creativity, and a proactive approach, ensuring that each team member's expertise is leveraged for collective success.

This role offers a unique opportunity to deepen your understanding of vital data utilised across Danske Bank in trading, investments, and customer advisory. You will work closely with a network of dedicated professionals and engage with our global vendor partners, including Bloomberg, London Stock Exchange Group, and MSCI, to ensure the best fit quality of market data. Collaboration with your team members and experts across the bank will be key, as will managing both internal, external, and contractual relationships. You will:


Take ownership of internal stakeholder relationships, ensuring their data needs are met.
Manage a portfolio of external providers, maintaining strong and effective partnerships.
Lead or contribute to strategic projects involving third-party data solutions.
Align business requirements with external data offerings to optimise value.
Negotiate favourable terms and price-quality ratios with suppliers.


Motivated, Analytical, and Collaborative Professional

We seek a person who is self-driven and motivated, ready to enhance our team's success through collaboration and support, both professionally and socially. Your drive for success, a collaborative approach, and brings analytical skills, and experience in working with financial data into our team. Ideally you:


Hold a Master’s or equivalent degree in finance, business, IT, or law.
Possess 2-3 years of experience within the banking business or financial sector.
Have prior experience with data analysis, IT, and/or vendor management.
Strong procurement, negotiation, and contractual skills.
Effective communication and collaborative skills, enhancing a great workplace environment.
Fluency in English, both written and spoken


Does this sound intriguing and engaging to you?

At Danske Bank, we value diversity and consider it a key factor for building engaged and efficient teams. If you motivated to join us, we would like to hear from you.

Please apply by submitting your CV, ensuring it includes details that specifies how you meet our criteria. Applications are processed on a continuous basis, so apply as soon as possible. For further questions, feel free to contact Claus Thorball, Head of Group Market Data Management at clt@danskebank.dk.

We look forward to hearing from you.

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Engineer




Looking for one of those rare Data Engineer jobs, where you get to manage the ingestion of 100s of GB of data and to do so in a small team with a flat hierarchy, where you actually have a say?  




Well good news: We’re offering one of those rare opportunities just now. 




You’ll be building and scaling data infrastructure to handle massive volumes of user-generated data, powering real-time, high-impact solutions that drive key product and business decisions. With cutting-edge technologies at your fingertips, you’ll have the freedom to take ownership, innovate, and watch your ideas shape real-world outcomes from day one.




Sounds pretty sweet, no? Hopefully you’ll find it even more sweet after reading the mandatory bulleted lists for any job description:  




What you’ll be doing. 

Support developing our data platform
Develop, and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines for processing, transforming, and storing large volumes of data
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and ensure data availability for analytical purpose 
Implement data security and privacy measures to safeguard sensitive information 
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies to recommend and implement best practices for data engineering. 




We imagine you’re someone who has: 

A bachelor’s degree in engineering
Minimum of 3+ years of practical experience in Data Engineer role with a focus on data pipeline orchestration and data modeling
Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, SQL
Solid understanding of data modeling, database design, and data warehousing concepts
Minimum of 2+ years experience working with AWS data tech stack (Athena, RDS/Aurora, Glue, DynamoDB, Lambda)
AI / ML deployment preferable with AWS native tools (SageMaker, Bedrock)
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
Great communication skills in English




How is it working at OOONO?

We’re glad we asked. It’s a nice working place. As in nice-nice. We have a relaxed, informal atmosphere and a flat hierarchy. Whenever you need a break from your important work stuff, you can get beat in table tennis, foosball, or just smalltalk about the weather by the coffee machine. We have monthly social events where we do anything from go-karting to going to festivals. 

And when we’re not social? Then we’re pretty damn ambitious. We don’t like conservative targets or linear growth. We’re all about the extraordinary. This has led OOONO to become one of the fastest-growing tech scaleups and surprise-surprise: We have no plans of slowing down. So yes, OOONO is a lovely place to work, but it’s also a pretty good opportunity to develop as a person and take the next steps in your career. 




The practical stuff

Start date: ASAP
Send a motivated CV to job@ooono.dk
Working hours: Full-time (37 hours)
Location: Gearhalsvej 1.1, 2500 Valby.
Show more

Title: Data & Analytics Manager
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
ARE YOU READY TO ENABLE GANNI TO SCALE BY ENABLING BETTER DATA ANALYSIS AND DECISION-MAKING WITH OUR NEW MODERN DATA PLATFORM?

WE ARE LOOKING FOR A DATA MANAGER TO JOIN OUR EXCITING GROWTH JOURNEY.

Your Missing & Responsibilities Ahead Of You

GANNI is on an exciting growth journey, aiming to become a digital-first, direct-to-consumer brand. To achieve this, our Digital Development & Data department plays a key role in building a future-proof technical landscape that supports our ambitions.

We are currently in a transition phase, establishing a modern, scalable data platform and reporting framework based on Microsoft Fabric. This means you’ll have the opportunity to work with new technology while also shaping the way we do things. Your expertise will help define best practices and ensure our data infrastructure is built for the future.

The Data & Analytics Manager you will be responsible for the data team consisting of a Data Engineer and a Data Analyst. The Data team is part of the Digital Development & Data Management department which covers a lot of different areas from Data platform & Analytics, Integrations, ERP, Omnichannel & PMO.

As a Data Manager be responsible for the Data Platform & Analytics development backlog. You will take the lead and participate in stakeholder meetings with different departments, scoping sessions and work hands-on with development ensuring we follow architectural guidelines.

We’re looking for someone who actively ensures stable and efficient operations while continuously improving and refining our data infrastructure as well as securing a good and professional work environment for your team.

You have experience collaborating across all levels of the business and working closely with departments like Finance, Sales, Operations, and Marketing. We see you as a trusted advisor for all things related to Business Intelligence, automation, and reporting - someone who can provide guidance on any questions that arise. You act as a technical sparring partner, supporting new business initiatives and advising on how to best utilize and activate data.

We believe that this position holds a lot of space for you to grow professionally in an international environment where you combine data, people and technology! You enjoy a dynamic environment in a growth organisation where you will have the opportunity to develop yourself over time with new responsibilities.

Responsibilities Ahead Of You


Being a people manager and leading a team of two (Data Engineer and Data Analyst) as well as 1-2 external data engineers in all development related work in all from data integration, data transformation to data visualisation.
Maintain and steer the Data Platform & Analytics backlog and priorities.
Participate and lead scoping sessions with business stakeholders.
Responsible for translating business requirements into a technical solution
Making sure to have a consistent technical direction of the data deliverables to ensure a futureproof architecture
Be an advisor and sparring partner for different departments as well as for the department manager.
Perform code reviews for and with colleagues and externals
Ensure a stable data platform and reporting landscape meeting end-user expectations
Collaborate closely with ex. Integration Architects to support each other on integration and for enabling data products for the integration platform
Like and thrive in working hands-on and can support when needed on technical issues and development.


Must Have Requirements


Have experience from roles as a Data/BI architect, Senior BI consultant or Data Engineer either in-house or from a consultant company.
Experience as a manager (formal or informal) or team lead is an advantage.
We expect that you have a broad knowledge of Azure Data Services ex. Microsoft Fabric, Synapse Analytics, Data Pipelines, Cosmos DB, Azure SQL DB, Azure Data Lake and Power BI.
Have a minimum of 5 years experience working within Data analysis, Data Engineering and/or Business Intelligence.
Experienced in creating star-schemas and data modelling especially working in a data lakehouse architecture.
Have experience with SQL, Spark SQL, PySpark, DAX and Power BI and working with Notebooks
Have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to engage and communicate with senior business-leaders.
Have experience of working with several external development vendors and vendor management.
Thrive in a fast-moving and dynamic business environment where operations and business requirements might change fast.
Have experience with different source systems, having experience with Microsoft Navision/Trimit, Salesforce Commerce Cloud, NewStore, InRiver, Bloomreach, JIRA and SharePoint is an advantage.
A plus would be to have experience with Customer Data Platforms and a business focused on Direct-to-consumer.
Maybe you have experience with object-oriented programming like Python or C#.


THE GANNI WAY

You are proactive by nature and understand the value of well-planned processes combined with high data quality provided at the right time in the right place. We believe you are comfortable working with hands-on operational tasks such as answering questions about data and fixing bugs as well as providing day-to-day support to colleagues and customers.

We believe that you have strong analytical skills while you easily visualise and communicate to stakeholders from various departments and different levels to make sure the message goes through. You are enjoying a dynamic environment where you will have the opportunity to be a key-player and an impact maker. We believe you continue to help the organisation, team and your colleagues to grow by bringing in a new perspective.

BE BOLD AND JOIN OUR GANNI COMMUNITY!

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel motivated to join our team and become a part of the GANNI community. If you have more questions regarding the position please contact Jasmine Lidh, Director of Digital & Data at jasmine.lindh@ganni.com

We will be interviewing candidates continuously and kindly ask you to send your application and CV as soon as possible. Please use the “Apply for position” button.

We welcome applications from all people regardless of gender identities, sexual orientations, ethnicities, racial identities, religious beliefs, disability statuses and personal expressions. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV.

Quick Apply

You don’t need to upload a cover letter to apply for this position - your CV is enough! We want to make the process easy for you, so you can quickly apply by simply attaching your CV. If you have a cover letter, you’re welcome to include it, but it’s not required. We look forward to hearing from you!
Show more

  • Have experience of working with several external development vendors and vendor management.
  • Thrive in a fast-moving and dynamic business environment where operations and business requirements might change fast.
  • Have experience with different source systems, having experience with Microsoft Navision/Trimit, Salesforce Commerce Cloud, NewStore, InRiver, Bloomreach, JIRA and SharePoint is an advantage.
  • A plus would be to have experience with Customer Data Platforms and a business focused on Direct-to-consumer.
  • Maybe you have experience with object-oriented programming like Python or C#.

THE GANNI WAY

You are proactive by nature and understand the value of well-planned processes combined with high data quality provided at the right time in the right place. We believe you are comfortable working with hands-on operational tasks such as answering questions about data and fixing bugs as well as providing day-to-day support to colleagues and customers.

We believe that you have strong analytical skills while you easily visualise and communicate to stakeholders from various departments and different levels to make sure the message goes through. You are enjoying a dynamic environment where you will have the opportunity to be a key-player and an impact maker. We believe you continue to help the organisation, team and your colleagues to grow by bringing in a new perspective.

BE BOLD AND JOIN OUR GANNI COMMUNITY!

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel motivated to join our team and become a part of the GANNI community. If you have more questions regarding the position please contact Jasmine Lidh, Director of Digital & Data at jasmine.lindh@ganni.com

We will be interviewing candidates continuously and kindly ask you to send your application and CV as soon as possible. Please use the “Apply for position” button.

We welcome applications from all people regardless of gender identities, sexual orientations, ethnicities, racial identities, religious beliefs, disability statuses and personal expressions. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV.

Quick Apply

You don’t need to upload a cover letter to apply for this position - your CV is enough! We want to make the process easy for you, so you can quickly apply by simply attaching your CV. If you have a cover letter, you’re welcome to include it, but it’s not required. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Analytiker
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Dataanalytiker med god forretningsforståelse

Skab overblik og indsigt i medlemmernes adfærd og præferencer




Realdania ønsker at styrke relationen til og engagementet hos flere medlemmer og fremtidssikre foreningens mangfoldige medlemsskare med interesse for det byggede miljø. For at understøtte foreningens arbejde med dette, søger vi en ny dataanalytiker til at skabe indsigter fra vores medlemsdata til formidling i form af analyser, notater, rapportering og i Power BI.




Jobbet

Du vil være det primære kontaktpunkt for dataanalyser og rapportering, der vedrører medlemsdata og vores foreningsstrategi og du vil bistå strategiske udviklingsprojekter med indsigter og optimering af processer. Stillingens indhold er blandt andet:

Forstå forretningsbehov, skabe nye indsigter og sikre at medlemsdata stilles til rådighed i en indsigtsfuld og organiseret form. Du vil fungere som sparringspartner og bidragsyder til analyser, notater og datadrevne beslutningsoplæg, ligesom du selv vil være projektleder på forskellige dataanalyseprojekter.
Indgå i den fortsatte udvikling af datavarehus og Business Intelligence på tværs i Realdania, herunder en kommende migrering til en ny platform.
Samarbejde med andre afdelinger og analysere og sikre, hvordan vi kan forbedre data og udvikle foreningens brug af AI og digital forretningsudvikling.




Hvem leder vi efter?

Dataanalyse og Business Intelligence motiverer dig. Det omfatter overblik over interne og eksterne data, modellering af data til automatiseret og digitaliseret rapportering samt at gøre denne information tilgængelig i overensstemmelse med behovene i organisationen.




Du har en relevant uddannelsesmæssig baggrund og nogle års praktisk erfaring.




Vi forestiller os at du:

er erfaren i dataanalyse og formidling heraf til ledelse og kolleger.
har stor erfaring med Excel.
har erfaring med eller interesse i at formidle og præsentere data i et Business Intelligence værktøj, for eksempel Power BI.
har erfaring med at bearbejde relationelle data – for eksempel via SQL, R, Python eller lignende.
har nemt ved at sætte dig ind i komplekse problemstillinger og anvende data til at beskrive, analysere og forstå dem.
er digitalt kyndig og kan medvirke i faciliteringen af Realdanias digitaliseringsdagsorden og fortsatte udvikling af vores dataplatform i samarbejde med kolleger på tværs af huset og eksterne konsulenter.
er engageret og kvalitetsbevidst med opmærksomhed på detaljen, har gode samarbejdsevner og trives med at arbejde på tværs i organisationen.
ønsker at blive eksperten i de data og forretningsprocesser, der understøtter foreningens arbejde på medlemsområdet, så du kan være med til at udvikle analyser og processer, og understøtte Realdanias foreningsstrategi.
er interesseret i at blive en del af Realdania, som er en filantropisk forening med et levende medlemsdemokrati og mange interessenter.




Vi tilbyder

Du ansættes som dataanalytiker i Foreningssekretariatet med otte faste medarbejdere og tre studentermedhjælpere. Du refererer til sekretariatschefen for Foreningssekretariatet.




Vi er en arbejdsplads, der er præget af faglighed og kvalitet og af hjælpsomhed og gode kolleger. Vi har et engageret miljø både fagligt og socialt, og vi har gode rammer om vores arbejde, en personaleforening med mange sociale aktiviteter, forsikringer, god frokostordning m.m.




Spørgsmål

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, kan du kontakte Christian Bonde fra KAR+CO på telefon 40 27 59 00.




Ansøgningsfrist

Ansøgningsfristen er den 21. april 2025. Upload din ansøgning til KAR+CO ved at klikke på knappen ”Søg stilling”.




Ansøgninger modtages kun via ansøgningssystemet. Kan du ikke uploade din ansøgning, bedes du derfor kontakte KAR+CO.




Vi læser ansøgninger løbende og forventer at holde samtaler i uge 17 og 18.




Vi håber på tiltrædelse 1. juni 2025 og ellers efter nærmere aftale.




Bemærk, at vores annoncer automatisk og løbende bliver fornyet på jobportalerne, indtil stillingen er endeligt besat. En fornyelse af stillingen, om end det kan se sådan ud, er således ikke et udtryk for genopslag. Du kan kun søge stillingen via systemet og kun én gang. Jf. GDPR bedes du undlade at fremsende ansøgning på ny via mail eller lignende uden forudgående aftale.




Realdania er en filantropisk forening med knap 190.000 medlemmer. Foreningen arbejder med filantropi på basis af afkastet af sin investeringsformue. Vi støtter store og små projekter over hele landet, der samlet set bidrager til at nå vores filantropiske mål og vores mission: at skabe livskvalitet for alle gennem det byggede miljø. Vores arbejde skal samlet set gavne alle i Danmark, og vi ønsker at gøre en forskel for både nuværende og kommende generationer. Realdania har siden år 2000 støttet cirka 5000 filantropiske projekter med 24 mia. kr. Alle, der ejer fast ejendom, kan gratis blive medlem. I 2025 fylder Realdania 25 år, og det markeres med en stor jubilæumsindsats, der blandt andet støtter små fællesskaber over hele landet med fysiske rammer.




Foreningssekretariatet i Realdania understøtter medlemsdemokratiet ved at sikre medlemshåndtering, planlægning og afholdelse af valg til repræsentantskabet og gennemførelse af repræsentantskabets møder. Vi har sammen med vores kollegaer i Medlemsteamet kontakten til medlemmerne og har styr på foreningens vedtægter og en stor mængde medlemsdata, der skal håndteres korrekt. Vi arbejder for at sikre de bedst mulige betingelser for at kunne yde professionel medlemsservice og videreudvikle de administrative processer i forhold til dette. Dit bidrag som dataanalytiker er med til at understøtte denne rejse, som vi håber du vil med på.




Arbejdssted: Jarmers Plads 2, København V

Title: VIE - Data Analyst, Denmark, Engesvang
Description:
How will you CONTRIBUTE and GROW?

Specialty Gases is a team of 7 experienced colleagues with different ages and gender. We work between 7:00-16:00 producing different mixtures every day were no day is as the previous one. The laboratory is a team of 3 experienced women with good routines and procedures. We work very close together and enjoy the work as well as the breaks.

The goal is to achieve an accreditation for ISO 17025 (Laboratory) & ISO 17034 (Specialty Gases) to provide a better variety of products with shorter leadtimes to our customers in the Nordics. This is important for Air Liquide to achieve profitable growth in the Nordics.

You will be the project manager on this way ensuring that we will stay on track, use our resources in the best way and bring the results and stakeholders together to achieve the goal. The main interactions will take place with the specialty gas team and the laboratory as well as the accreditation body but also colleagues and experts in Europe. The project will benefit from the experience of other plants in europe that already have achieved the accrediation.

The mission requires very good English communication skills in both verbal and writing with people at various level internally as well as externally.

___________________

Are you a MATCH?

Educational Qualifications:


Master’s degree in Chemical Engineering or a related field, with a specialization in chemistry, physics, mathematics, or similar disciplines.



Essential Skills and Competencies:


Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly.
Strong sense of responsibility, open-mindedness, and a results-driven mindset.
Highly motivated and committed to achieving project goals.
Proficient in uncertainty calculations and preparation of official reports.
Advanced skills in Google Sheets for data analysis and reporting.



Nice to have:


Strong interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders
Proven experience in project planning and leadership.
Expertise in data evaluation and analysis.
Familiarity with accreditation processes and standards.



Language:


Fluency in English (both written and spoken).
Proficiency in a Scandinavian language (Norwegian, Danish, or Swedish) is advantageous



Please send the CV and cover letter in English.

Position open only for candidates eligible to the VIE program. Therefore, only the applicants meeting the requirements of the French V.I.E program will be taken into consideration. Please visit this website for more information about these requirements

https://mon-vie-via.businessfrance.fr/en/what-is-the-vie-french-international-internship-program

The V.I.E., an international young graduate program, enables young professionals who are less than 28 and European Union nationals to work for a French company in any country of the world. Becoming part of this program means going abroad to carry out a professional assignment for up to 24 months whilst benefiting from social care coverage and an interesting salary, which depends on the host country.

Business France, the French agency for international business development, is in charge of all the administrative procedures of your assignment. For further information, please visit the following link:

https://mon-vie-via.businessfrance.fr/en

Our Differences make our Performance

At Air Liquide, we are committed to build a diverse and inclusive workplace that embraces the diversity of our employees, our customers, patients, community stakeholders and cultures across the world.

We welcome and consider applications from all qualified applicants, regardless of their background. We strongly believe a diverse organization opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to innovate by living our fundamentals, acting for our success and creating an engaging environment in a changing world.
