Title: Senior Data Analyst and Technical Mentor
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

The banking industry is rapidly evolving, and Danske Bank is at the forefront of this transformation. Join a major bank in the region and contribute to our commercial agenda. If you are an experienced Data Analyst with strong technical expertise, ready to leverage your skills and mentor a team of highly skilled professionals, we have a great opportunity for you!

About The Role

As a Senior Data Analyst you will be part of the Commercial Excellence Team within Danske Bank's Business Customer unit as part of the Nordic Analytic and Insights Team. In this role you will be part of delivering commercial data driven initiatives that stretch across all Nordic countries, having close dialogue with stakeholders on all levels of the bank’s Business Customers unit, a unit that serves +200 000 small and mid-sized corporates across market areas.

You can expect to solve complex problems, support decision-makers with data-driven recommendations, and become a trusted advisor for key stakeholders. You will work with senior leadership yet be comfortable in working effectively at all levels of large organisations. You will also need the ability to balance a holistic view with attention to detail. Additionally, as we transition to a new tool stack within Danske Bank, part of your role will involve inspiring and supporting the team in optimising workflows using the new tools to ensure high-quality, reliable, and scalable solutions.

Qualifications And Requirements

You have a curious mindset to challenge status quo and bring enthusiasm to the team with a can-do attitude. As a Data Analyst and Technical Mentor you will:


Possess high expertise in Python, with the ability to elevate the team's Python capabilities.
Infrastructure experience with platforms such as Databricks and GitHub or Azure DevOps., or other Git solutions, with a strong understanding of best practices to inspire and support the team in optimising workflows using these tools to ensure high-quality, reliable, and scalable solutions.
Good understanding of software functionality and be able to take dialogue with supporting tech teams in Danske when issues arise.
Possesses a comprehensive analytical toolkit that enables effective structuring, analysis, and presentation of data to maximise organisational value. Expected to perform data extraction and management using SQL, conduct analytics primarily in Python, and present findings using Microsoft Office suite products.
Approach assignments with curiosity, acting as a data and analytics consultant for stakeholders, thus allowing your analytical skills to shape the final product in unforeseen ways.
Strong technical background to support complex analytics, including regression analysis.
Ability to forge strong relationships with key stakeholders across business, data platform, technology, finance, and data scientist teams.


The ideal candidate possesses experience from specialised data teams, preferably within the financial sector, and has a technical background with a strong ability to teach others and simplifying complex or technical concepts. While not essential, having a keen interest in AI, frontrunner in implementing Danske Bank AI solutions and identifying business opportunities would be advantageous.

What We Offer

We offer a dynamic and supportive work environment where you can thrive both personally and professionally. You'll be part of a team of ambitious and sociable colleagues who are passionate about what they do, making for a fun and engaging workplace. We believe in empowering our employees by providing autonomy in their roles, allowing you to take initiative and make meaningful contributions. Additionally, we are committed to fostering a culture of continuous learning and development, ensuring you have the resources and opportunities to grow your career.

We are seeking a candidate based in Denmark, Sweden or Finland, who will report to Louise Nørsten the Head of Analytics & Insights for Business Customers.

Interested?

Please apply as soon as possible as we conduct interviews on an ongoing basis.
Show more

Title: Student Assistant AI
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a student skilled in AI ready to apply your knowledge of AI and software development in a real-world setting?

Become a part of our AI and Innovation team, where we develop innovative AI solutions that reshape our interaction with technology. Our aim? To Bring People Closer through AI-driven innovation—and we want you to be part of it!

The Team You Will be Part of

Join an innovative and inclusive AI and Innovation team that thrives on collaboration and creativity! Our team consists of a collaborative group of innovative thinkers focused on providing valuable AI solutions. We believe that diverse perspectives fuel innovation, and we encourage every team member to share their ideas and insights. Together, we create a space that honors every voice, allowing everyone to engage in our collective effort to transform the way we interact with technology through AI. This position allows you to learn from knowledgeable experts and work with peers who also value the evolving landscape of AI!

Your contribution is appreciated, and you will:


Develop AI Solutions: Assist in designing, coding, and testing AI applications and software tools.
Experiment & Innovate: Work with machine learning models, data processing pipelines, and automation tools.
Collaborate & Learn: Participate in brainstorming sessions, team discussions, and code reviews.
Optimize & Improve: Advance system performance, scalability, and AI model accuracy.


To fulfill your responsibilities in the role, we imagine that you:


Are currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field, with a specialization in Artificial Intelligence.
Have experience with Python, Java, or similar programming languages and an understanding of AI/ML frameworks.
Are interested in AI and its real-world applications.
Are motivated, adaptable, and willing to explore—you enjoy solving problems and experimenting with new technologies in collaboration with others.


We encourage you to apply

Even if you don’t match all the above-mentioned skills, we warmly receive your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value the right mindset. We consider that personal capabilities are vital for contributing to valuable results.

We prioritize creating an inclusive recruitment experience where every candidate is valued equally in the hiring process.

Join us in bringing people closer

GN brings people closer through our leading intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. Inspired by people and driven by innovation, we deliver technology that enhance the senses of hearing and sight. We support people with hearing loss to overcome real-life challenges, improve communication and collaboration for businesses, and provide great experiences for audio and gaming enthusiasts.

Joining GN as a Student Assistant

In GN, our Student Assistants typically work 15-20 hours a week. We value flexibility and will collaborate with you to ensure your working hours complement your studies.

You also have the possibility to join the GN Students Network. This expansive network connects students from various departments and frequently hosts events like Friday happy hours, student lunches, and other engaging social activities.

How to apply?

To apply, use the ‘APPLY’ link no later than 23rd of April, 2025. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so don’t wait to send yours.

Quick apply

You are welcome to use our Quick Apply function, where you only submit your up to date CV, including a few sentences outlining you motivation for applying – quick and easy.

We encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

Should you have any special requirements for the Interview please let the hiring manager know upon accepting invitation to interview.

If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Thomas Grønfeldt Senger on trgoenfeldtsenger@gn.com.

We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application!

Title: Product Analyst with Power BI skills
Place: Brøndby Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Product Analyst with Power BI skills 

Do you want a rare opportunity to make an extraordinaire impact as part of a great team? 

If you have a passion for telemetry, usage, and behavioral data – and you know how to leverage Power BI in this context – this role offers a unique career opportunity. As part of Milestone’s transformation, your expertise will be a key asset for future growth. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to shape how the company works with telemetry data, giving you significant influence and learning opportunities. And you’ll do it as part of a well-functioning, collaborative team where teamwork, knowledge sharing, and mutual support are part of everyday life. 

Turn data into clear and insightful PowerBI dashboards 

Your primary mission is to help business colleagues achieve better results by providing them with valuable data-driven insights. You’ll engage in dialogue with stakeholders across various business areas to understand their goals and needs. Using this knowledge, you’ll collaborate with the Power BI backend team to to request, refine, and test data in our cross-organizational data model. From there, you’ll transform data into compelling, easy-to-understand Power BI dashboards. At the same time, you’ll continuously contribute ideas for optimizing our overall setup. Your primary tasks will be to:  



Engaging with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectives 
Building Power BI dashboards in collaboration with the backend team 


Acting as the data/Power BI lead in various business projects 


Developing an understanding of how usage data fits into the overall value chain 


Assisting project teams in setting up data-driven metrics and coaching them on data interpretation (e.g., through workshops) 


Contributing to the compilation of monthly and quarterly royalty reports 



Experience in Power BI for telemetry, usage, and behavioral data 

We are looking for you that thrive on handling tasks independently while at the same time knowing when to engage with your colleagues to create 1 + 1 = 3. We are also looking for your entrepreneurial spirit as you shall play a key role in building the future way of working for your workstream. As part of this, you must be curious on new trends, technologies and tools.  Additionally, it is important that you like dialogue and collaboration with many different people covering multiple professions and nationalities. Finally, you can tick of the below:  



Degree in data science or equivalent experience  


Experience with telemetry/usage/behaviour data, preferably in a software company  


Power BI frontend experience, especially in visualization and storytelling of data with the data user in mind 


Knowledgeable of DAX and star schema models / the Power BI platform  


Experience with Azure DevOps and user story processes 



Your new team 

Your new workplace will be Milestone’s headquarters in Brøndby, Copenhagen, where you’ll join a team of eight skilled colleagues in the Product Operations team where you will be part of the Product Analytics and Performance workstream. Our team brings together experts in product excellence, performance, telemetry, qualitative research, and outcome-driven product management. We work cross-functionally to enable product teams to make informed, customer-centered decisions and deliver real impact.  

Just as important. You can look forward to being part of a highly functional, professional, and socially engaging environment. Our team is diverse – we are eight people representing seven different nationalities. At Milestone, you’ll experience a positive and welcoming culture with frequent social activities, an on-site gym, private health insurance, and additional perks like free drinks, fruit, lunch, Friday bars, and more. Flexibility is also a natural part of life at Milestone. 

Contact and application 

Please apply at our website using the ”Apply” button.  

You will experience an inclusive and unbiased recruitment process where all employment decisions are based on qualifications rather than race, color, ethnicity, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, and religion. We advise you not to attach a cover letter to your application but instead, we encourage you to write a few lines about why you are applying for the position in your resume/CV. Additionally we recommend you not to add a photo in your resume/CV. 

If you have any questions, you are very welcome to contact Christina Hampson, Head of Product Operations at +45 2552 9352. 

We are looking forward to receiving your application.  

At Milestone, your work goes beyond what the human eye can see. With our unique video technology software, you help people make wiser and more responsible decisions – in and beyond security. Whether you advance our software, inspire to new integrations, or elevate our customers, you are part of a growth company recognized by the industry. We have a unique people-first approach to everything we do, and it’s not just empty words. Being part of a fun, friendly, and flexible environment you’ll find, that working here almost feels like a home away from home. If you are curious to know more about who we are, we suggest you visit http://milestonesys.com/career

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Odense Kommune, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Would you like to drive data innovation in the automotive industry, leveraging cutting-edge technologies and big data solutions? Then you might be the Data Scientist we are looking for!




About Us

We are a global company specializing in online car auctions and IT solutions for the automotive industry. With more than 15 years of data across Europe, we are continuously growing and seeking a Data Scientist to help us commercialize our data and create value for our customers.




The Autorola Group is a global leader in online remarketing and automotive IT solutions, as well as business intelligence solutions for used vehicles and professional fleet management.

Headquartered in Denmark, the Autorola Group currently employs around 850 people and has branches in 19 countries across Europe, North America, Latin America, and the Asia-Pacific region.

Through an extensive network of companies, manufacturers, banks, leasing companies, and fleet managers, Autorola offers dealers worldwide the opportunity to acquire and market vehicles through auctions. Our product portfolio is complemented by our workflow management system, which enables the digital integration of individual customer processes throughout the entire vehicle lifecycle, as well as our artificial intelligence, which provides real-time indicators for developments in the used car market.







Your Role

Reporting to the Head of Data Science in our Business Unit, Indicata, you will play a key role in building and maintaining our big data platform, supporting various markets with data insights, Power BI dashboards, and developing data science solutions that enhance our appraisal engine and forecasting capabilities.




Your key responsibilities include:

Developing and maintaining our big data platform, including building out the data lake.
Engaging in platform discussions and collaborating on data architecture.
Utilizing SQL, Python, R, and Power BI for data analysis and dashboard creation.
Working closely with the Data Engineer to prepare datasets for analysis.
Designing and executing complex data analyses across multiple markets.
Commercializing data insights to add value to our customers.
Ensuring data quality and optimizing existing algorithms.
Supporting and potentially developing machine learning solutions over time.
Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.







Your Profile

We imagine you have at least 2 years of relevant experience, but we are also open to recent graduates with the right motivation and approach. Additionally, we expect you to have:

Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, and Power BI.
Experience with Spark and Databricks is a plus.
Strong commercial acumen and the ability to translate data insights into business value.
Experience in creating Power BI dashboards for complex data analysis and forecasting.
A methodological approach to problem-solving and improving data-driven solutions.
Familiarity with the “Team Data Science Process” or similar to be able to work structured and independently on own projects.
The ability to work both independently and collaboratively with stakeholders.
A willingness to learn about the automotive industry and its data ecosystem.







What We Offer

Autorola A/S is a global company with over 850 employees and 19 subsidiaries across Europe, Latin America, and Asia-Pacific.

You will get the opportunity to work for a fast-growing company that collaborates with some of the strongest brands in the automotive industry. Our environment is characterized by an informal and easygoing communication culture. Our headquarters is located right by the railway station at Skibhusvej 52 A, 5000 Odense C.




You will be included in the pension scheme and health insurance, as well as have the chance to participate in company social events. We offer a good lunch arrangement, a fitness room, and a Friday bar to end the week on a high note.




Want to Join the Team and Have an Impact on the Future?

We are looking to fill the position as soon as possible, so if you see yourself thriving in the above-mentioned tasks, we look forward to receiving your application.




Even if you do not meet all the ideal requirements, we encourage you to apply, as we strongly believe in inclusion and diversity.




We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to remove the advertisement once we find the right candidate.




If you have any questions about the position, feel free to reach out to Christian Gless, Tech Talent Acquisition Partner, by phone at +45 31624481.

Title: Data/BI Specialist (m/w/d)
Description:
Werde ein Teil der HHLA und bewege mit uns die Zukunft!

Du liebst es, Daten in wertvolle Erkenntnisse zu verwandeln und möchtest die Zukunft unseres Unternehmens mitgestalten? Als Data/BI Specialist bist Du unser*e Experte*in für Datenanalyse und -management, unterstützt die Unternehmensbereiche und Key User bei datengetriebenen Entscheidungen und entwickelst innovative Lösungen. Werde Teil des BI-Teams der HHLA und bringe Deine Leidenschaft für Daten in spannende Projekte ein!

Die Hamburger Hafen und Logistik AG (HHLA) ist ein führender europäischer Hafen- und Transportlogistikkonzern. Wir entwickeln mit unseren Kunden logistische und digitale Knotenpunkte entlang der Transportströme der Zukunft. Dabei setzen wir auf innovative Technologien und nachhaltige Lösungen. Der Konzern beschäftigt derzeit rund 6.700 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter.

Das erwartet Dich


Du entwickelst die analytische Datenarchitektur weiter, um die datengesteuerte Entscheidungsunterstützung im HHLA-Konzern zu fördern.
Du sorgst für eine konsistente und qualitätsgesicherte Datenbasis, indem Du strukturierte, semi- und unstrukturierte Daten integrierst, verarbeitest und transformierst.
Du analysierst die Daten und sagst zukünftige Entwicklungen und Ereignisse voraus, indem Du Methoden des maschinellen Lernens und andere Techniken der künstlichen Intelligenz einsetzt.
Du bereitest die Daten auf und präsentierst sie in Form von Berichten, Dashboards und anderen geeigneten Präsentationsformaten.
Du verantwortest die Betreuung der bestehenden BI-Landschaft.


Das bringst Du mit


Du hast fundierte Kenntnisse in ETL-Prozessen und kannst Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen in das Data Warehouse (SAP BW und Oracle) und den Data Lake integrieren.
Du bringst praktische Erfahrung mit Big Data-Technologien wie Hadoop, Spark und Kafka zur Verarbeitung und Analyse großer Datenmengen mit.
Du bist in der Lage, Datenmodelle zu entwerfen und zu implementieren, die den Anforderungen des Unternehmens und der Fachbereiche entsprechen.
Du besitzt starke analytische Fähigkeiten zur Interpretation von Daten und Gewinnung wertvoller Erkenntnisse.
Du hast Kenntnisse in relationalen, NoSQL- und Cloud-Datenbanken.
Du hast Erfahrung in Programmiersprachen wie (PL/)SQL, Python, R oder Java zur Automatisierung und Analyse von Datenverarbeitungsaufgaben.
Du kannst Daten in verständlichen und ansprechenden Formaten mit Hilfe von Crystal Reports, Analysis for Office und QlikSense präsentieren.
Du sprichst fließend Deutsch und hast gute Englischkenntnisse.


Du hast Interesse, aber erfüllst nicht alle Anforderungen? Lass uns gern sprechen!

Das bieten wir Ihnen


Flexibles Arbeiten und eine gute Work-Life-Balance: 37 Wochenstunden in Vollzeit, mobiles Arbeiten und Gleitzeit
Eine transparente und attraktive Vergütung gemäß Tarifvertrag inklusive Weihnachtsgeld und variabler Vergütung
Gemeinsam in die Zukunft: Unbefristete Zusammenarbeit und eine attraktive Altersvorsorge durch unseren HHLA Kapitalplan
Weitere attraktive Benefits wie z.B. ein Zuschuss zum Deutschland Ticket, Corporate Benefits und Fahrrad Leasing über JobRad
Einen Arbeitsplatz mitten in der Hamburger Speicherstadt zwischen Hafencity und Innenstadt
Ein vielfältiges Angebot an internen und externen Weiterbildungen, Trainings und Workshops
In der Speicherstadt, auf den Terminals und über die Kaikante hinaus: Eine Unternehmenskultur, in der Kollegialität und Wertschätzung gelebt wird


Als international tätiges Logistikunternehmen mit Wurzeln in Hamburg steht die HHLA für Weltoffenheit und Toleranz. Wir sind überzeugt von den Vorteilen unterschiedlicher Perspektiven, Erfahrungen und Kompetenzen. Es ist unser Ziel, ein Arbeitsumfeld zu schaffen, in dem Menschlichkeit, gegenseitiger Respekt und Wertschätzung die Grundlage für das Handeln aller Mitarbeitenden sind.

Wenn Du gemeinsam mit uns die Zukunft der HHLA gestalten möchtest, freuen wir uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung – bevorzugt online über unser Bewerbungsformular.

Dein Kontakt

Hamburger Hafen und Logistik AG

Bereich Personalmanagement

Nina Harbecke
Show more

  • Weitere attraktive Benefits wie z.B. ein Zuschuss zum Deutschland Ticket, Corporate Benefits und Fahrrad Leasing über JobRad
  • Einen Arbeitsplatz mitten in der Hamburger Speicherstadt zwischen Hafencity und Innenstadt
  • Ein vielfältiges Angebot an internen und externen Weiterbildungen, Trainings und Workshops
  • In der Speicherstadt, auf den Terminals und über die Kaikante hinaus: Eine Unternehmenskultur, in der Kollegialität und Wertschätzung gelebt wird

Als international tätiges Logistikunternehmen mit Wurzeln in Hamburg steht die HHLA für Weltoffenheit und Toleranz. Wir sind überzeugt von den Vorteilen unterschiedlicher Perspektiven, Erfahrungen und Kompetenzen. Es ist unser Ziel, ein Arbeitsumfeld zu schaffen, in dem Menschlichkeit, gegenseitiger Respekt und Wertschätzung die Grundlage für das Handeln aller Mitarbeitenden sind.

Wenn Du gemeinsam mit uns die Zukunft der HHLA gestalten möchtest, freuen wir uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung – bevorzugt online über unser Bewerbungsformular.

Dein Kontakt

Hamburger Hafen und Logistik AG

Bereich Personalmanagement

Nina Harbecke

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Commercial Strategy & Management (Private & Business Banking)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a data-driven strategist ready to fuel growth in a dynamic fintech environment? Lunar is revolutionizing Nordic banking, and we need a Senior Business Data Analyst to optimize monetization, sales, and partnerships across our private and business platforms.

At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus and Stockholm 🚀




So who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both, breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.




As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Senior Business Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision-making across monetization, sales, and partnerships so that we can optimize growth and commercial impact.




As our new Senior Business Data Analyst, you will be part of our Commercial team, reporting to Christian Sillesen, Head of Commercial. The team currently comprises a talented and ambitious group across Copenhagen and Stockholm, working on enhancing Lunar’s commercial performance through data-driven insights within the broader Commercial function, led by Mats Persson, Chief Commercial Officer.




What will you do?

Monetization Optimization: Analyze user behavior and optimize pricing, promotions, and revenue generation.
Sales Lead Generation & Performance: Leverage data to improve lead generation and develop predictive sales models.
Partnership Performance Analysis: Evaluate ROI and track performance of strategic partnerships.
Price & Deposit Analysis: Conduct pricing and deposit trend analysis and provide competitive insights.
Data-Driven Insights & Reporting: Extract, clean, and analyze data to generate actionable business insights.




Curious about the Lunar culture? 💚

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.




We're excited to welcome everyone to apply for this impactful role! We can’t wait to follow up with talents who we believe are the best fit based on the following criteria:

Who are you?

3-7 years experience as a Data Analyst (commercial/fintech/banking preferred).
Strong expertise in SQL (R, Python) and data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI).
Experience with statistical analysis and data modeling.
Ability to analyze large datasets and extract key trends.
Strong understanding of commercial KPIs.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Experience with HubSpot or similar CRM systems is a plus.
Familiarity with pricing analysis and working with data engineers is a plus.




Are you ready to join the journey? Apply now and let’s find out more!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰




Depending on the regulations in the country you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.

Title: Student Analyst - Germany
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to gain excellent analytical skills – grow your talent in an environment where your competencies pave the way for your professional aspirations?

As a Student Analyst at Abacus Medicine, you will be given responsibility from an early stage while working in a global, fast-growing pharmaceutical company where your competencies and aspirations are the only factors setting the limit for what you can accomplish.


Drive meaningful change

The German Portfolio Management team is responsible for introducing the right products to the market, ensuring that products are purchased from the best trades, that the purchased stock is efficiently allocated and sold with the highest possible profit. As a Student Analyst, you will be working alongside fellow students and full-time employees alike, across the Portfolio Management team.

You will join a group of students with multiple areas of responsibility – meaning that you will have different tasks during your workday that are essential to improving and maintaining our position in the German market:

Firstly, ensuring that we launch products that match market demands. Performing various analyses on the German market, our competitors, product performance and various ad-hoc factors to ensure that we derive the actionable insights needed to support decision-making.
Finally, the group is contributing to the management of the German insurance contracts, which is one of the main demand drivers in the German market.

Our goal is to continuously grow Abacus Medicine in the parallel trade industry, which is why it is important to have a structured and proactive mindset coupled with a strong willingness to learn.

Your Profile

We expect you to be self-driven, trust-building and capable of creating good relationships with multiple stakeholders in an international environment. You recognize yourself in the following characteristics:


Have a thorough and analytical mindset
Take on challenges in a complex industry with many stakeholders
Proactive and capable of managing complex tasks
A strong team player with the ability to work with stakeholders across the organization

Furthermore, we expect the following:

You are studying a relevant bachelor’s degree with at least 2 year left of your studies
Experience with Excel
Fluency in both written and spoken English (corporate language). Fluency in German will be an advantage but not a requirement
Experience from an equivalent position as Student Analyst will be an advantage but not a requirement


Be part of an international community of people who care


You will be an important part of our team, where learning is encouraged, and you will be given responsibility from day one. Working at Abacus Medicine means working shoulder by shoulder every day across the entire organization to become the leading parallel trade company in Europe.

The working culture is characterized by ambition mixed with fun. Everyone runs in the same direction and is running at full speed. And since the Abacus Group and the German team are growing Abacus offers exciting challenges and future career development opportunities in a dynamic environment where ambitious, talented people can challenge themselves and grow – as growth is in Abacus’s DNA.

What we offer:

A part-time position: 15-20 hours per week
Workplace in a central location at our HQ in Kalvebod Brygge, Copenhagen
Student Board which hosts social events, dinners, case competitions and more
Delicious lunch arrangement at our Staff Restaurant
A fun and entrepreneurial workplace where we are driven by community spirit and a desire to be successful
Exciting challenges and future career development opportunities in a young and dynamic environment

“If I had only 2 words to describe the nature of working at Abacus it would be: responsibility & flexibility. From the very start you are empowered to assume responsibility for critical parts of the business and contribute to discussions with senior stakeholders. At the same time, you have the flexibility and freedom to shape the way things are being done in the organization on a daily basis. Our team consists of people with backgrounds reaching from economics and business to pharmaceutical engineering. As in the whole Group, the hierarchies are flat, and I work in an empowering and fun work environment where you can feel that people like to come to work.” 

- Employee, Business Development Germany

Interested?

If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV. We are reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and may close the job posting once we receive sufficient interest, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

If you have any further questions about the role, please do not hesitate to contact the hiring manager, Kristoffer Brink - Portfolio Manager at kristoffer.brink@abacusmedicine.com.



Would you like to know more about us?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.



Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, you’ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You’ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,500 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

Title: Research Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Hejsa! 👋

Siden du har fundet vej hertil, vil du sikkert gerne vide mere om vores stilling som Research Analyst og du har trods din unge alder helt sikkert allerede udvist en arbejdsmoral, som har sat dig foran dine jævnaldrende👀 Har du vist at du kan blive kampdygtig til noget, om det er et tidligere job, musikinstrument eller anden interesse? Så er du måske den næste stjerne hos en af Nordens hurtigst voksende tech startups 💥 Men først burde vi måske fortælle dig mere om hvad vi laver, og endnu vigtigere, hvorfor.

Resights startede med en vision om at konsolidere ejendomsdata på en enkelt platform - for at spare tid og forbedre beslutningstagningen. Slut med rodede regneark eller mavefornemmelser 😵‍💫 Siden da har vi gennem et usædvanligt tæt forhold til kunderne, udviklet platformen enormt. I dag dækker platformen mange forskellige use cases og er meget mere end en database, fra at finde nye investeringsejendomme til at analysere byer eller automatisere breve til ejendomsejere. Den røde tråd er ejendomsdata og hvordan vi kan gøre det muligt for vores kunder at drive mere forretning.

Så kort sagt, det er Resights. Men i virkeligheden er det, der virkelig definerer os, de 45 mennesker bag vores software. En samling af nørdede holdspillere, som på fire år har bygget en af de hurtigst voksende startups i Danmark, med over 1400 kunder. Endda med en positiv bundlinje og uden nogen VC-check. Vigtigst, har vi haft det hamrende sjovt undervejs, fordi det er en del af vores DNA (læs vores kulturmemo her) 🧬

Vi forestiller os at du...


Er i gang med dit sabbatår
Har udvist et exceptionelt højt ambitionsniveau i skolen, i et arbejde eller anden personlig passion.
Er dygtig til at anskue samt løse problemer
Kan arbejde fokuseret og målrettet mod dine mål


Hvis du ikke føler at du møder alle vores krav for rollen, så tilskynder vi dig at ansøge alligevel. Vi ved at kompetence, kløfter og imposter syndrom kan få kandidater til at læse sig ud af en rolle - vi opfordrer dig til at læse dig ind i den.

Om rollen

Du bliver en del af et helt nyt team sammen med 3 andre Researchere, hvor du får ansvaret for at indsamle information om byggeprojekter. Du vil dykke ned i relevante kilder, opspore de vigtigste detaljer om projekter, og tage kontakt til aktører på markedet for at sikre, at vi har de nyeste og mest præcise oplysninger.

Derfor skal du opbygge en dybdegående forståelse for branchen, være hurtig til at afkode information. Tiden fra et byggeprojekt bliver offentliggjort til, at vi kan fortælle vores kunder om det, er altafgørende – derfor kommer du til at spille en central rolle i at sikre, at vores data altid er opdateret og relevante!

At fylde vores projektdatabase med knivskarpe projekter er den absolut vigtigste enkeltstående opgave, vi i Resights står overfor i dag. Derfor søger vi unge, skarpe hjerner, der hurtigt kan forstå og løse opgaverne. Vi har brug for personer, der arbejder projektorienteret og kan optimere vores systemer, så vi får de skarpest mulige arbejdsgange.

Hvorfor vælge Resights?

Vi tror på, at fordele er mere end gratis øl og konkurrencedygtig løn. Selvom vi også kan sætte flueben i de bokse 😉, ved vi at de vigtigste fordele er dem, der taler til dig på et dybere og mere personligt plan. Med andre ord, en hverdag fyldt med interessante udfordringer og muligheden for at gøre en forskel.


Et fantastisk kontor med intense kampe i Mario Kart, loungeområder hvor du kan slå dig ned, barista kaffe og meget mere på borgergade i hjertet af København 🕹
Masser af sociale arrangementer. Fra keramik til havespil, counter strike og grill
Gratis frokost og et køkken propfyldt med snacks 🍕


Rollen udfyldes hurtigst muligt.

For eventuelle spørgsmål er du mere end velkommen til at kontakte Rasmus Rex (Head of Operations og tidligere Analyst) på +45 4226 9820.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
As a Data Engineer in the Data Engineering Chapter, you will collaborate closely with diverse product teams across the business. Your role involves leveraging a range of cloud technologies and tools tailored to the specific data products you are working on.

Digital Solutions & Development > Digital Solutions > Chapter - Data Engineering #1

The Data Domains and Products, a vital part of Digital Solutions, is dedicated to delivering accurate, available, and comprehensive data products to enable actionable insights. This newly established area is an integral component of Vestas' innovative Digital Powerhouse. Our mission is to empower customers, partners, and colleagues to seamlessly discover, access, and connect essential information for informed decisions and impactful actions.

Responsibilities

Your key responsibilities will encompass:


Designing, constructing, and maintaining scalable, reliable, and efficient data products
Managing, enhancing and monitoring data products using DevOps methods
Supporting the enhancement of the common information model across the Vestas data landscape
Supporting the translation of logical models into reusable and reliable physical model
Engaging in close collaboration with the data platform team


Qualifications

We envision that you possess experience in designing, building, and maintaining data products within diverse cloud environments. Additionally, you should identify with one or more of the following qualifications:


Proficiency in programming languages like SQL or Python or C#
Experience in the development, implementation and utilization of CI/CD
Expertise in working with various Data Warehouse solutions and constructing data products using technologies such as dbt, Snowflake & databricks
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, capable of troubleshooting and resolving complex data issues
Familiarity with agile development methodologies and DevOps practices
Understanding of the data mesh concept


Competencies

On a personal level, we anticipate that you:


Possess a collaborative and open-minded nature, eager to contribute to a globally diverse cross-functional team within the organization
Display curiosity and passion for developing innovative data products that generate value
Thrive in dynamic environments and exhibit flexibility in adapting to evolving conditions
Exhibit strong communication skills, coupled with a proactive, problem-solving approach to accomplishing tasks
Embrace a commitment to continuous learning and a desire to contribute to the collective success of the team


What We Offer

You will join a dedicated and passionate team committed to support the business through the development and scaling of data products. You will also have the possibility to be part of forming the chapter team charter and have your say in how to best build data products on a technical level. You will experience an environment that fosters continuous learning, enabling you to actualize your ambitions and get the chance to work in an agile office environment. While we hold our team members to high individual standards of collaboration, accountability, and meeting deadlines, we provide unwavering support to one another, collectively celebrating successes and addressing challenges.

Additional Information

Work location: DK, Aarhus.

Please apply no later than 19/04/2025.

BEWARE – RECRUITMENT FRAUD

It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, https://www.vestas.com/en/careers/our-recruitment-process

DEIB Statement

At Vestas, we recognise the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in driving innovation and success. We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, "Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.

About Vestas

Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 185 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.

With 30,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future.

Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.

To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.
Show more
HTML:
As a Data Engineer in the Data Engineering Chapter, you will collaborate closely with diverse product teams across the business. Your role involves leveraging a range of cloud technologies and tools tailored to the specific data products you are working on.

Digital Solutions & Development > Digital Solutions > Chapter - Data Engineering #1

The Data Domains and Products, a vital part of Digital Solutions, is dedicated to delivering accurate, available, and comprehensive data products to enable actionable insights. This newly established area is an integral component of Vestas' innovative Digital Powerhouse. Our mission is to empower customers, partners, and colleagues to seamlessly discover, access, and connect essential information for informed decisions and impactful actions.

Responsibilities

Your key responsibilities will encompass:

  • Designing, constructing, and maintaining scalable, reliable, and efficient data products
  • Managing, enhancing and monitoring data products using DevOps methods
  • Supporting the enhancement of the common information model across the Vestas data landscape
  • Supporting the translation of logical models into reusable and reliable physical model
  • Engaging in close collaboration with the data platform team

Qualifications

We envision that you possess experience in designing, building, and maintaining data products within diverse cloud environments. Additionally, you should identify with one or more of the following qualifications:

  • Proficiency in programming languages like SQL or Python or C#
  • Experience in the development, implementation and utilization of CI/CD
  • Expertise in working with various Data Warehouse solutions and constructing data products using technologies such as dbt, Snowflake & databricks
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, capable of troubleshooting and resolving complex data issues
  • Familiarity with agile development methodologies and DevOps practices
  • Understanding of the data mesh concept

Competencies

On a personal level, we anticipate that you:

  • Possess a collaborative and open-minded nature, eager to contribute to a globally diverse cross-functional team within the organization
  • Display curiosity and passion for developing innovative data products that generate value
  • Thrive in dynamic environments and exhibit flexibility in adapting to evolving conditions
  • Exhibit strong communication skills, coupled with a proactive, problem-solving approach to accomplishing tasks
  • Embrace a commitment to continuous learning and a desire to contribute to the collective success of the team

What We Offer

You will join a dedicated and passionate team committed to support the business through the development and scaling of data products. You will also have the possibility to be part of forming the chapter team charter and have your say in how to best build data products on a technical level. You will experience an environment that fosters continuous learning, enabling you to actualize your ambitions and get the chance to work in an agile office environment. While we hold our team members to high individual standards of collaboration, accountability, and meeting deadlines, we provide unwavering support to one another, collectively celebrating successes and addressing challenges.

Additional Information

Work location: DK, Aarhus.

Please apply no later than 19/04/2025.

BEWARE – RECRUITMENT FRAUD

It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, https://www.vestas.com/en/careers/our-recruitment-process

DEIB Statement

At Vestas, we recognise the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in driving innovation and success. We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, "Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.

About Vestas

Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 185 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.

With 30,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future.

Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.

To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.

Title: Business Intelligence Intern
Place: Viby, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Gain invaluable practical experience with data analysis and Business Intelligence – Vitec Visiolink is looking for a Business Intelligence intern for the period August-December 2025.




As an intern in the Business Consulting department at Visiolink, you will be an active player in the exploration of data and trends based on large amounts of data in Google Analytics.

BI prepares reports and other products for the benefit of our customers, ensures data quality and uses data to inspire customers for strategic initiatives that increase reader engagement in their e-newspapers. As an intern, you will become part of the team on an equal footing with other employees.




About the internship

During the internship, you will gain insight into, and practical experience with all the tasks that cross our desks every day. The course will also offer events outside the house such as customer meetings, presentations and external events. You will largely help shape your internship, where the tasks can consist of:

• Analysis of large amounts of data (in Google Analytics 4, Python/R, Google BigQuery)

• Data collection, structuring and visualization

• User behaviour analysis

• Creating reports and presentations

• Automation through Python/R and Google BigQuery

• Data visualizations through Looker studio




About you

You are probably studying Business Intelligence, Business Economics, Information Technology or something in that vein.

We ensure that you have good conditions for your learning, and throughout your stay we focus on strengthening your skills. Together we will find the projects you are the most interested in and develop your internship form there.

• You have experience in data science and analysis

• You have experience with Python, R , or SQL

• You love exploring data, and you have your focus and interests within analysis and dissemination of data

• You are curious, result-oriented and passionate about translating theoretical understanding into a practical and application-oriented reality.




About Vitec Visiolink

Vitec Visiolink is a market-leading supplier of digital publishing solutions for the European media industry. We produce solutions for digital distribution in the form of e-newspapers and magazines, podcasts, newspaper archives, live news, etc. with 250 media houses in Europe, and more than 2,000 titles are distributed every day.




In Vitec Visiolink you will find 50 competent and committed colleagues who are all passionate about making a difference.




We have a flat organizational structure, where there is high ceiling and the opportunity to make your own mark - regardless of whether you are an intern, specialist or manager. Our active staff association ensures that we also have some great experiences together outside of working hours.




Practical information

The internship is 37 hours per week and is unpaid. However, a lunch buffet is included, as well as other employee benefits and events. We are processing applications on an ongoing basis, so do not hesitate to send in your application.




FYI: Vitec Visiolink is currently located at Bjørnholms Alle 20, 8260 Viby J, but we are moving to new premises in Aarhus C at the end of September.




Are you interested?

Any questions regarding the position can be directed to business intelligence specialist Cecilie Vestergaard at cecilie.vestergaard@vitecsoftware.com or Product Manager, Per Gylling at per.gylling@vitecsoftware.com.




Om Vitec Software Group

Vitec er førende inden for Vertical Software. Virksomheden er grundlagt og har hovedsæde i Umeå i Sverige, og vores produkter er udviklet til specifikke behov inden for forskellige brancher i samfundet. Medarbejdernes ekspertise, kombineret med vores fælles virksomheds- og forretningsmodel, muliggør fortsat forbedring og innovation. Vi vokser gennem vores forretningsenheders succes og gennem opkøb. Alt, hvad vi gør, gør vi med et langsigtet perspektiv. For man kan stole på os – i dag og i morgen. Vitec har 1.660 medarbejdere, er noteret på Nasdaq Stockholm og havde i 2024 en nettoomsætning på 3.334 millioner SEK. Læs mere på vitecsoftware.com.

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Er du klar til at dykke ned i de nyeste teknologier i Azure og Microsoft Fabric? Hos Kvik A/S har vi en mission: Vi vil bygge et vindende hold og skabe exceptionelle forretningsindsigter gennem data og applikationer. Vores mål er at vækste virksomheden og realisere vores ambitiøse digitale rejse.

Hvad tilbyder vi?


Hybrid arbejdsplads (minimum 2 dage på kontoret)
Hands-on erfaring med Microsoft Fabric
Spændende projekter samt et sjovt og udfordrende arbejdsmiljø
Muligheder for personlig og faglig udvikling
Fokus på jobtilfredshed i en åben og ærlig atmosfære
Ansvar og indflydelse i et selvstændigt team


Arbejdsområder

Som BI Consultant hos Kvik A/S vil du have følgende arbejdsområder:


Analyse og afdækning af forretnings behov
Løfte og udvikle eksisterende cloud platform til Fabric setup
Design, udvikling og implementering af BI-løsninger
Sikring af datakvalitet
Rådgive og understøtte stakeholders i brugen af BI-værktøjer
Identificere og implementere muligheder for automatisering og optimering
Tværfagligt samarbejde med andre teams om dataintegration og -analyse projekter
Vedligeholdelse og fejlfinding i eksisterende BI-systemer
Bidrage til at udforme og forbedre BI-strategier og -processer


Den ideelle kandidat

Vi ser den ideele kandidat besidde følgende:


Erfaring med SQL, Azure Data Factory, Microsoft Fabric, Python og datamodellering
Generel forståelse for agile arbejdsprincipper (DevOps) og git
Solid forretningsforståelse til at understøtte dialog med stakeholders


Om vores team

Vi er et ungt og dygtigt team, der trives med samarbejde, innovation og et omskifteligt landskab. Vi omfavner den agile metode og tror på at udfordre grænser, lære af fejl og fejre succeser sammen.

Din profil

Er du proaktiv og ansvarsfuld? Vi søger en kollega, der ikke er bange for at udfordre normen. Som BI Consultant kombinerer du teknisk viden med forretningsbehov.


Ansvar og initiativ: Du tager ansvar for dine opgaver
Nysgerrighed: Du stiller de svære spørgsmål og udforsker nye løsninger
Formidling af tekniske løsninger: Du kan oversætte komplekse tekniske begreber til forståeligt sprog for stakeholders
Samarbejde: Du trives med tværfagligt samarbejde
Minimum 2 års erfaring


For yderligere detaljer om denne fantastiske mulighed, kontakt vores Senior BI Architect, Victor D. K., på telefonnummer 22600424. Denne fuldtidsstilling er baseret hos Kvik A/S, Mosevej 3, 8240 Risskov. Der kan forekomme kørsel til hovedkontoret i Vildbjerg.
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence, Internship, Lystrup
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to kickstart your career in an international high-tech company that operates within specialized areas like aerospace, defence, security, and space? Our Business Intelligence Team within the Finance Systems & Business Intelligence department offers a unique opportunity for a passionate student who wants to be part of our internal talent pipeline.

We are facing an exciting future with considerable growth and demanding changes, as we deliver advanced technologies and mission critical solutions for the defense and aerospace industry. Our systems provide security for people on land, at sea and in the air. Therefore, we are looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Intern to become part of this journey and contribute to our overall purpose – securing people through advanced technology.

Your role in our team

We are currently facing an exciting future with considerable growth and demanding changes. We are looking for a highly motivated BI Intern to become part of this journey and to join our Finance Systems & Business Intelligence department in Lystrup, which has a variety of responsibilities.

We offer an exciting position where you can start building your dream career. We will focus on your professional and personal development, and you will have the opportunity to make your mark in a dynamic company. You will experience a variety of tasks and the opportunity to apply your theoretical skills in practice. We pride ourselves on maintaining an open working environment where we support each other to stay focused, committed, and motivated to deliver value to our colleagues throughout Terma.

As a BI Intern at Terma, you will be part of a company with many engaged and knowledgeable employees, where technology, innovation, strategy, and continuous improvements drive everything we do. You will work closely with skilled colleagues and on exciting projects.

How You Will Make a Meaningful Contribution

Your key responsibilities include:


Assist in the development and maintenance of BI reports and dashboards
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data requirements
Ensure data accuracy and integrity in our BI solutions
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our BI processes
Participate in data analysis and visualization projects
Support the team in ad-hoc data requests and troubleshooting


Bring your world class expertise into play

You are fluent in English both in writing and verbal at a professional level. Danish is an advantage but not a requirement


We are looking for an Intern studying at the Bachelor’s or Master’s level within Business Intelligence, Data Science, Finance, or a similar field of study
Familiarity with BI tools such as MS Power BI, SQL, or DAX is a plus


As a person, you bring a positive, can-do attitude and you thrive on turning theory into action. You are self-driven, detail-oriented, and not afraid to juggle multiple tasks at once. Collaboration comes naturally to you, and you take pride in delivering high-quality work on time.

The key points to success in our team are to show commitment, work with passion both in groups and independently, have an outgoing and proactive personality, curiosity, and show initiative in the daily work. You solve your tasks within set deadlines and with a strong focus on quality and detail, of course in close cooperation with your colleagues. You work in a structured manner, make things happen, and identify and deal with issues proactively. You are a good communicator and understand the importance of cross-functional cooperation.

We are an international company representing world class expertise, delivering complex and high-tech products. We value our colleagues and our meaningful contributions to securing people through advanced technology. You will also experience that we have a strong focus on your development, teaching you useful new competences and further strengthening current ones, both professionally and personally. Our company culture is autonomous and engaging, and we acknowledge the importance of flexibility in a great working environment.

When joining Terma, we promise that you will experience: Great people, challenging tasks, world-class expertise, and meaningful contribution in your daily work.

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

We encourage all individuals to apply for our job openings, as we are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, inclusive, and welcoming workplace. Our commitment to these DEIB principles means we value and celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of each team member. We strive to ensure that every employee has equal opportunities to succeed, feels respected and valued, and experiences a strong sense of belonging within our organization.

We encourage you to leave out photo, age, and name.

If you would like to take on the challenge of working in an innovative company, we look forward to receiving your application. A resume is required, while a cover letter is optional. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com. Applications will be processed continuously.

Do you have any questions regarding the position?

Feel free to contact Hiring Manager on this e-mail: osp@terma.com

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Bear In Mind That Both Candidates And The Candidate’s Adult Household Members, For This Position Must Be Able To Obtain a Security Clearance By The Danish Defense Intelligence Service. This Entails Among Other Issues


Full household as a minimum have stayed within NATO/EU countries for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad, and
None of the full household have committed serious criminal offences.


Terma group has headquarters in Denmark and is a high-tech company developing products and systems for defense and non-defense security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry. TERMA | Allies in innovation.

The high-tech and innovative Terma Group develops products and systems for defense, non-defense and security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft and vessels, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry.

Headquartered in Aarhus, Denmark, Terma has subsidiaries and operations across Europe, in the Middle East, in Asia Pacific as well as a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary, Terma Inc., with offices in Washington D.C., Georgia and Texas.

Application Deadline

Ongoing

Title: Reporting Assistant (Interim Staff)
Description:
NTU International is a leading international consulting firm providing programme management and advisory services for development projects worldwide. For almost three decades, NTU has been delivering sustainable development projects and advisory services within engineering, policy, economics, and social fields.




We are currently compiling a pool of qualified professionals interested in the role of (Interim) Reporting Assistant to potentially support Frontex, an EU Institution based in Poland and a prospective client of NTU. Please note that this announcement does not represent a confirmed job offer. However, if NTU is awarded the tender procedure, individuals from the pool whose profiles align with the specific needs of the project will be contacted for potential engagement.




About the Position:

An esteemed EU institution is seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Reporting Assistant to provide temporary support in data analysis and statistical reporting. The selected candidate will assist in transforming data into clear, insightful reports to support decision-making processes within a dynamic, multicultural environment.




Key Responsibilities:

• Complete and oversee a variety of assignments involving the systematic collection, compilation, and interpretation of numerical data.

• Produce charts, tables, and graphs to visually represent statistical analysis.

• Prepare comprehensive statistical reports, including the interpretation of data sets.

• Assist in evaluating and interpreting research results.

• Develop sampling techniques and processes that are easy to analyze and interpret.




Requirements:

• Experience in data collection, statistical analysis, or reporting, preferably within an EU institution or public sector organization.

• Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and data visualization tools.

• Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail and accuracy.

• Ability to present data in a clear and accessible format for diverse audiences.

• Knowledge of statistical methods and techniques.

• Good written and verbal communication skills.

• Knowledge of EU working procedures and languages (English required, other EU languages are an asset).




What We Offer:

• A dynamic and multicultural work environment.

• Competitive remuneration based on experience and EU guidelines.

• Opportunity to gain experience within an EU institution.

We encourage applications from qualified individuals of all backgrounds.




Other information:

If you are interested in this position, please apply via LinkedIn and we will include you in the pool of interested candidates. When we have a job that fits your profile, we will contact you directly.




Only selected candidates will be contacted.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Nabla Technologies er en mindre energy trading virksomhed beliggende midt i Aarhus. Vi specialiserer os i modelbaseret og automatiseret kortsigtet energy trading på de fleste amerikanske energimarkeder.




Vi søger en dygtig Quantitative Analyst, der kan blive en del af vores team og bidrage til den fortsatte udvikling af vores modelleringssetup. Som Quantitative Analyst vil du arbejde med alle faser af udviklingen af automatiserede handelsmodeller – fra feature engineering og design af deep learning-modeller til udarbejdelse af budstrategier og meget mere.




Dine kvalifikationer

Uddannelse inden for Data Science, Datalogi, Matematik, Statistik, Økonomi, Ingeniørvidenskab eller lignende.
Erfaring med modellering i PyTorch, TensorFlow og/eller JAX.
Gerne forståelse for finansielle markeder og erfaring med finansiel modellering.
Evne til at arbejde selvstændigt.




Om os

Nabla Technologies blev etableret i slutningen af 2021 og fokuserer på kortsigtet energy trading på de fleste amerikanske energimarkeder. Vores team består af specialister med stærke baggrunde inden for økonomi, statistik og datalogi. Vi opererer udelukkende med automatiserede tradingsystemer uden manuelle tradere.




Hos Nabla Technologies værdsætter vi personlig frihed og en sund work-life balance højt. Vi tilbyder fleksible arbejdstider og dyrker en positiv og afslappet atmosfære. Trods vores beskedne størrelse har vi opnået betydelige resultater.




Alle medarbejdere hos Nabla Technologies får fra starten et stort ansvar og gode muligheder for personlig og faglig udvikling. Vores arbejdsmiljø giver medarbejdere friheden til selv at strukturere deres arbejdstid på den måde, der bedst passer deres individuelle behov og kalender.




Vi har ikke ambitioner om at vokse til en stor organisation, men foretrækker at bevare en mindre og højkompetent gruppe af medarbejdere. Denne struktur holder os agile, innovative og tæt forbundne. Vi sætter stor pris på hver enkelt medarbejders ekspertise og arbejder kontinuerligt sammen om at forbedre vores teknologi og processer. Vores ambition er at være på forkant inden for automatiseret energy trading, samtidig med at vi nyder godt af et samarbejdende, støttende og inspirerende arbejdsmiljø.




Praktiske oplysninger

Startdato: Hurtigst muligt
Lokation: Fysisk på vores kontor i Aarhus eller delvist remote
Kompensation: Konkurrencedygtig løn med mulighed for bonus og/eller medarbejderaktier
Arbejdstider: Fleksible, men primært inden for normale kontortider.




Kontakt os

Hvis du mener, at du er et godt match til denne stilling, bedes du sende din ansøgning, CV, samt karakterblad hvis du har under to års erfaring, til thomas@nablatech.net. Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig. Undlad venligst at ansøge via "Easy Apply" på LinkedIn, da disse ansøgninger ikke vil blive taget i betragtning.




Hvis du har spørgsmål, er du også velkommen til at kontakte Thomas Hoffmann Nielsen på thomas@nablatech.net.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer (Student Assistant)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Management PrimeServ DK

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Student Assistant Data Engineer to join our Data Management department. This role offers an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data engineering, working with cutting-edge technologies and contributing to the development of our data infrastructure.

As a Student Assistant Data Engineer, you will support the team in managing and optimizing our data systems, ensuring data quality, and developing data pipelines. You will work closely with experienced data engineers and analysts to deliver high-quality data solutions.

You Will Play An Important Role In


Assisting in the design, development, and maintenance of data pipelines (ETL/ELT processes) using Azure services.
Writing and optimizing SQL queries for data extraction and transformation.
Supporting data modeling efforts to ensure data is structured effectively for analysis.
Implementing data quality checks and monitoring data integrity.
Developing and deploying machine learning and AI models in the cloud.
Collaborating with stakeholders to gather data requirements and deliver data solutions.
Assisting in the development and maintenance data products documentation.
Conducting research and staying updated on the latest data engineering, AI, and cloud development trends and technologies.
Providing support in data visualization and reporting tasks.


We Imagine That You


Are currently enrolled in a university program (preferably in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, or a related field that includes Business Analytics or AI).
Have a basic understanding of core data concepts, including data types, quality, governance, and security.
Have had an introduction to SQL and have touched upon concepts such as data modeling and pipelines.
Have some experience with programming languages such as Python.
Have an interest in AI and machine learning, with some knowledge of basic ML concepts.
Are familiar with data tools (e.g., Power BI or Excel) and can create basic reports and dashboards.
Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Are able to work independently and as part of a team.
Have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Are fluent in English.


Benefits


Gain hands-on experience in data engineering and data management.
Help solve real business problems using ML or AI models.
Work in a dynamic and supportive environment.
Flexible working hours to accommodate your academic schedule.
Opportunity to contribute to significant data and AI projects and make an impact.


Welcome to Data Management in PrimeServ DK

Our department is dedicated to managing and optimizing the organization's data assets. We work collaboratively to ensure data quality, develop data solutions, and support data-driven decision-making across the organization. Our team values innovation, continuous learning, and teamwork.

Unleash your potential: Join us towards a carbon-neutral future

We offer you an opportunity to help shape the world of tomorrow – whether you are just starting out, taking your first career steps after graduation, or looking for the next big career challenge.

At MAN Energy Solutions, we focus on diversity and equality to create a creative and inclusive culture. We believe that a diverse workforce with a mix of gender, nationalities, and perspectives will drive innovation, creativity and productivity. We are committed to our employees’ well-being, and you will have the opportunity to join different social activities from yoga and fishing to creative clubs.

We prioritize work-life balance, offering flexible working hours, the possibility of working from home, and mental well-being including health insurance and focus on work atmosphere. Here you have opportunities for growth, development, and mentorship.

In 2027, MAN Energy Solutions will move to Trekroner in Roskilde. Here we will consolidate all our current locations on Zealand into one large site.

About The Student Network

The MAN Student Network is a community made for students by students at MAN Energy Solutions Denmark. The network has the purpose of connecting students in Denmark with the benefit of establishing strong academic and social relationships across group departments, but also as an opportunity to expand the academic network, which ultimately may prove to provide the first full scale step toward a future career at MAN Energy Solutions.

The students within the network have the opportunity to provide recommendations and improvements and actively affect the concept of this network.

About MAN Energy Solutions


250 years of experience in advanced engineering
We deliver a unique portfolio of technologies and opportunities in the development of engines for use on ships and in power plants across the globe
We operate under the motto "Future in The Making" as it reflects our dedication to developing sustainable solutions and actively contributing to a carbon-neutral economy
We have over 15,000 employees worldwide. In Denmark, we are more than 2,500 passionate employees from over 55 nationalities


Build your own future

Please submit your application to us no later than Wednesday, the 30th of April, 2025. We will conduct interviews during the application period. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Francisco Moreano Lasso by phone (+45) 81 75 80 58. More information about the company can be found at www.man-es.com .

In MAN Energy Solutions, we strive for an inclusive and fair recruitment process for our job applicants based on equity. We encourage all qualified candidates, regardless of gender, age, religion, disability and ethnic background to apply for this position. Therefore, please refrain from attaching a photo to your CV or cover letter. Furthermore, assistive tools will be available when needed, for example for dyslexia.

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Lead & Shape the Future of Marketing Analytics at Lunar!

At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus and Stockholm 🚀

So who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both, breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.

As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Senior Marketing Data Analyst to lead and develop our marketing analytics function. This is a pivotal role where you will take full ownership of our marketing data strategy, driving advanced analytics and automation to optimize marketing ROI and scale our growth across the Nordics.

Be in the Driver’s Seat

As our new Senior Marketing Data Analyst, you won’t just be working with data—you will be shaping and evolving the way we leverage data across marketing. You will set the vision for how we use analytics to fuel our marketing efforts, establish best practices, and build a function that delivers high-impact insights and measurable business outcomes.

You’ll be based in Copenhagen, embedded within our Audience and Acquisition team, reporting to Sally Armstrong. The team currently comprises 5 amazing individuals focused on leveraging data-driven insights to fuel customer acquisition and engagement within the broader Marketing function, led by Manuel Douchez. But you’ll be the one steering the marketing analytics ship - driving strategy, developing methodologies, and making sure data is at the heart of every decision we make.

What Will You Do?

Set and drive the strategy for marketing analytics, defining how we measure and optimize marketing effectiveness.

Establish and implement best practices for data analysis, reporting, and visualization, ensuring marketing performance is continuously improved.

Lead and innovate in advanced attribution modeling, leveraging machine learning, MMM (Marketing Mix Modeling), and Bayesian techniques to optimize marketing investments.

Develop and champion best-in-class marketing measurement methodologies, ensuring data integrity and actionable insights.

Take ownership of incrementality testing and media experimentation to enhance ROI and inform strategic decision-making.

Collaborate cross-functionally with data teams in Commercial, Product, and Finance to ensure alignment in methodologies, shared learnings, and commercial impact.

Act as the key strategic partner for marketing leadership, providing data-driven recommendations that shape our marketing approach.

Automate marketing analytics processes, leveraging AI and cutting-edge tools to enhance efficiency and insight generation.

Serve as the go-to expert for marketing data, ensuring all marketing initiatives align with broader business intelligence efforts.

Curious About the Lunar Culture? 💚

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.

Is This You? Let’s Find Out!

We’re looking for someone who is eager to take ownership, build something incredible, and truly shape the future of marketing analytics at Lunar. If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you!

Proven experience in a marketing data analytics or business intelligence role, ideally with a strong commercial focus.

Expertise in advanced attribution models, including MMM, machine learning, Bayesian techniques, and media mix modeling.

Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools.

Experience with Looker, Funnel.io, dbt, AWS, Redshift, Airflow, Git, or similar technologies.

Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and executive-level reporting.

A passion for automation, AI-driven analytics, and streamlining marketing data processes.

Experience working cross-functionally, ensuring data-driven marketing decisions are aligned with commercial goals.

Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.

Experience in high-volume, complex data environments such as fintech, banking, or large-scale consumer technology companies.

Are You Ready to Build the Future?

Apply now and let’s explore how you can take Lunar’s marketing analytics to the next level!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰

Depending on the regulations in the country you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.
